loans.name: Tchamélé

texts.fr:
Cette  dame de  trente huit ans vit dans le quartier d’adidogomé à Lomé la capitale du Togo, elle est une revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle exerce ce son commerce depuis 2004 et elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce premier crédit  pour augmenter son stock de produits d’alimentation générale.
Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est un chef coutumier et ils ont ensemble  un enfant à charge .
texts.en:
Tchamélé E. is a 38-year-old woman living in the neighborhood of Adidogomé in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She sells groceries and has been running her business since 2004. This is her first loan request with WAGES, which she would like to use to increase her supply of general food products. She is married to a village chief and they have one child in their care.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase general food products

loans.name: Ay

texts.en:
Mrs. Ay P. is a villager in Phao Chu Kiet village, in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Reach Puk, are farmers who own three hectars and cultivate rice, to earn for living. 

They face a small problem on their farm. Their field has infertile soil, so Mrs. Ay P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to strengthen the field and make the crop more productive. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fuel for a pump to water the field. She is 58 years old and the mother of one child, who is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to strengthen the field to make the crops more productive.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina K. currently sells juice in the market and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Thirty-nine years old and married to an electrician, she has two children, both in school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa T. is 30 years old, married, and the mother of two. Her family lives in Uvurhangai province. Uvurhangai is a one of Mongolia's southern provinces, located 400 km from the capital city, Ulaanbaatar. Her eldest child goes to elementary school, and the youngest one goes to kindergarten.

After Bolormaa graduated from high school, she was taught by her mother how to cut hair. She then worked as a barber’s assistant in her mother's salon for 1 year. In 1998, she completed a short-term haircut training course. Following that course, she opened her own hairdressing salon and has been working independently for 10 years.

During the past 10 years, she has become very experienced and earned many repeat clients. Her business provides her family’s main source of income, and is important for improving her family’s living conditions. Bolormaa's husband runs a transport business using his own motorcycle. Bolormaa plans to use this loan to buy hair brushes, nets, sprays, and hair oil to sell and increase her business capital.

loans.use: Buy hair brushes, nets, sprays, and hair oil

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong S. is 23 years old and lives with her brother and mother in the Takeo province. She stays at home and weaves silk scarfs to earn a living. Every day, she is able to make US $5 of profit.

Her brother is a worker in the Ministry of Plantation, and he makes US $2 per day.

Kong S. is asking for a loan of US $400 to purchase silks to weave scarfs. (Kong S.,is on the left, pictured with her mother.)

loans.use: Purchase silks to weave scarfs.

loans.name: Marcely

texts.en:
Marcely has been managing a vegetable vending business for almost a year. She's planted different vegetables in her backyard, then sells to the public at harvest. Their main source of income is farming. Sometimes they also make tamarind candies for extra income.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to utilize for her vegetable business. She strives to be a good mother to her children, a good wife to her husband, and to become a successful businesswoman someday.

Marcely is doing her best to support her family and provide them with a better standard of living. Their children are: Rosielyn (29-years-old, a domestic helper); Ronnie (27-years-old, a farmer); Joker (25-years-old, a construction worker); and twins, Jeremy and Jerome (15-years-old, third year high school). They live in Barangay Tandul Cabatuan, Isabela.

loans.use: Investment in vegetable vending business

loans.name: Getzamani Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Getzamani esta ubicado en la zona sur de nuestro pais, un lugar caliente y muy bonito por su infraestructura, Choluteca es uno de los departamentos que tiene mucho moviemiento comercial, la gente que vive en esta ciudad se caracteriza por ser muy amable y hospitalaria.
los integrantes del grupo son:
Martha Dilia R., ella se dedica a la venta de empanadas, tamalitos y pisques, desde hace mucho tiempo, con esta actividad a logrado sacar adelante a su familia, ella es madre soltera tiene dos hijas, una de ellas ya esta casada y la otra esta en el colegio, en los tiempos libres le ayuda, ella viaja a la ciudad para comprar los platanos, frijoles, hoja de huerta, azucar, canela, aceite y maseca para poder preparar los tamalitos y las empanadas, ella vende su producto en su pueblo y en los caserios cercanos a el.
 Ritza E.: se dedica a la venta de verduras, tiene un pequeño puesto de ventas en su casa de habitacion, ella compra la verdura a carros que la traen de varios lados, ella tiene muchos clientes por su buena atencion que les brinda a los clientes, las verduras es un alimento que se consume mucho en nuestro pais, ademas de ser muy ricas contienen muchas vitaminas las cuales el cuerpo las necesita en el diario vivir, , ella tiene 3 hijos que estan en la escuela del pueblo. con el esfuerzo y el de su esposo han logrado sacar adelante su hogar y estan muy felices ya que todo les ha ido muy bien. el sueño de ella es llegar a tener un mercadito de verduras con muchas variedades y tambien vender frutas.
 Blanca L.: se dedica a la venta de tortillas, ella se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para preparar la masa y empezar a hacer las tortillas, ella tiene tres hijos los cuales estan en la escuela, ella compra el maiz y la leña para fabricar sus tortillas, ella las vende en diferentes pulperias y tambien en su casa de habitacion.
ellos necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante con sus negocios y familias, tienen la fe en Dios en que todo les va a salir muy bien de ahora en adelante.
texts.en:
The Gezamani group is located in the southern zone of their country. It is hot place with a beautiful infrastructure. Choluteca is one of the departments with a lot of commercial movement. The people who live in this city are characterized as being friendly and hospitable. The members of the group are: Martha Dilia R. has been selling empanadas, tamalitos or little tamales, and large tamales for a long time. This activity has allowed her family to get ahead. She is a single mother with two daughters. One of them is married. The other goes to school, and helps during her free time. Martha travels to the city to buy bananas, beans, vegetable leaves, sugar, cinnamon, oil and corn flour to be able to make her little tamales and empanadas. She sells her products in her town and in nearby areas. Ritza E. sells vegetables from a small stand in her home. She takes cars to buy the vegetables from different places. She has many customers because she gives them good attention. Lots of vegetables are eaten in her country. Besides being delicious, they have lots of vitamins that the body needs daily. She has 3 children who are in the town school. With her efforts and the efforts of her husband, they have been able to do well with their home, and they are happy that everything has gone very well for them. Her dream is to have a little vegetable market with lots of different vegetables and fruit. Blanca L. sells tortillas. She gets up at 4 in the morning to make the dough and start making the tortillas. She has three children who are in school. She buys the corn and the wood to make her tortillas. She sells them in different stores and from her home. They need a loan to be able to get ahead with their businesses and their families. They have faith in God that everything will turn out well from now on.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn flour, corn, meat, oil, butter, vegetables

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is a baker. She makes makes bread in the Cape Coast area and has done so since 2004. She is married and has four children: her husband is a driver.

Evelyn uses her income to pay for school fees and food for her family. She will use the loan to purchase flour, eggs, and margarine in bulk in order to prepare her bread goods for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Evelyn plans to be able to provide quality education for the children.

loans.use: To purchase flour, eggs, and margarine in bulk to prepare bread for sale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa trabaja en una imprenta como compaginadora, tiene un hijo que esta a su cargo en edad escolar.
Sus ingresos que tiene como compaginadora le ayudan para poder solventar los gastos de alimentación y educación de su hijo.
Vive en la zona de Villa Copacabana Sector Escobar Uria de La Paz en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de una computadora y así mejorar sus condiciones de estudios de su hijo.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva las ganas de superarse le dan la oportunidad de poder acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Rosa works in page makeup at a printer's shop. Her school age son is in her care. Her page-makeup income helps her to pay the expenses of feeding and educating her son. She lives in the Villa Copacabana area, Escobar Uria part of La Paz. This loan will be used to buy a computer and thereby give her son a valuable tool for studying. This is the second time that she is requesting a loan through IMPRO and the second time that she needs the help of KIVA. The desire to better herself gives her the opportunity to have access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a much-needed computer for her son.

loans.name: Tserendoljin

texts.en:
Tserendoljin G. lives with her husband in Arhangai, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Tserendoljin has a small butchery business, which she started in 2006. Her husband drives his truck to herder families from whom he purchases sheep, goats and cattle at discounted prices. They are slaughtered at their butchery shop for individual sale. When meat prices are high, they usually deliver the meat to the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. From the beginning, the business has been a success; Tserendoljin's business capital has increased from 200,000 MNT to 1,500,000 MNT.

As the biggest public celebration, Naadam, approaches in July, Tserendoljin and her husband plan to bring more livestock to Ulaanbaatar. Tserendoljin is requesting a loan to purchase more livestock to prepare for the Naadam celebration in the capital. In the future, she wants to move to the countryside and become a herder woman with some 500 livestock.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia M. makes a living primarily from selling bananas in her community. She is 46 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Kinuman Sur, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Lucresia has been operating her specialized retail store for over a year and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lucresia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lucresia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a food business

loans.name: Friah

texts.en:
Friah E. is from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 29 years old. Friah is single and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Friah owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling processed food products like dressed chicken and longganisa (sausages) to the local community. Friah has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 Phillipine pesos a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Friah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Friah is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Friah from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education and to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Juana Amelia

texts.es:
Juana es una madre soltera de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su hijo de 3 años de edad en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo y, eventualmente, a la venta de sábanas y enseres para el hogar, lo que percibe de estos pequeños negocios le sirve para cubrir los gastos de educación de su hijo y para ayudar a sus padres a solventar los gastos económicos diarios del hogar, ya que ellos son de edad avanzada y no pueden trabajar.

Ella desea crear un pequeño bazar en donde pueda vender los productos que usualmente ofrece de manera permanente, es por ello que ha solicitado a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de productos de belleza y contar con un stock regular de mercadería para ofrecer al público.

A Juana ya se le ha apoyado con un crédito anterior que ha cancelado puntualmente por lo que es considerada como una cliente responsable y confiable.
texts.en:
Juana is a single mother and is 41 years old. She lives with her 3-year-old son at her parents’ house which is located in the city of Ferreñafe, which is 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For one year she has sold cosmetics by catalog and eventually she began also selling sheets and household items. This small business helps her to cover the costs of education for her son and to help her parents cover the daily household economic expenses, since they are elderly and cannot work anymore. She desires to create a small store where she can sell the products that she usually offers in a more permanent way. It is for this reason that she has asked for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from our institution. She wants to use the loan to purchase beauty products and count on a regular stock of merchandise to offer to the public. Juana has already been supported with a previous loan that she repaid punctually and because of that she is considered to be a responsible and reliable client.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: William Xavier

texts.es: William Xavier M. tiene la edad de 31 años. Es un hombre casado y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Inicio hace mas de 3 años, el logro adquirir   la experiencia necesaria para obtener clientes, anteriormente laboraba como cobrador, pero debido a ciertos problemas que enfrento tuvo que renunciar y dedicarse a ofrecer ciertos productos y como no tenía el suficiente capital y un amigo le ayudo para que comprara más productos, y así fue como logra seguir con este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de calzado, pantalones, faldas, camisas, cremas y colonias. Su deseo es  ampliar su negocio para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
William Xavier M. is 31. He is a married man who is raising two children. He sells general merchandise. He started over three years ago. He gained the necessary experience to get customers. He previously worked as a collector, but due to certain problems he encountered, he had to resign. He started selling certain products. He did not have enough money, and a friend helped him so that he could buy more products. That is how he was able to continue with this business. The loan he is asking for is for working capital to buy footwear, pants, skirts, shirts, creams, and colognes. His wish is to expand his business in order to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda owns a small vegetable farm in their village in Namnama Flores Naguillan, Isabela.  She use to plant different vegetables in the in lot garden. Her harvested crop is being sold to buyers or sometimes, Ermelita sells it in retail price to her neighbors. Ermelinda would like to request for a loan amounting to PHP4, 000 to be use as additional business capital to her vegetable production and vending business. She will be using the amount in purchasing new breed of seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to grow and produce more fruits. The loan will be of big help in maintaining and growing her business shares Ermelinda. 


Ermelinda is already fifty-one years old and is married to a house carpenter in the person of Norberto A.. They are blessed with four children. Their youngest child is the only one left who is currently studying. She is now in high school and she hopes to pursue her studies until college. Ermelinda is hoping that someday, through her vegetable production their living situation will somehow become progressive.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch S. is 24; she is married and has two children. To earn a living, she sells a variety of flowers that she buys in bulk from her wholesale supplier. She sells to people who need flowers to decorate parties or ceremonies.  Her husband helps her sell flowers. She is taking out a loan to buy more flowers to  sell.

loans.use: To buy more flowers to sell

loans.name: Falilatu

texts.en: Falilatu is 49 years old and married with 3 children. She sells bunches of plantains in the market. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira (or about $350 US) to purchase more plantains to sell. She thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bunches of plantains to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of ingredients for her business

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou S. est une femme mariée, elle est âgée de 41 ans et mère de 8 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, vend du mil et de l'arachide. Elle participe au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Astou S. is a married woman.  She is 41 years old and the mother of 8 children.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH for 7½ years.  Her work involves fattening cattle and selling millet and peanuts.  She takes part in paying for her children's schooling costs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To keep up her commercial work

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is a 28-year-old married woman with two children. She has been working as a tailor since 1999 to earn additional income for her family. Today, Rima is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy tools and textiles to make a variety of products. She wants to become well known to attract clients.

loans.use: To buy tools and textiles

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 58-year-old married man living in Jdeidet Marj Oyoun, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and three kids. Youssef has owned a flower seeding farm and an egg-hatching machine since 2004. Youssef requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to start a new chicken business and support his farm. His customers are his friends, neighbors, relatives, tourists and neighboring dealers. Youssef hopes to expand more in the future by supporting his flower farm.

loans.use: To start a new chicken business and support his farm

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan A. de 53 años de edad, tiene una casa de cemento que esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, esta casado tiene 3 hijos uno de 17 años y los otros ya mayores de edad.

Juan por consejo de uno de sus hijos mayores invirtió en un taller de cerrajería ya que su hijo le enseñaría todo con respecto a cerrajería porque el trabajo en un taller de cerrajería, así poco a poco fue creciendo el negocio en conjunto con su hijo ahora Juan trabaja desde las 09h00 hasta las 17h00 vende de 10 a 15 puertas semanales una de las complicaciones es su salud y la competencia.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tubos, platillos, planchas para agrandar mas el negocio, en el futuro quiere crear una sucursal de cerrajería para su hijo.
texts.en:
Juan A., 53 years old, owns a concrete house located in Paraíso, Guayaquil. He is married and has three sons, one is 17 years old and the other two are already of legal age.

Following the advice of one of his older sons, Juan invested in an ironworks workshop. His son would teach him everything about ironworks, because he used to work in an ironworks shop himself. This way, the business grew little by little with his son's help. Now Juan works from 9 am to 5 pm and he sells about 10 to 15 doors every week. Some of the difficulties he faces are his health and the competition.

With the loan he wants to purchase tools to increase his business further, and in a future he wants to create an ironworks workshop branch for his son.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools

loans.name: Julievi's Group

texts.en:
Julievi B. is from the village of Biray in Ozamiz City. She is 22 years old. Julievi is the leader of a 2-member loan group sponsored by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Julievi is single. To make a living, Julievi makes and sells snacks, such as "puto" rice cakes and banana cue (deep-fried bananas covered with caramelized brown sugar) in the local community. Julievi has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Julievi joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julievi is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase the ingredients that she needs to make products to sell. This will be Julievi's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Mrs. Yon D. is 35 years old and lives in Daeum Pou village, Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own a 2.40-hectare (6-acre) field on which they cultivate rice.

On this farm they now face a problem because they lack financial resource to grow crops. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Yon D. is now requesting 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support the growing of crops.

Mrs. Yon D. is married with four children, three of whom are students in the public school while the youngest one is only a year old. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her rice field

loans.name: El Chilamate Group

texts.en:
The Chilamate Group includes Yahoska Rafaela Jirón Blandón, Eveling María Narváez Laínez and Elena de los Ángeles P. Mendoas.

Yahoska Rafaela Jirón Blandón is a woman entrepreneur who has worked very hard for the well being of her family.  For them, she began selling snacks, sodas, and juices, amongst other products.  Recently Yahoska has improved her business by turning it into a general store where even more products can be found including cosmetics, basic grains, sausages, meat, fruits, and vegetables.

Eveling María Narváez Laínez has been selling all types of products since 1995 including clothing, hair accessories, jewelry, and more. Elena de los Ángeles P. M. sells used clothing.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell in her store

loans.name: Mujeres Forjadoras Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “MUJERES FORJADORAS”, está conformada por 9 socias quienes se desempeñan en labores de comercio minorista e informal, trabajan con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desde hace 4 meses.
Vilia Mirtha emprendedora y entusiasta, actualmente asume el cargo de presidenta, tiene 46 años,  es separada y tiene 3 hijos de 17, 21 y 27 años.
Desde hace 23 años se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir  y cosméticos sobre pedidos, se inicio en este negocio porque sentía la necesidad de apoyar a su familia económicamente y además para realizarse como persona. Con el ingreso de su negocio y el apoyo de su ex esposo e hijos ha logrado construir su casa, ha solventado la  educación de sus hijos y se ha realizado como mujer y madre.
Con el reciente préstamo, las socias de la alcancía comunal  lo utilizaran en la compra de mercadería y diversidad de artículos  para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes en esta campaña escolar. Agradecen el financiamiento para sus actividades comerciales y seguirán cumpliendo con sus pagos puntualmente.
texts.en:
The communal bank MUJERES FORJADORAS is formed by 9 members who work in minor and informal commerce. They have worked with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for 4 months. Vilia Mirtha is an enterprising and enthusiastic woman who assumes the role of president. She is 46, is separated and has 3 children - 17, 21 and 27 years old. For 23 years she has work selling clothing and cosmetics by catalogue. She began this business because she felt the need to economically support her family and to fulfill her potential. With the earnings of her business and the support of her ex-husband and children she has achieved the construction of her house, has paid for her children's education and has fulfilled her potential as a woman and mother. The members will use this loan to purchase inventory and a diversity of articles to cover the demand of their clients during the school campaign time. They are thankful for the finance for their activities and will continue meeting their repayments punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Juan Alejandro

texts.es:
Este Sr. Se llama Juan Alejandro V., es soltero y sin hijos y con una carga familiar de su mamá y dos sobrinos los cuales están en edad escolar. 
Juan Alejandro hace 20 años se dedicaba a vender lotería en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa, pero como ese negocio no le dejaba muchas ganancias decidió ahorrar para poner una venta en su casa de habitación que es en el reparto Carlos Fonseca Nº 1, actualmente se dedica al comercio, tiene una pulpería desde hace 4 años, y lleva por nombre ¨ Pulpería Juancito¨ donde vende granos básicos, Pollo, Carnes, Huevos, Enlatados, Gaseosas de todos los sabores.
Ceprodel le ha financiado 5 créditos  desde el año 2007, y todos han sido para invertir más en el negocio y en esta ocasión quiere comprar un Freezer para meter todo lo que es carne, pollo y lácteos.
texts.en:
This is Juan. He is single and has no children, but he supports his mother and two school-aged nephews. He’d been selling lottery tickets in the Chichigalpa market for the past 20 years, but this didn’t provide much of an income, so four years ago he decided to save his money and start and run a general store out of his home. He calls it “Pulpería Juancito,” and he sells basic grains, poultry, meats, eggs, canned goods, and different flavors of soft drinks. CEPRODEL helped him to obtain five loans in the 2007, all to invest into his business. He will use the money from this loan to buy a freezer in which to store the meats, poultry, and milk products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Freezer

loans.name: Charif

texts.en:
Charif is a 58-year-old married man with two dependent children. When he graduated from university 38 years ago, he started giving private lessons to the children in his town and its surroundings. In addition, he's also talented and writes poems. He’s a very brilliant man who likes his job a lot and he feels that he is blessed to have such talent. 

Today, Charif is asking to borrow $1,000 to be able to print his poems in a special poetry book in his name. It will present the collection of his written work over the years and he's very excited to publish it with the help of the loan.

loans.use: Print his poems in a special poetry book

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Marcos Antonio F. P., es  casado y habita en el Barrio Medardo Andino, tiene 3 hijos y el mayor de 18 años, trabaja y apoya en los gastos del hogar, los dos menores dependen económicamente de la cabeza familiar.

Ellos se dedican a la carpintería y tienen su taller y uno de los principales problemas que los agobian, es la falta de materiales y maquinaria para realizar las ofertas de trabajo que se le presentan, él comenzó con el taller, gracias a su esfuerzo propio y su ahorro diario de años atrás, a futuro comprara un torno, que mejore y agilice las labores, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo,  para la compra de un mayor inventario de madera que pueda aumentarle las ventas y favorezca su economía  doméstica.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcos Antonio F. P. is married and lives in the district of Medardo Andino. He has three children, the oldest of whom is 18 and works and helps support the household expenses. The two younger children are financially dependent upon the head of the family. Marcos and his son devote themselves to carpentry and have their own workshop. One of the main problems that hold them back are the lack of materials and machinery to carry out the offers of work they are presented with. Marcos started his workshop through his own effort and his long-term savings. He would like to buy a lathe, which would improve and speed up the work, and is the reason he asks for a loan, as well as for the purchase of a larger wood supply, which will increase his sales and improve his household finances.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick Clarke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material for his business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 54 year-old married man and father of 9 children. He has been working as a home painter, on a freelance basis, upon the request of the clients. He works hard to satisfy the demands of his job in order to pay his daily expenses and provide a better living for his family.

Mohamad is a very dynamic man who does his best and works hard to improve his financial situation and sustain his family. The challenge he faces in his work is the competition since there are a lot of other home painters, but since he has good experience in his domain he does his best to increase his number of clients.

He is requesting a loan for the first time to purchase painting tools and paint. In the future he plans to keep on improving his work as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase painting tools and paint.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda P. is from the town of Banga. She is 57 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda has a business raising and selling "tilapia" (St. Peter's fish) to the market which she has done for over 15 years.

In January 2010, Rosalinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed and additional fish to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosalinda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and additional fish to sell

loans.name: Tamaraneh Traders Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesswomen in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 800,000, they will be able to add more stock to their business, make more sales, and make more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by feeding and clothing their children and sending them to school.

Adama T. is the leader of this group. She was born in a place called Mayboll, 38 years ago. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a medical practitioner and her children are attending schools – four in secondary schools and one in primary school.

Adama sells items like groundnuts (peanuts), beans and palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil) and has been doing this business for ten years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying wholesale more groundnuts, beans and palm-oil.

loans.use: To buy wholesale more groundnuts, beans and palm-oil

loans.name: Burentsog

texts.en:
Burentsog J. is 21 years old and lives with his mother in Hovd province in western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a house. Burentsog operates a retail meat business with the help of his mother in his town. He began his business in 1999 and after several years of operation, he has managed to establish himself in the business community. He has individual customers who buy his meat on a regular basis. 

Because of his business success, he has managed to increase his business working capital and is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of meat which he will use for his business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Sithan

texts.en: Mrs. Sithan P. is 53 years old and lives in a small village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has four children: one son and three daughters. Three of them are married and live outside the family home, and another one is a hair dresser. Her husband raises pigs at home. Sithan has been selling bread and meatballs in the local school since 2000 and also helps her husband raise pigs. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $500 to purchase pig food.

loans.use: To purchase pig food.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita Q. is from the village of Balzain west, Tuguegarao City. She is 49 years old. Teresita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el anexo Las Delicias del caserío Arbolsol, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito conformado por varios centros poblados considerados como zonas rurales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ovejas, ella cría ovejas en diversos ambientes cercanos a su domicilio, las alimenta con pastos naturales y cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor en el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. 

Hilda desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas animales para criarlos y venderlos, por este motivo ha solicitado a Nuestra Institución un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Hilda es una mujer tranquila y responsable, su tiempo transcurre en la realización de sus labores domésticas y en ayudar a su esposo con las labores agricolas. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Hilda, 28, is married and lives with her husband in Las Delicias, an annex of Arbolsol, a rural zone of Mórrope district which is made up of various rural population centers and is part of Lambayeque province and is located over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. She raises sheep in several plots near her house for sale. Se feeds them natural grasses and when they grow to a good developmental stage she sells them to merchants who frequent the area where she lives. This activity allows her to help her husband, who is a farmer, to support the family. Hilda wants to expand her business buying more animals to raise and sell. For this reason she has asked Our Institution for a 500 new sol loan to help her reach her goal. Hilda is a very calm and responsible woman. Her time is taken up in her domestic chores and in helping her husband with the farming. In the area where she lives her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a levelheaded, responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Kuuki Ole

texts.en:
Kuuki Ole N. is 26 years old, and he is married to Noomuyia N.. 

Kuuki is a farmer. He has been farming on his own piece of land for the last seven years.
  
He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his fourth loan. He is planning to spend 20,000 KES buying chemicals and fertilizers for tomatoes that he has already planted, and 20,000 KES to prepare land to plant more tomatoes. His area has favorable climatic conditions for tomato farming, thus keeping him focused on farming only. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm and plough a bigger piece of land to increase tomato production.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer in vegetable farming and also start fruit farming. He also hopes that one day he will own some farm machinery to make his farming more efficient and economical.

He is a hardworking man and with the right resources he can do great.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizers, and prepare land to plant more tomatoes

loans.name: Vina

texts.en:
Vina N. is from the village of Salucong. She is 49 years old. Vina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Vina owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Vina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Vina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Vina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Vina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 25 years old and married with a three-year-old child.  She runs Esther’s Boutique to earn a living.  She has engaged in the business for two years.  She says that she gets a number of customers everyday.  

She is a member of Faulu Kenya under Embakasi Upendo group.  Through the group, she has been able to save her money.  She hopes to have a wholesale shop in the future.  

She has requested 25,000 KES to add to her stock of clothes and cosmetics. She believes that with additional stock, she will attract more customers.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van N., 64, lives with her husband in the Kampong Chhnang province. She works in a grocery store, typically making $5 each day. Her husband stays at home to help his wife sell grocery items. Van N. is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike to transport groceries from the market to sell at home.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Digna Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

La señora Digna tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 1 año, dice que todavía está en su luna de miel, todavía no han  tenido hijos porque quieren estabilizarse para darle lo mejor a su hijo que pronto quieren tener. Su marido trabaja en el Camal Municipal.

Se dedica al comercio desde hace dos años, vende frutas y verduras,  tiene un puesto  en el mercado municipal, trabaja desde las 7 am hasta las 17h00, nos cuenta que su papá tenía este negocio pero lo dejo a su cargo porque él se fue a otra ciudad. Sus productos los compra en el propio mercado a comerciantes al por mayor o a agricultores que llevan sus productos a vender.

Este crédito es para comprar más frutas y legumbres y así tener bien surtido su puesto. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya tres ciclos y le gusta por las facilidades de pago. Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya donde viven es arrendado.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Ilusiones” (Illusions) meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of El Progresso in the city of Portoviejo. This marginalized urban area is the most populated section of the city and known for being the location of the Portoviejo Women’s Prison.

Sra. Digna is 20 years old and has been in a common law marriage for one year. She says she is still on her honeymoon. Digna and her husband still do not have children because they want to be stable so that they can provide the best for their child which they hope to have soon. Her husband works at the municipal slaughterhouse.

Digna has been selling fruits and vegetables for two years. She has a stand at the municipal market where she works from 7am to 5pm. Digna says her father started this business but left her in charge because he moved to another city. She buys her merchandise from wholesalers and farmers who bring their produce to the market.

This loan will be used to buy more fruits and legumes so that her vending post will be well-stocked. Digna has participated in three loan cycles with her Communal Bank and enjoys the convenience of the payments. Her dream is to own a house since she currently lives in a rental property.

loans.use: Purchase fruits & legumes

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S., 63, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for a Pre-Angkorean temple. S. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of about 1 USD each per day. Three of her children are employed at the factories, earning an income of 3 USD each per day to help cover the family’s expenses. S. has to spend 66 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity and water supplies, and 60 USD on other necessary expenses every month.  S. is requesting a loan of 400 USD to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Buena Fe 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Yusleny is the coordinator of her group Buena Fe 1 & 2 (good Faith). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenges are selling her products on credit and collecting.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying doing business.

Yusleny is excited to be taking her 5th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 4 years, beginning with a small sum her husband gave her to start up the business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to purchase household and cosmetic products. She will use the profits to invest in the her business and some for her family expenses.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because "I feel great being part of this program and with the unit in my neighborhood," she said. Her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding L. Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and the tourist industry dominates the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity that can't be counted on.

loans.use: to buy household and cosmetic products

loans.name: Mercedes Isabel

texts.es:
Mercedes Gutiérrez  tiene 65 años  y se dedica a la venta D. queso al detal, ella es una mujer casada, madre D. 6 hijos en las edades D. 33 a 42 años,  que vive en el barrio Las Palmas, al sur D. Barranquilla. Su negocio  es la comercialización D. Queso, que inició en Concordia, un pueblo del departamento del Magdalena, hace aproximadamente 40 años, y terminó trasladándolo a la ciudad D. Barranquilla, donD. desarrolló esta actividad con éxito,  vendiendo entre empleados D. empresas y en diversas microempresas.        
Su credikiva es el sexto financiamiento que hace con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización a la que se encuentra vinculada desD. hace 5 años y con él comprará,  queso para  comercializarlo con las tiendas en el sector al por mayor,   y al detal   por libras   para el consumo D. los hogares D. sus clientes. Mercedes es una mujer que permanece muy contenta,  porque con su microempresa D. queso,  ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, y ha tenido éxito en cada decisión respecto a ella,  por eso es muy reconocida por vender el mejor queso; tanto es el posicionamiento D. su actividad, que a ella llegan   familias que viajan al exterior, y como conocen la calidad D. su producto le compran, para llevar cuando viajan fuera del país a familiares, que viven en los  Estados Unidos y en  Europa. En la actualidad Mercedes presenta una rotación D. sus productos cada 8 días, una rentabilidad sobre las ventas D. un 20%, la rentabilidad sobre su inversión es D. un 25% , la rentabilidad sobre su patrimonio es del  28% y así mismo posee una capacidad D. pago D. un  50%.
Su sueño es lograr terminar la segunda planta D. su vivienda, pues se encuentra en obra negra y desea separar el medio ambiente empresarial del familiar y también sueña con ampliar su negocio, hasta convertirlo en una gran empresa, para seguir apoyando a 3 nietos a los que Mercedes ama profundamente y están bajo su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Mercedes G. is 65 and makes a living selling cheese at the retail level. She is married and a mother of 6 children ages 33 to 42. She lives the Las Palmas neighborhood south of Barranquilla. She has a business selling cheese, which she started 40 yeas ago in Concordia (a town in the department of Magdalena), but then moved it to Barranquilla when she has been successful. She sells to large company employees as well as to a number of small businesses. 

Her  Kiva loan is her sixth with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with which she has worked with for 5 years. With her loan she will buy cheese to sell wholesale to local businesses as well as by the pound for domestic consumption. 

Mercedes is a optimistic woman because her small business has been able to get her family ahead. She has been successful with the decisions she has maD. in her business and she is well known for selling the best cheese. She is so well known that families traveling abroad will take cheese to relatives in the United States and Europe. 

Mercedes rotates her inventory every 8 days with a profit of 20% on products, a 25% profit on her investment, 28% profit on her assets and 50% ability to pay. Her dream is to expand her business into a larger company in order to help the 3 grandchildren  she loves deeply and is for which she is responsible.

loans.use: Buy cheese at wholesale

loans.name: María De Transito

texts.es:
María del Tránsito tiene 64 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo en el distrito D. Pueblo Nuevo, una zona que tiene a la mayor parte D. su población situada en áreas urbano marginales.  Se encuentra ubicada en la provincia D. Ferreñafe, a más D. veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su vivienda en donD. ofrece en venta a sus clientes diversos productos D. uso diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. Ella trata D. ofrecer productos D. buena calidad y brindar un trato amable. El negocio ya cuenta con tres años D. funcionamiento y durante todo este tiempo ha podido captar una clientela estable, la cual siempre acuD. a su establecimiento a adquirir los productos que necesitan.

María desea adquirir más productos para ampliar su bodega y poder satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta. Por ello ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que contribuyan al logro D. su objetivo.
texts.en:
María del Tránsito is 64 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in the district of Pueblo Nuevo, where most of the population lives in poorer urban areas. Pueblo Nuevo is located in the province of Ferreñafe, more than twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small store in her own home where she offers her clients a variety of everyday products, including staples and groceries. She tries to offer good quality products and proviD. a friendly service. The business has been operating for three years and during this time she has been able to attract a steady customer base, who always goes to her store purchase the products they need.

María wants to buy more products to expand her store and meet the current demand. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to Edpyme Alternativa that will contribute to her goal.

loans.use: Buy more products to expand her store and meet the current demand.

loans.name: Jose Eliseo

texts.es:
Don José, es un señor de 56 años de edad, su lugar de residencia es en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, ahí vive con su esposa, 5 hijos y un nieto, don  José se dedica a la crianza de pollos, este negocio consiste en comprar los pollos pequeños y alimentarlos por ocho semanas dándoles vitaminas, antibióticos y alimento para que crezcan y engorden en este periodo, luego se comercializan.
Don José necesita construir una galera para los pollos y solicita un préstamo para poder comprar los materiales como laminas, madera y maya, este crédito le ayudara a mejorar las instalaciones de la granja para que tengan un lugar amplio y puedan crecer en mejores condiciones.
La aspiración de él es conseguir que este negocio sea viable a largo plazo que le produzca ganancias mejores para su hogar.
texts.en: Don José is a 56 year old man who resides in San Francisco Gotera, in the Department of Morazán. He lives with his wife, 5 children and 1 grandson. Don José makes his living raising poultry. He buys young chicks and feeds them up over 8 weeks, giving them vitamins, antibiotics and food, so that they grow and fatten well, and then he sells them. Don José needs to build a hen-house, and is seeking a loan to be able to buy materials, such as metal sheeting and wood, for the project. This loan will help him improve the enclosures at his farm, so that the chickens have ample space and can grow up in better conditions. He aspires to continue with his business so that it is viable over the long term and generates better income for his household.

loans.use: To buy sheeting, wood and other materials to build farm enclosures.

loans.name: Lilybeth

texts.en:
Lilybeth S. is 33 years old and married. She supports her family by operating a used clothing business and a tricycle transport business. She lives in Maasin, Brookes Point, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her used clothing and tricycle transport businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000. 

Lilybeth is now borrowing PHP 17,000 so that she can continue to purchase more stocks of used clothes to sell. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lilybeth aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to join the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Reina Isabel D. tiene 43 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos que dependen de su matrimonio.
Doña Reina es una mujer muy comprometida con su familia, tiene 14 años de vivir en su casa ubicada en la colonia Morazan de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
 
Su negocio es una pulperia que esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion y en donde vende arroz, manteca, jugos, jabon, papel higienico, granos basicos, leche, refrescos, pollo y otros productos de consumo diario.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria para surtir mas su pulperia y asi tener mayores ganancias.
su meta o aspiracion es tener un minimercadito donde tenga muchos productos y muchos clientes.
Reina es una mujer muy alegre y carismatica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reina Isabel Díaz, 43, is married and has three children who depend on her and her husband.  Reina is very devoted to her family.  She’s lived in her house, located in San Lorenzo’s Morazán neighborhood, for 14 years.

Her business is a grocery store in her home where she sells rice, lard, juices, soap, toilet paper, basic grains, milk, soft drinks, chicken and other daily consumption items.

She will use the loan to buy groceries to stock her store thus having higher profits.   Her goal is to have a minimarket with lots of products and customers.  Reina is a very cheerful, charismatic woman.

loans.use: To buy milk, soap, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, cookies, beans, lard, oil, margarine, chili sauce, flour, soft drinks, tomato sauce, pasta, soups, juices, spices, toothpaste and toilet paper.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom A. is 29 years old and her husband, Mr. Sophal Pheap, is 28 years old.  They live in a village about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2005 and have two young daughters.  

Mom stays at home and takes care of her daughters. The main source of income for her family is her husband’s salary, who works as a driver for a company.

Mom is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to build a kitchen and a restroom for family use.

loans.use: To build a kitchen and a restroom for family use

loans.name: Chares

texts.en:
Chares V. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old. Chares is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Chares owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling green bananas & coconuts for copra in the local community. Chares has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Chares joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chares has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Chares is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas & coconuts to sell. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Chares from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas & coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sewing/tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional linens to sew for her sewing/tailoring business.

Gilda has been in this business for 10 years. Gilda earns additional income from fish vending.

Gilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dreams are to expand her business and have her house repaired in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional linens to sew

loans.name: Yucabeth

texts.en:
Yucabeth is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She has operated a bookshop business for the past three years, selling to her neighbours and passersby.

Yucabeth faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During holiday season the demand for products is lower compared to school-going season. She dreams of establishing two more branches in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase stationery, books, pens and pencils. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase stationery, books, pens and pencils.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora cecilia tiene la edad de 50 años, estudio hasta el tercer grado de primaria, y se encuntra casada con el señor Jose L. con el cual tiene dos hijos los cuales asisten ala universidad en tierra blanca, ella y su familia viven en la comunidad de Arroyo de pita En el estado de Oaxaca su comunidad se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varior kilometros que tiene bachillerato. 

doña cecilia nos platica que desde hace un poco mas de tres años decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que con sus hijos estudiando la carrera el dinero que su esposo gana no les alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos de su hogas, ella nos dice que vende refrescos y dulces desde su hogar con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad. 

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de refrescos, jugos y dulces para posteriormente venderlos. 

Doña cecilia espera en un futuro con sus ganancias ir agrandando su negocio y convertirlo en una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes, tambien nos mostro su agradecimiento para la fundacion por la confianza que le ha otorgado al brindarle este credito.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 50 years old and studied through the 3rd grade of elementary school. She is married to Jose L., with whom she has two children who attend college in Tierra Blanca. She and her family live in the community of Arroyo de Pita in the state of Oaxaca. Her community is characterized by being the only community in many kilometers that has a high school.

Cecilia tells as that she decided to start working in her own business a little more than three years ago. Since her children were studying in college, the money that her husband makes was not enough to cover the costs of their home. She tells us that she sells soft drinks and sweets from her home with her friends and neighbors from the community.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of soft drinks, juices and sweets to sell later on.

In the future, Cecilia hopes to continue expanding her business and turn it into a small grocery store. She also expressed her gratitude to the foundation for trusting her with this loan.

loans.use: to sell soft drinks and sweets

loans.name: Milagros Ii Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio San Miguel de Encarnación surgió mediante el contacto de la señora Graciela G. con la Fundación Paraguaya, y a partir de allí comenzaron a trabajar en conjunto. El grupo está integrado por 12 personas.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Rosa R., ella es madre soltera tiene cuatro hijos y tiene un almacén, donde vende comestibles en su comunidad.
La señora Rosa solicita este crédito que lo utilizará para la compra de mercaderías como panificados, lácteos, cereales, frutas y verduras, pues si lo recibe podrá mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Todas las integrantes del grupo son mujeres muy sacrificadas que desean la prosperidad de sus familias, pues ellas han sufrido mucho a causa de la pobreza en la que se encuentran y la mayor meta que poseen por ello es la de superarla, para que sus hijos sean personas con mayores oportunidades de un mejor vivir.
texts.en:
This group from Barrio San Miguel de Encarnación came about through contact between Graciela G. and Fundación Paraguaya.  From that, they began to work together.  The group consists of 12 members.

One of the members of the group is Rosa R..  She is a single mother with four children, and she has a store in her community where she sells foodstuffs.

Rosa is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise such as bread products, milk products, cereals, fruits, and vegetables.  If she receives the loan, she will be able to increase her sales and improve her family's quality of life.

All of the members of the group are very self-sacrificing women who want prosperity for their families, since they have suffered a great deal from the poverty in which they find themselves. Therefore, their greatest goal is to rise above it, so that their children may be people with greater opportunities for a better life.

loans.use: to purchase bread products, milk products, cereals, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Sohaila

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 43 years old, widowed and has three children, all of whom work. She lives with two family members.
Sohaila has worked as a tailor since 2000. She makes and repairs women's, men's and children’s clothing. She has good experience, a good reputation, and is well known in her area. She is requesting a loan of $1,800 to buy a generator and a sewing machine. She is aiming to earn more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a generator and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Guenier

texts.es: Guenier, tiene la edad de 22 años, está en unión libre y vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el dinero del crédito realizar la compra de abonos para la asistencia de su tiquizque. El cuenta con el terreno sembrado y lo que quiere es darle una buena asistencia para así obtener este año una buena producción obteniendo así ganancias. El quiere brindarle a su esposa una mejor calidad de vida en su futuro e irse asegurando su futuro económico. Es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Guenier is 22 years old and in a common-law marriage with his wife, who is his highest priority. He intends to the use the money from this loan to purchase compost for growing “tiquisque” (a starchy tuber grown in many tropical regions). Guenier has already planted crops on his land, so he wants to do a good job of maintaining them so that he can have good production this year and generate income. He wants to provide his wife a better quality of life and secure their financial future.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Guenier has not had any other loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase compost.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school. She owns a canteen near the school selling all types of snacks like chapattis, samosas, pancakes, biscuits and popcorn. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of wheat flour, cooking oil and baking flour. 

Gorret has been in this business for seven years and works six days a week.  Her business challenge includes ever increasing prices of commodities and the rainy season because she works in a muddy place. She aspires to see her business grow big and employ three girls. She lives in a two room rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses includes school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of  wheat flour, biscuits, popcorn and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rigoberto Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Rigoberto Antonio, es casado, tiene 24 años de edad, es graduado en mecánica, tiene 3 hijos 1 de ellos está estudiando, se dedica a la mecánica en general, reparación, mantenimiento de vehículos, inició este trabajo siendo auxiliar en otro negocio y al momento lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de una Pluma para levantar motores, ya que quiere contar con las herramientas  necesarias para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Espera ver su negocio bien posicionado y tener muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Rigoberto Antonio is married, 24 years old and has graduated from a mechanics training program. He has three children, one of whom is studying. He works in general mechanics, and fixing and maintaining vehicles. He started working as an assitant mechanic in another business and currently has six years of experience.

He is requesting a loan to buy a jack to lift cars, since he already has many of the tools necessary to bring quality services to his clients. He hopes to improve his business and have many clients.

loans.use: to buy a jack for his auto shop.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La Sra. Julia tiene 49 años de edad tiene casa propia  Zona 3 pasos al frente donde hace 20 años que se compro su casita, tiene 2 hijos y ella vive con el menor de sus hijos. La Señora hace 9 años que se compro su micro para darlo a trabajar en la línea  en la cual percibe su renta diaria, y también vende productos de una empresa muy conocida,  con eso se ayuda con los gasto de la familia. "el crédito que se le otorgo fue para realizarle mantenimiento en general a su micro" (compra de llantas, accesorios y otros), Doña Julia quedo muy agradecida con nuestra institución por la oportunidad que se le dio al otorgarle dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia is 49 years old and owns a home in District 3 that she purchased 20 years ago. She has two children and lives with the younger one.

Nine years ago, Sra. Julia purchased a microbus so that she could operate a route that generates a daily income. She also sells products from a well-known company to help with the family expenses.

The loan being provided will be used to pay for general maintenance of her microbus (purchase tires, accessories, and other items). Doña Julia is very grateful to Emprender for giving her the opportunity to receive this loan.

loans.use: to purchase tires, accessories, and pay for maintenance of her microbus.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
At 53, Rodrigo has maintained his hog-raising business for more than 10 years. He is married with three children who all attend school and his wife is a housekeeper. Rodrigo is able to pay the school fees for his children with the profit generated from his business. 

Rodrigo is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase feed for his hogs. In the future, he wants to maintain and expand his business and increase his income so that he can save money to support his children through university.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his hogs

loans.name: Shayirbubu's Group

texts.en:
Shayirbubu, 46, is the leader of this group. She is married and has three children, the youngest of whom is financially dependent on her. When she and her husband got married, they received some poultry, which they grew at home and used for the family’s consumption. Soon she turned it into a small profit-making business, selling poultry and eggs to the very first of her customers.

Now Shayirbubu breeds cattle as well as poultry and receives 6,500 KGS a month. This is quite enough to furnish the house and buy other conveniences.

With a loan of 80,000 KGS Shayirbubu plans to broaden and diversify her livestock breeding further. She will use the loan to buy additional livestock.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock.

loans.name: Frelly

texts.en:
Frelly is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Frelly has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Frelly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Frelly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 53-year-old married man and father of eight children. Ahmad is a hard working man who spent his whole life working hard to provide his family with secure and healthy living. Ahmad has worked in transportation for twenty years. He owns a bus that is specialized for transporting students from/to school. He is well known in the region, and most of his children help him transport students to provide him with special extra days off.

Ahmad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to do necessary maintenance to his bus to keep it in the best shape and service as it should be. He hopes to increase the number of buses he owns, by buying new modern ones and opening a special school bus company in the future.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to his bus

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with 10 children; three of whom attend school while seven have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 20 years, she has operated a water selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a charcoal selling business which contributes her other source of income. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transporting charcoal to her place of operation. Salama dreams of educating her children to higher levels of education. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is 52 years old and has been raising hogs for almost five years. She engaged herself in this business to generate income to provide a good education for her children. She has three children attending school. She usually earns about PHP 2,000 for each hog disposed. Profits go for her children's school fees and allowances.

Brigida has insufficient funds to sustain her hogs, so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, medicines and vitamins for the hogs. She wants to ensure good nutrition and proper growth of hogs.

She wants to continue growing as an entrepreneur and someday lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines and vitamins for the hogs.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en: Vanny, 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Vanny is a housewife and her husband is a soldier, earning an income of around $4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $33 on food and $10 on the other necessary expenses. Vanny is requesting a loan of $600 to pay for the children’s school fees. In the future, she would like to repair her house. This will be her first loan Kredit, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to pay for the children's school fees

loans.name: Santos Deojana

texts.es:
Santos es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesana.

Santos desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino (cuenta con 16 cabras) y ganado ovino (cuenta con 14 ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su familia.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado y realizar algunos arreglos en su corral, con los ingresos que adquiera por la venta puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Santos es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere y  mejorar económicamente para tener otras comodidades.
texts.en:
Santos is a 40-year-old mother who lives with her children in her own home.  The only service her home receives is electricity.  It is located in the rural area of Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  This area is noted for its farming, livestock raising and handicrafts.

Santos has been raising and selling goats (she has 16) and sheep (she has 14) for some years.  Her pens are located behind her home and they are both suitable and spacious.  She feeds her animals nutritionally-balanced feed and natural fodder so that they reach an optimal level of growth and she is able to sell them in the different markets in her area.  This makes her very good profits with which she is able to cover her family's daily expenses.

Santos has requested a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy nutritionally-balanced feed and make some repairs to her pens.  She will use the income that she makes from selling her animals to repay her loan and improve her family's quality of life.  Santos is a hard-working person and very responsible.
