The only thing she wants is for her family to do well and to improve her financial situation so that they can enjoy more comforts and conveniences.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed and to make some repairs to her pens

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es:
Ricardo vive con su esposa y un hijo, se dedica a la venta de medicina, este negocio lo inicio gracias a sus amigos que se dedican al mismo negocio, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio pero aun no tiene un horario establecido para atender a sus clientes.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de medicina para salir a venderla de forma ambulante,la inversion sera en vitaminas, analgesicos, antibioticos; esta compra le ayudara a ampliar el negocio y tener más ingresos en la familia.
La aspiracion de Ricardo es crecer en el negocio,  tener casa propia, darle el estudio a su hijo  y vivir feliz con su familia.
texts.en:
Ricardo lives with his wife and one son and devotes himself to medicine sales. He started this business thanks to his friends who are in the same  business. He has experience in this line of business but still lacks an established schedule by which to tend to his customers. 

He is seeking a loan to purchase medicine that he will go out and sell door-to-door. The investment will be in vitamins, analgesics, and antibiotics, a purchase which will help him expand the business and bring more income to the family. 

Ricardo's aspirations are to grow in the business, have his own home, provide an education to his son and live happily with his family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, analgesics and antibiotics.

loans.name: Namik

texts.en:
Namik is 42 years old and married. He owns and operates a milk production business and sells at a bazaar.
   
He has been involved in this business for 20 years. The income from the sale of milk helps him to improve his family's livelihood. His plans for the future are to increase the production of milk and his sales. With the loan he is requesting, he will purchase more cows. He hopes you will support him in his business goals.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Yang

texts.en:
Yang (pictured here) and her husband, Ly, live in a suburb about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They have been married since 1994 and have one son and two daughters. One is a garment worker and the other two are in school.  

Yang is a garment worker, while her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy a motorbike to get to work because she commutes to work by taking a taxi often. Taking a taxi to work is expensive for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to get work.

loans.name: Jeanry

texts.en:
Jeanry is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.
 
Jeanry has a shop that sells green bananas and coconuts for copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production). She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

Jeanry has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jeanry hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old.  She is married and has five children.

She operates a tree farm  selling seedlings and mature trees, she has been in business for three years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.  She is applying for her first loan of 20,000 KES.  A credit officer introduced her to KADET LTD.

She hopes to use the loan  to buy more seeds, in the future she hopes to buy a larger plot of land.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow seedlings and   sell.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen, 32, is divorced and has a son. She lives with her son in Ho Chi Minh City.

Yen supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She sells sugar, confectionery, soft drinks, yoghurt and other household items to people in her community. In addition, she runs public phone service. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products such as foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products such as food and beverages.

loans.name: One Word Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the One Word I Group from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. The members are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a new loan of 2,400,000.00 SLL for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

This is not the first loan that Mariama and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. The previous loan they received from Kiva lenders went a long way in helping these borrowers to increase their business inventories. Having done repaying that loan successfully, they are again requesting for a new loan in order to further expand their businesses. With her share of this loan, featured leader Mariama will buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Sorphorn

texts.en: Sorphorn, a mother of six children, is 33 years old and a resident from Battambang province. Nowadays she is a rice farmer and she also raises cows to increase her income. Now she is in need of working capital to support her business. Therefore, she forms a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for the cost of plowing and to buy rice seed for her farmland. She hopes that she can replant her cash-crop in a timely manner so as to gain a high income.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of plowing and to buy rice seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 46 years old, married with six children. Two of whom are in school.

Mary Jean is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Jean requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets and feeds.

Mary Jean has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Jean  would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia was born in 1955 in Kiambu, Kenya. She is married and a mother of three children, two of whom are in college, the other is still in primary school. She is the group treasurer of WEEC, and since joining the group in 2003 she has executed her duties as treasurer diligently and responsibly. Cecilia is due to complete her first loan of USD735 this month. Together with her husband, she used this loan to open a pub and guesthouse at Kanunga in 1995. Her business has allowed her and her husband to raise and educate their children. Cecilia is very good at marketing, and she has been able to interact with many people while also converting them into customers. She knows how to handle all types of people and she treats them with dignity and respect, attracting many to come back time and again to her pub and guest house. With the loan of USD 450, Cecilia intends to buy more drinks to cater to her growing number of customers. She is willing to repay her loan on monthly basis.

loans.use: Cecilia would like to buy more crates of wine, beer and spirits.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman lives with his wife and daughter in Berdansk, a city on the Sea of Azov. He runs a small business selling automotive lighting systems and accessories. He has been in this business for six years and has been quite successful. Currently, Roman has about $6,000 of working capital. His monthly gross revenue amounts to $3,000. Roman is a very polite and affable businessman. His kiosk offers a variety of exclusive, good-quality inventory. Exceptional prices and a willingness to make sure that his customer’s needs are met help him stay competitive and maintain repeat clientele. A nice, convenient location for his business also adds to the success of his trade. Roman is requesting a loan of $1,000 to remodel his vending pavilion and purchase some additional inventory. He is planning to buy some new shelves and stands, paint and insulate the walls of his pavilion and purchase assorted headlights for further retail sale. He believes that financial assistance in combination with his hard work and perseverance will contribute much to the successful growth and increased profitability of his business.

Роман з дружиною та дочкою живе в м. Бердянськ, що знаходиться на березі Азовського моря. Роман торгує автомобільною оптикою та аксесуарами. Він займається цим бізнесом вже шість років, досяг неабиякого успіху. Зараз, в Романа приблизно 6000 доларів робочого капіталу. Його щомісячний дохід складає приблизно 3000 доларів. Роман - дуже ввічливий та привітний бізнесмен. В його кіоску завжди широкий асортимент ексклюзивних, якісних товарів. Виняткові ціни та намагання допомогти покупцеві допомагають Роману залишатися конкурентноспроможним та зберігати постійних клієнтів. Зручне розташування бізнесу також сприяє успіху його бізнесу. Роман просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб зробити ремонт у своєму торгову павільйоні та закупити більше товару. Він планує придбати нові полиці та стенди, покрасити та утеплити стіни павільйону, розширити асортимент фар для подальшого роздрібного продажу. Роман вважає, що фінансова підтримка у поєднанні з наполегливою працею сприятимуть успішному розвитку його бізнесу та підвищать його рентабельність.

loans.use: To do remodeling in his vending facility

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy four young sheeps and goats

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
Catarina G. C. is a member of a group of women who all rent little plots of land to grow crops for a little bit of supplemental cash. Catarina has one of the largest plots, still small at 3 cuerdas, but many of the women have only a single cuerda. She rents her plot for about US$474/year, and grows onions and ornamental flowers like daisies and carnations. She'll invest this loan in seed, fertilizer, and pesticides. Her little business brings in only a part her income, so like the other women she has to work extensively in the fields of others to support her six children.

Catarina, 36, has kids aged 4 to 18.. Four of them are in school and she herself finished the second grade, so she can read and write, and speaks pretty good Spanish. (Day-to-day conversations are all in her native Quiché language.) She has her own house, with electricity and light. Her long-term dreams would be to buy a plot of her own and to build a better house. A single cuerda of land would cost more than US$1000, which will require a significant reinvestment of profit down the line.

Women's group: "De la Cruz" in La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for flower crop

location.town: La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en: I am a poor woman with six children; we have a family business making paper envelopes.  We get the raw material (paper) from the nearby paper market and sell the finished goods to various other markets. All my children assist me in this business except the youngest one and my husband. My husband works as a salesman at a spare parts shop with a very little pay. I never had enough resources to educate my kids, and so they were deprived of their basic human right, but now I wish to educate my youngest one. I would like to borrow $425 so that we can purchase more raw materials to produce more envelopes.

loans.use: Want to purchase sufficient quantity of raw materials

loans.name: Ani

texts.en: Ani is 30 years old and married. She sells candied fruit and is in business with her husband. They earn about $13 per day. Ani would like a loan of $75 (IDR 500,000) to buy more goods and increase the income for her children's education. She's a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en: Shavkat A. started the  trade of alcohol drinks after graduating secondary school in 2003. Before that he worked in a  shop selling  for over 3 years. His salary was 30% of his sales in month.His salary was only one income in his family because his parents were old and could not earn enough money for all the family needs.Today he has his own shop in the  Istaravshan region,Tajikistan.He gets stable profit and his experience has  helped him to attract more new clients. Also his younger  brother helps him at his shop. Shavkat tries teach his brother  all the skills of being an excellent seller which he has learned from experience.From KIVA he is requesting  extra capital to increase the volume of goods before the holiday,as his products will be in high demand.

loans.use: Purchase a large batch of alcohol drinks before holiday.

loans.name: Mirzohabib

texts.en:
Mirzohabib is 34 years old. Mirzohabib and his wife, who is a nurse, are raising three children. All three go to school and Mirzohabib and his wife dream of their children attending college.

In order to support the family and to ensure a better future for the kids, Mirzohabib runs his own business. He has a small shop that repairs electrical equipment like, electrical cattle irons, electrical ovens, vacuum cleaners and heaters. He also sells electrical equipment. He is a good repairman and chooses high-quality equipment at attractive prices for his clients. Mirzohabib’s business is very stable and provides significant support for his family.

Mirzohabib has been working with IMON for about 2 years. He has been able to repay all his loans timely and precisely. Today, Mirzohabib requests $500.00 USD for 9 months. He is planning to purchase spare parts and the diagnostic devices for the repair of electrical equipment. Mirzohabib thanks all for their support.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and diagnostic devices to repair electrical equipment

loans.name: Claudia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Like many women, Claudia works to help her husband with household expenses. She works 12 hours a day, with only short breaks, as a textile operator at a factory in a free-trade zone, laboring to meet her employer's daily production targets. Her husband is a cab driver. Their humble house is in need of repairs. Specifically, they need to replace their zinc roof because some years ago, they bought used zinc panels for the roof and the rain and sun have damaged it, leaving it split. They're afraid for their children and the house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Como muchas mujeres la Señora Claudia G., para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar trabaja como operaria textil de una zona franca, trabajando 12 horas diarias, con un tiempo mínimo de descanso en una maquila con un numero de piezas a elaborar diariamente establecido por su empleador, su esposo trabaja como taxista. Su humilde vivienda necesita de una mejora y es la e cambiar el zinc del techo de su vivienda, ya que hace varios años habia comprado zinc usado y el sol y la lluvia lo dañaron, encontrandose rajado y teme por la seguridad de sus hijos y su casa

loans.use: Buy materials to repair roof of house.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is 28 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 8, 5, and 3 years old. Mwanahamisi is a cloth seller, a business she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

In the past,Mwanahamisi has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cothes for her business.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela is very creative and her artistic sensitivity is expressed in the beautiful embroidery that she develops every day with her wonderful hands in the comfort of her own home, because she also wants to take care of her 4 children. Her beautiful handiwork has resulted in the increased popularity of her work in a short period of time. She plans in the near future to make embroidery at a company level with the growth of her small shop. For some time she has been working with this goal in mind and is asking for a loan through this venue to acquire a larger quantity of cloth and embroidery yarn so that she does not have to interrupt her daily tasks.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Adela es muy creativa y su sensibilidad artística se plasma en los bellos bordados que cada día desarrolla con sus manos maravillosas en la comodidad de su hogar porque desea también estar al pendiente de sus 4 hijos. Sus bellos acabados han hecho que en poco tiempo se popularice sus servicios, tiene en mente dentro de poco dedicarse a la elaboración de bordados a nivel empresarial con la consolidación de su pequeño taller y precisamente con el propósito de alcanzar este objetivo viene trabajando desde hace mucho y en a través de este portal solicita un préstamo de dinero a fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de hilos y telas para no interrumpir su tarea diaria.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger quantity of embroidery yarn and cloth.

loans.name: Heri

texts.id:
Heri Priyanto works as a leather bracelet maker. Heri has to travel by motorcycle for about 2.5 km (1.55 miles) to the place he works. Usually, his leather bracelets are sold to souvenir shops or directly to customers. His leather bracelets are made of dried leather, which is shaped and sewed into bracelets with many designs and sizes. He lives with his wife and child on Wijaya Suwung Street, Denpasar. The profit he earns is not only used for his household needs, but also saved for his child's school tuition in the future. Heri Priyanto really hopes that he will be given this loan so that he can increase his business capital, which can grow his business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Sehari-harinya Heri Priyanto berprofesi sebagai perajin Gelang Kulit. Heri harus menempuh jarak sekitar 2,5 km ke tempatnya bekerja dengan menggunakan sepeda motor. Biasanya gelang kulit yang sudah diproduksi dijual ke toko souvenir atau langsung ke konsumen. Gelang kulit ini dibuat dari kulit yang sudah dikeringkan kemudian dibentuk dan dijahit menjadi gelang denagn berbagai bentuk dan ukuran. Saat ini tinggal bersama istri dan anaknya di.Jl Wijaya Suwung Denpasar. Keuntungan yang didapat, selain untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangga, juga dipakai untuk persiapan untuk membiayai sekolah anaknya nanti. Heri Priyanto sangat mengharapkan diberi pinjaman untuk dipakai sebagai modal usaha sehingga usahanya bisa lebih berkembang.

loans.use: To increase business capital

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose and his family are dairy farmers and they also dedicate themselves to agriculture in order to feed themselves. Jose is also the manager of the milk producers of the province of The Andes. His main source of income with which he maintains his family (his wife and 3 kids) comes from selling milk to the PIL Andina factory.

He lives in the community of Huayrocondo-Batallas which is in the province of The Andes in the state of La Paz (two hours from the city of El Alto).

He needs this credit in order to buy a medium quality milk-producing cow so that he can increase milk production and thereby improve his familiy's economic income.

This is his second credit with Impro and his good behaviour with regards to loan repayments means that he qualifies to make another loan application.

Translated form Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

José y su familia, son productores de leche y se dedican a la agricultura solo para su alimentación y él también trabaja como dirigente de los productores de leche de la Provincia los Andes. Sus ingresos principales con los que mantiene a la familia (3 hijos y esposa) provienen de la venta de leche a la Fábrica PIL Andina. Vive en la Comunidad Huayrocondo – Batallas de la Provincia Los Andes del Departamento de La Paz (Ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito requiere para comprar una vaca lechera de mediana calidad, de esa forma incrementar la producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos para su familia. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: To buy a medium quality milk-producing cow to increase milk production/Compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para incrementar su produccion de leche.

loans.name: Katifa

texts.en: Katifa B., 49, is married with seven children. Katifa has many years of experience in the sewing business. She sells her wares in the village community five days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Katifa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan through traditional banks. She plans to spend the loan on supplies for her business. Her husband works as a night auditor for Aggies Hotel and as the head coach for a rugby team; he plans to work part-time as a finanacial assistant for Katifa's business.

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine, materials, lavalava, threads, and other supplies for her sewing business.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Phin P., 38, works on her farmland in Sa Ang, Cambodia, with her husband. They have four children.

The field typically generates only US$2 each day in income and it is very difficult to support such a large family. Phin P. has asked for a loan of US$200 to purchase more vegetable seeds to increase her field's yield. She believes that this investment will allow her to increase her income; with the extra money she can improve her family's quality of life.

Many Cambodians are feeling the strain of high food and gasoline prices, so they are looking for ways to increase their income and provide for their families.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seeds

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mr. San S. is a villager in Khsom Village in Kandal Province. His wife, Mrs. Sok Nith, pictured on the left of the photograph, is a gardener in the USA embassy in Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. San is 22 years old, and he is the father of a 1-year-old child, who is thus too young to work or study.

San is a motorbike taxi driver who would like to generate greater income to support his family. Currently, San is experiencing problems with his business because his motorbike is rather old, so he necessarily spends a lot of money on gas/petroleum. As a result, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase another motorbike, which would allow him to save more money for the benefit of his family.

loans.use: To save fuel costs by purchasing another motorbike.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth owns a chemist shop where he sells medicine. He runs the shop with his wife who is a trained nurse in a private hospital.  Kenneth is also a nurse but he prefers to sell medicine because selling medicine will enable him have time to attend to other family issues.  He has been in this business since 1998. His wife also assists him when she is not on duty. Kenneth is 45 years old and married with three children. He needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more medicine for sale from a pharmaceutical store. He says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more medicine to sell

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto tiene 39 años de edad, vive en pareja hace 13 años con Mariza y juntos han criado a dos niños que hoy tienen 2 y 6 años respectivamente.

Comienza diciendo que cuando niño realizaba trabajos en la chacra de su padre. Una vez llegado a la adolescencia, como tantos otros paraguayos, tuvo que partir al país vecino de la Argentina con el fin de hacerse de una profesión con el cual poder vivir dignamente. Fue así que trabajó por muchos años como constructor y en ese tiempo conoció a la que sería su compañera de toda la vida.

Volvió después de 15 años a su ciudad natal, Itá, donde compró una camioneta y montó su pequeña despensa. En la misma, además de vender los productos necesarios para la canasta familiar, también tiene una mesa de billar que constituye la diversión de todos los jóvenes del barrio.

Con su camioneta realiza fletes hasta distintos puntos de la ciudad.

En esta oportunidad solicita el crédito para surtir mejor su negocio con mercaderías tales como: harina, arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 39 years old and lives with his partner of 13 years with whom he has two children who today are 2 and 6 years old, respectively.

He begins by telling us that, when he was a child, he worked on his father’s farm. Once he reached adolescence, like many other Paraguayans, he had to leave his country and travel to Argentina with the goal of finding a profession which would allow him to live with dignity. In this manner, he worked for many years in construction, during which time he met his companion for life.

After fifteen years he returned to Itá, his native city, where he bought his own truck and started his own store. In the store, in addition to selling basic necessities, he also has a billiards table which provides a diversion for the youngsters of the neighborhood. With his truck, he provides charters to different areas of the city.

In this opportunity, he requests the loan to better supply his business with merchandise such as: flour, rice, sugar, noodles, etc.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, flour, rice, noodles, and beverages.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom P. is a villager in Trapaing Sva village in Kandal Province. She is 43 years old and the mother of five children; two are employed in a garment factory and the others attend the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Sin Sokly, are farmers.  They own a plot of land where they cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn their living. They face a problem because they have only one ox, so they cannot plow their field. Thus, Mrs. Mom P. decided to request a loan to buy another ox to help plow the field. She and her husband are in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a second ox to help plow the field.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is a 30-year-old married woman with four kids; fortunately, the Government compulsory free education policy has helped her to send all her kids to school and they are in the primary level. She dropped out of school for lack of financial support. She decided to learn a trade to earn a living. She has now erected a stand in the marketplace of New Edubiase, a suburb of Obuasi, where she has been selling bathroom slippers over the last six years. Even though the slippers are meant for bathing, others also use them for different purposes, such as for traveling, while others wear them for their errands. She said customers preferred the slippers because they are affordable. She has insufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress.

She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality and large quantity of assorted slippers to upgrade her inventory. She will also use part to support her kids in school for their future career. She said she is going through challenges because she could not go to school but wants to see her kids fulfilling their dreams by helping through the proceeds from the loan. She said she would be grateful for that assistance. Akua belongs to the community group called ‘Obatanpa’, meaning Good Mother Trust group. The group members guarantee a loan through repayment pledges and support one another to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days, and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase bulk supply of bathroom slippers.

loans.name: Phall

texts.en:
Mr. Phall P. is a farmer in Trapaing Snau village in Kampong Cham province. He owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Ban Mach, is a recyclables collector who gathers or buys waste such as empty bottles, cans, plastics and so on. Since her business is going well, she wants to buy more waste to re-sell to the recycling factory.

Thus, Mr. Phall P. decided to request a loan for his wife's business. He is 31 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study because that child is just 3 years old. His wife is also in the picture.

loans.use: to buy empty bottles, cans, plastics, etc.

loans.name: Kifoyat

texts.en:
Kifoyat has a responsibility that makes her work hard for improvement. She is a mother and a widow, and she wants her daughter, who is under her care, to go to college so that she can have a better future. She has also two independent adult sons. To support herself and her daughter, Kifoyat has worked on farming for the last 20 years. 

Kifoyat is a woman of humble heart and position who works very hard every day in her fields to produce her family’s sustenance, planting and tending her potatoes, tomato and cucumber. Despite the losses Kifoyat and her family have suffered, they persevere, motivated by their desire for a better life, and that is why Kifoyat is asking for a loan to buy seed, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants to prepare one of her fields for cultivation. Show your solidarity with this noble but backbreaking cause!   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is 46 years old and married with 4 children. She sells provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married. He and his wife have one son named Nikita, who is 5 years old. Sergei sells women's clothing. His monthly profit is about 3,000 UAH.

Sergei has been in this business for 7 years. He sells clothing at different markets in the Kherson area. Instead of waiting for clients from the area to come to him, he goes out to small markets and provides clothing for many people there. Sergei is a very entrepreneurial and hard working person. He wants to develop this business even further. His business is the only source of income for his family.

Sergei would like to borrow 9,500 UAH to increase his assortment of clothes. He hopes that more variety will increase his sales and help him take better care of his family.

loans.use: To buy more varied clothes to sell.

loans.name: Daniel Alfonzo

texts.es: El Sr. Daniel D. tiene 40 años de edad, el vive en union libre con la Sra. Gladys Marina Molina con la cual han procreado 2 hijos, uno de ellos esta en la escuela y el otro que es mayor le ayuda en la pesca, el compra curiles para venderlos ya que este tipo de mariscos se vende muy bien en esta zona, con los curiles se hace un buen ceviche y mucha gente lo compra porque tiene un sabor muy delicioso, el tiene 2 lanchas para pescar y en estos momentos el necesita el credito para comprarle un motor ya que se le daño el que tiene puesto, y esta es su herramienta de trabajo sin ella no puede sacar su producto del mar. por tal razon el esta solicitando el credito.
texts.en:
Daniel D. is 40 years old and lives with his partner, Gladys Marina Molina, with whom he has 2 sons. The younger son is at school and the elder helps him with fishing. He buys clams to sell them on, as this kind of shellfish sells very well around here. Clams can be used to make a fine ceviche (seafood salad marinated in lemon juice) and many people buy it for its delicious flavour. He has 2 fishing boats and now needs the loan to buy an engine, as his current one has broken down. He can't fish without this particular equipment, which is why he is requesting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fishing boat engine

loans.name: Sandra Carolina

texts.es: La señora Sandra Carolina Sánchez, tiene la edad de 31 años, habita en el las pilas Orientales, ubicado en cuidad de Masaya, junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene a su cargo tres hijos , una mujer de 15 años, un varón de 12 años y niña de 7 años , actualmente todos estudian, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, ella se dedica a trabajos de confesiones desde hace cinco años, solicita un financiamiento para poder incrementar su inventario, para esto va a comprar tela, hilo, súper, bordados entre otros que mejore su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra Carolina Sánchez is 31 years old and lives in the Pilas Orientales neighborhood in the city of Masaya together with her husband, who works in order to help her with the household expenses. They have three dependent children: a 15 year old girl, a 12 year old boy and a 7 year old girl, all of whom are currently in school. Their plan for the family is to improve their living conditions. Sandra has worked for 5 years as a dressmaker. She is requesting a loan in order to be able to expand her inventory. To do so she is going to buy cloth, thread, embroidered pieces and other raw materials that will improve the quality of her work.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, thread and other products she needs to do her dressmaking.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is thirty–five years old and married with two sons. One is in senior high school and the other is in junior high school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer and mason by profession.

Afia is a trader. She runs a grocery store in her community. She purchases her goods in Dormaa, the district capital. Afia has been in business for one year and wants a loan to buy provisions in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk.

loans.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es: El señor Orlando José M. Z. , tiene la edad de 69 años habita en el barrio , la borgoña , ubicado en l municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tiene cuatros hijos , ya todo casados e independientes , los planes hacia su familia es apoyar siempre a sus hijos y poder establecer mas  cultivos para que ellos trabajen juntos , don Orlando desde hace 40 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor afectación son las plagas y el mal tiempo , ya que en ocasiones ha perdido cultivo, con este crédito va a comprar insumos y fertilizantes para mejorar el cultivo y poder vender lograr una buena cosecha y vender a mejor precio en el mercado
texts.en:
Mr. Orlando José M. Z. is 69 years old and lives in the La Borgoña neighborhood of the Ticuantepe municipality. Together with his wife, who maintains the house, he has four grown and independent children who are all married. His plans for his family are to always support his children and help them establish more agricultural fields so they may work together. Orlando has worked 40 years in agriculture. The worst problems he has experienced have been plagues and poor weather, at times causing him to lose the harvest. With this loan he will buy supplies and fertilizers to improve the yield in order to get the best price at market for a successful harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers to improve the harvest.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah T. is thirty years old. She is married and has two children. One child is currently in school. Hannah is a trader and loves selling. She sells food products like cassava dough, corn dough and maize in the local market of Bawjiase where she lives. Banku, one of the popular Ghanaian dishes, is produced by milling fresh cassava and maize into cassava and corn dough. Selling for the past five years, she has lots of experience to win customers. 
Hannah is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her kids with a quality education for their future careers. With this loan, she wants to purchase increased stock of cassava and maize to produce enough cassava and corn dough to satisfy her customers’ needs. She is a member of the borrowing group called ‘Maranatha Trust Group’. In this group members provide support to one another in handling repayment. She does not sell on days of her group meeting and her picture was taken during her group meeting. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase cassave and maize in bulk.

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en: The picture shows 21-year-old Sovann S., a good mother caring for one lovely young child who is not yet enrolled in school. Sovann currently retails various vegetable that she buys in bulk on credit from farmers, paying for them from the income she earns from selling them, typically about $2 per day.  Another income source is her husband, who has worked as a barber for years but still needs equipment. Therefore, Sovann is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase additional hair-cutting tools for her husband’s service.

loans.use: To purchase additional hair cutting tools for her husband’s service.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn S. is from the village of Zone 1B, Del Carmen, Iligan City. She is 25, married and has one infant. To make a living, Genelyn owns & operates a business selling fruits like mangoes from a food stall, in the local community. Genelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In July 2009, Genelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Juvita

texts.en:
Juvita M. is from the city of Aloran. She is 60 years old. Juvita is single. To make a living, Juvita owns & operates a hog raising business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Juvita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Juvita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Juvita is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Juvita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera, y vive junto a su madre y sus hermanos en el distrito pesquero de San José, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace 10 años se dedica al arte del bordado artesanal, desde entonces se ha valido de esta actividad para ganarse la vida y solventar sus propios gastos; ella trabaja en base a pedidos, sus clientes le brindan todo el material necesario (hijos y telas) para que les borde manteles, cortinas y servilletas.

Ella desea expandir su negocio haciendo más bordados, los cuales pueda vender en diversas ferias de exposición artesanal, así como distribuirlos en las principales tiendas turísticas de la región; por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más hilos y telas para empezar a trabajar de manera independiente y con recursos propios.

Su mas grande anhelo es hacerse conocida en la región y que su trabajo tenga la difusión que se merece.

Goza de muy buenas referencias personales ya que sus clientes y vecinos la consideran una chica muy responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Juliana is 30 years old and single. She lives with her mother and brothers in the fishing district of San Jose, located about 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For 10 years, she has been involved in the art of hand embroidery. Ever since, she has made use of this business to earn a living and pay her own expenses. She works based on orders. Her customers offer her all the necessary material (thread and fabric) so the she embroiders blankets, curtains and napkins for them.

She wants to expand her business by making more embroidery which she can sell in various artisans markets, as well as distributing them in the main tourist shops of the region. For this reason she finds herself applying, for the first time, for a loan of 500 new soles from our institution. She plans to invest in the purchase of more thread and fabric in order to begin working in an independent fashion and with her own resources.

Her greatest yearning is to become known in the region and that her work will have the distribution it merits. She enjoys very good references since her customers and neighbors consider her a responsible and hard working young woman.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of thread and fabric for the making and sale of embroidery

loans.name: Charlotte Constance

texts.fr: A. Charlotte Constance est née le 12/12/1959 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Charlotte Constance est mariée à KIKI Lambert. Le couple a deux enfants. La famille vit à Porto-Novo. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Charlotte Constance vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. C’est des tissus, chaussures et ustensiles de cuisine que Charlotte Constance vend. Charlotte Constance achète ses tissus à Cotonou,  Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin et les vend au marché Ouando de Porto-Novo. Charlotte Constance est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour  augmenter le volume de son activité, Charlotte Constance demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de tissus, chaussures et ustensiles de cuisine.

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Mrs. Nuon P. is a villager in Sdol villager in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. Her husband, Mr. Phin Rann, is a taxi driver. This couple also owns a business by using the rice to make wine to sell. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income to support the family living. Thus, Mrs. Nuon P. decided to ask for a loan to buy ten piglets, pig food, and fertilizer to support the rice field. She is 43 years old and the mother of five children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is on the rice of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy ten piglets, pig food, and fertilizer to support the rice field.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty sells sarongs of various colors in the market. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to meet the requirements of her clients. She is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 (US$675) to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkola sont en majorité des femmes veuves ayant en moyenne quarante trois, cinq enfants et vivant dans des familles traditionnelles à Kéléya (relevant de la préfecture de Bougouni) à 100  kilomètres de Bamako (la capitale du Mali).
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et professionnels et  font le commerce d’articles divers. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe avec l’institution de microfinance  Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles comptent avoir avec ce prêt, 10 casiers de boissons gazeuses, 70  kilogrammes de légumes frais, 100  kilogrammes d’atiékè et divers articles. Elles s’approvisionnent sur le marché de Kéléya où elles vendent sur des étales (au bord de la route nationale qui relie Bamako à Abidjan) ou en ambulant dans les quartiers du village. 
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 19.000 FCFA qui servira à payer l’échéance du prêt et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The women of group Benkola are mostly widows who average 43 years of age and five children. They live in traditional families in Keleya ( within the Bougouni prefecture) 100 kilometers of Bamako( the capital of Mali). They know each other through their proximity and professional ties and do commerce of various items. They are on their first group loan with Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. They intend to buy 10 crates of carbonated soft drinks,70 kilograms of fresh vegetables, 100 kilograms of 'atieke' and various items with this loan. They get their supplies at the Keleya market where they display for sale ( by the national highway which links Bamako to Abidjan) or by door-to-door in the village neighborhoods. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 19 000FCFA which will be used to repay the loans on time and contribute to the family expenses.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Maï Astou

texts.fr: Maï Astou S. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH depuis 7 ans et demi et a une bonne expérience avec le crédit. elle fait un commerce de mil et d'arachide elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Maï Astou S. is a 52-year-old woman who is married and the mother of seven children.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH for 7½ years and has a good loan record.  She does commerce in millet and peanuts.  She takes part in improving her family's living conditions. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her commerce

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
For 10 years Rose N. has had a boutique selling both cosmetics and clothes to workers from Mumias Sugar and other locales. In this business, she contends with competition and having to travel long distances to purchase goods.

Rose is married to a driver, and they have one child, three years old. She will use the proceeds of this loan to buy more inventory for her boutique, and ultimately she would like to build her business and have a big boutique as well as a restaurant. In addition to her boutique, Rose also sells fish and describes herself as God-fearing, honest, but hot-tempered!

loans.use: Ladies cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Modinot

texts.en: Modinot D. is 34 years old, married with two children. She  is a tailor and also sells clothing material and sarongs that can be used to make various styles of one’s choice. Modinot goes to Lagos Island to buy goods( clothing materials) as soon as her stock goes down. The lady in picture is her apprentice as she was at the market purchasing tailoring materials when the photograph was taken. Modinot has finished repaying her previous loan which was used to rent her shop. The balance of that loan was used to purchase a weaving machine. Modinot has been in this business for the past ten years. She requests for a loan of N100,000 to purchase clothing materials in bulk at a reduced cost and also to reduce the need for being on the road often. Modinot says when the children are on holiday from school they assist her a lot in the business because they know the solution to their needs comes from the success of the business. She says thank-you to all.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials and sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Ana Carolina

texts.es:
La  Sra. Ana O. es trabajadora del centro de insumos para la salud en el departamento de contabilidad.
Ana va usar el crédito para comprar cemento, arena y piedra para la construcción de un muro en la parte de atrás de su vivienda.
Quiere construir ese muro para que los niños puedan jugar con más seguridad.
Ella es casada y madre de dos hijos los que a la vez se encuentran en edad escolar.
Este es el segundo crédito que Ana ha tenido con CEPRODEL. Ha trabajado con ceprodel 2 años.
Ana dijo que sus créditos con Ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ha mejorado su casa de habitación
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana O. works in the accounting department for a health supplies center. She is going to use this credit to purchase cement, sand, and stones for the construction of a wall in the back part of her home, so that her children can play with greater safety. She is married and the mother of two school-age children. This is the second credit that Ana has had with CEPRODEL, and she has worked with us for two years. She says that her loans through Ceprodel have helped her a lot in improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand, and stone

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stocking and selling charcoal

loans.name: Emelisa

texts.en: Emelisa T. is engaged in retail business. Aside from that, she also owns and manages a small rice field in their village. She has seven children. Her eldest child is 21 years old. She desires a better life for her family, that is why she is working very hard to be able to earn income to buy them adequate food and other basic needs. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise in for her RTW (ready-to-wear) business and farm supplies for her farm.

loans.use: To buy RTW porducts to resell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
L a señora Teresa M. es casada, tiene la edad de 42 años y con 2 hijos de los cuales uno de ellos esta bajo su carga familiar y es estudiante universitario. Doña Teresa es Psicóloga y trabaja para el Minsa Posoltega de donde ella es originaria, labora desde hace 24 años y se desempeña como jefe de brigada de enfermedades de transmisión vectorial. 
Ella tiene 4 años de trabajar con Ceprodel y los créditos que se le han otorgado han sido de gran ayuda, ya que los 3 primeros fueron para mejoramiento de vivienda y este último que lo solicito para gastos médicos.
texts.en:
Teresa M., 42, is married and has two children, one of whom is still dependent on her; he is a university student. Teresa is a psychologist employed by the Ministry of Health in Posoltega, which is where she is from. She has worked for 24 years and is head of a vector transmission diseases nursing brigade. She has collaborated with Ceprodel for 4 years and the loans she has gotten have been of great help to her; she used the first three for home improvements and this last one is to cover medical expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal expenses (medical tests and medicine)

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura runs a small restaurant & eatery business. Although her husband has a job, he sometimes helps in running the business. They have 3 children between the ages of 7 to 19 years old and are currently going to school. The children also helping their parents in the business during their free time as part of their daily chores.

Laura joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 of August in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in restaurant & eatery business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 70,000 from her business activities.

Laura is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 was used to fund operations of her restaurant/eatery, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 14th cycle loan, an amount of PHP 10,000, which she intends to use for her restaurant/eatery business. Laura is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Reina De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Reina de los Angeles C.  es una señora   de 45 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en una comunidad llamada Coquital  localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos y  naranja.

Desde hace ya 2 años Doña Reina  se dedica a la cría de pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras para la producción de carne y huevos, ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad los cuales se muestran muy satisfechos. Ella dice que tener el apoyo y la ayuda de su esposo  le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante   ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte.
 Actualmente doña Reina  está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢665.000 (seiscientos sesenta y cinco  mil colones) para la compra de más pollos y gallinas; concentrado, y productos para el tratamiento de enfermedades; además de ampliar y reforzar su local. Con esto ella espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. Con el préstamo que está solicitando espera aumentar las ventas y así mejorar la condición económica de su familia.

Ella forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este es el segundo  crédito para doña Reina   y con el espera  sacarle un mejor provecho a su negocio y mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Reina de los Angeles C. is a 45 year old woman who lives with her husband and their four children. They live in a community called Coquital, which is located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province. This community is known for its mountainous regions and for being very close to the northern border of our country. Its main economic activities are livestock and farming. Specifically, they plant basic grains and oranges. For two years Reina has been raising chickens to fatten. She also raises laying hens to produce meat and eggs. She sells her products to the neighbors in the community, and they are very satisfied. She says that having her husband’s support and help facilitates the continuation of her project. She also says that the project is very interesting to her. She has seen her business slowly grow, and the demand is constantly increasing. Reina is currently requesting a loan for ¢665,000 (six hundred sixty-five thousand colones) to buy more chickens, hens, food concentrate, and products to treat illnesses. She also wants to expand and reinforce her place. She plans use the loan to make her business grow more and to improve her quality of life. Her business is going well, but she has not been able to make it grow more due to lack of money. With the requested loan she plans to increase sales and improve her family’s economic condition. She is part of the of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital, which is one of a hundred member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is Reina’s second loan. She plans to get a better profit from her business and to improve her economic condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens to fatten and to improve her place

loans.name: Kilda

texts.en: Kilda is a 47-year-old married woman and mother of three children. She has been running a tailoring business from her home as a support income for her family. She has been involved in this occupation for the past 20 years. She produces all types of clothes. After this long period working at the same sewing machine, it became very used and old and it became hard to work on it. So it takes big time to deliver her products. That’s why she wants to borrow $1,000 to buy a new developed sewing machine to better market her services and increase the liquidity of her business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Juana Vanessa

texts.es:
Juana es una joven de 25 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Pacora, un distrito agrícola perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque, es conocido a nivel regional por sus festividades religiosas, se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir a pedido, adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de Chiclayo y la distribuye entre sus vecinos y conocidos de acuerdo a los pedidos que le solicitan, adicionalmente cuenta con un stock permanente de ropa  que ofrece en venta todos los domingos en el mercado de su distrito. Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales, de educación y para apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia. Juana estudia computación en un Instituto de la ciudad de Lambayeque, ella desea salir adelante y debido a ello se esfuerza mucho por sobresalir en sus estudios. 

En los ultimos meses, su negocio ha tenido un aumento de demanda, dado a la calidad de prendas de vestir que ofrece, por ello actualmente desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas mercadería, siguiendo su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1400 nuevos soles.

Juana es una joven empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y tener su propio establecimiento de ropa. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Juana is a young woman who is 25 years of age, single, and lives with her parents in the District of Pacora. This agricultural district is part of Lambayeque Province, which is known on a national level for its religious festivals. It is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Juana sells clothing by order. She acquires her merchandise in the city of Chiclayo and delivers the products to her neighbors and acquaintances according to what they requested. In addition, she maintains a permanent stock of clothing to sell every Sunday at the district market. The revenue she generates goes toward her personal expenses, her education, and support for her family. Juana is studying information technology at an institution in the city of Lambayeque. She wants to get ahead and work hard so that she can excel in her studies.

In recent months, her business has experienced increased demand as a result of the quality of clothing she offers. She now wants to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise. To accomplish this objective, Juana has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1400 PEN.

Juana is a trustworthy and hardworking young woman. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and open her own clothing establishment. She has worked previously with Edpyme Alternativa and demonstrated that she is a punctual and responsible client when it comes to completing her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Good Friends Group

texts.en:
Kpana C. is the leader of Good Friends, a group made up of five borrowers. She is 52 years old, married, and has seven children who range from 13 to 34 years old. She was not able to attend school due to poverty. For the last year, she has made a living selling pepper, salt, onions and rice at the Stephen Tolbert Estate Market, which is located on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She sells her goods in a friendly, upbeat way, which keeps customers returning.  

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more pepper, rice onion and salt to sell to her customers. Her goal is to grow her business and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kpana is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more pepper, rice onion and salt to sell to her customers

loans.name: Melina

texts.en:
Melina O. is from the village of Camarahan Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 51 years old. Melina is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Melina owns & operates a seafood products business, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Melina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Melina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Melina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon, who lives with his parents and two siblings. In 2007, he started his own cellular phone business after having two years experience in the field.

He is now hoping to purchase new accessories for the phones and to do so he will need to borrow $1,200.

loans.use: To purchase new accessories for the phones

loans.name: Fatima Joao

texts.pt:
Fátima João Boene vive em B., província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique. No passado empréstimo conseguiu comprar todo o material que esteve previsto e também foi suficiente para o que pretendia. Conseguiu ainda pagar a sua letra segundo o calendário estabelecido.
A sua obra está bastante avançada, prevendo ainda dar continuidade com o que falta e ainda houve melhoria na sua vida porque subiu de categoria no seu emprego de professorado e também obteve o segundo filho. O presente empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia, blocos e outros) para dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa. 
Esta muito satisfeito com o empréstimo, esta conseguindo reformar a sua residência e pretende solicitar mais crédito para concluir a sua casa e continuar com os estudos.
texts.en:
Fátima João Boene lives in B., province of Maputo, in the south of Mozambique. With her previous loan she managed to buy all the material and complete the work she planned. She was also able to pay back according to the schedule. The construction is now well advanced and the expectation is to keep working on it. There was also an improvement in her personal life, as she got promoted in her teaching career and she also had a second child. With this loan of 10.000.00mt she would like to buy construction material (cement, stone, sand, bricks and other items) to keep working on the construction of her house. She is very pleased with this loan, because it is allowing her to reform her home and she plans to request an additional loan in the future, to complete the construction of her house and to continue with her studies.

Translated from Portuguese by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material (cement, stone, sand, bricks and other items)

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is a forty-eight year old widowed woman, living with her three children in Saida, Southern Lebanon. Fadia has owned a gift shop since 2004. To develop her business, she added a new product to her business, which is decorating artificiA. flowers, straw baskets, and handmade colored vases.

Fadia requested a loan from A. Majmoua, in order to buy new products such as silver trays, table decoration cloths, artificiA. flowers and home decorating accessories. She believes that as much as you give your business you will get back; her hope in her work can’t be described in words since it’s the only source to stand up and raise her little family on her own. Fadia is very talented in her business and seeks new opportunities all the time.

loans.use: To buy new products for her business.

loans.name: Geins

texts.en:
Geins C. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Geins is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Geins owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling used clothing and shoe products in the local community. Geins has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Geins joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geins is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Geins from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sharifah

texts.en: Sharifah N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Sharifah has a business of selling vegetables, which she has had for less than one year. Sharifah also has a business selling charcoal. To help expand her business, Sharifah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal and vegetables. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sharifah hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food at home. In the future, Sharifah hopes to own a beauty salon. Sharifah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her the skills of getting a job and how to read. Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and more charcaol

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy D. is from the village of Mapang, Rizal. She is 32 years old and single. To make a living, Joy owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Joy has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Joy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Joy from PMPC. 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for snack vending

loans.name: Tusaidiane Group

texts.fr: Kahindo A. est  conseillère du groupe Tusaidiane, âgée de 40 ans, veuve, mère de 6 enfants, tous étudient, son mari  est décédé suite a une longue maladie, elle fait le petit commerce de bois depuis 2004. Elle  commença son business avec son fond propre, plus tard, elle bénéficia du crédit de  Hekima en 2005 de 50$ pour renforcer son business de commerce. Elle expose ses marchandises sur la rue, axe de lave. Elle  vent également de graviers aux constructeurs. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  des certaines marchandises notamment les matériaux de construction pour  les écouler dans les chantiers des privés. Elle souhaiterait  construire sa maison et faire scolariser ses enfants orphelins confortablement. En plus, elle ambitionne avoir  une nouvelle moto pour faire le taxi, celle qu’elle détient actuellement est déjà amortie. La cliente Kahindo A. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres veuves exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Tusaidiane est composé de 17 membres. La  cliente Kahindo A. avait acheté cette moto à partir des bénéfices cumulés de ses activités.
texts.en:
Kahindo A. is the advisor of the group "Tusaidiane". She is 40 years old, a widow and the mother of 6 children, all of whom attend school. Her husband died after a long illness. She started a small business selling wood in 2004. She started the business with her own funds and, later in 2005, was the beneficiary of a $50 loan from the organization Hekima to strengthen her business. She sells her merchandise roadside on the principal route. She also sells gravel to construction workers. With this new loan, she will purchase supplies notably construction materials to sell to deprived work-sites. She hopes to build a home and have the opportunity to educate her orphaned children comfortably. Additionally, her ambition is to have a motorcycle to use as part of a taxi business; she has already fully paid for the motorcycle she currently has. (Kahindo A. purchased the motorcycle with the earnings from her business.) Kahindo A. thanks the organization Hekima for its actions in helping poor widows, unlike a traditional bank. The group Tusaidiane is comprised of 17 members.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials to sell to deprived work-sites

loans.name: Stephen Onyango

texts.en:
Stephen has been repairing vehicles in Naivasha town since the year 2006.  He is 28 years old, married to Edith Auma, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan well and in good time. He plans to use this cash to buy fiberglass materials which he uses for repairing vehicle bodies.

Stephen also hopes to be the supplier of fiberglass materials for the entire Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy more fiberglass material for repairing vehicles.

loans.name: Darling José

texts.es:
La Sr. Darling José T. T. es originaria del municipio Santa Rosa del peñón comarca el confite actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en Santa Rosa del Peñón donde tiene 6 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para mejorar su vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de Sin. Con el objetivo de Construir su vivienda.
Esta señor su objetivo es plenamente dedicado a mejorar su hogar.
Esto le permitirá llegar a construir su propia casa de habitación donde mejorara el bien estar de su familia
texts.en: Darling José T. T. is originally from the city of Santa Rosa de Peñón where he works as a primary school teacher. He has worked at the school Santa Rosa del Peñón for 6 years.  This is his first loan with Ceprodel to improve his home. He will use the loan to buy zinc to construct his home. Jose is fully committed to improving his home.  This loan will allow him to construct his own home to improve the well being of his family.

loans.use: Buying Zinc (shingles)

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn D. is from the village of Barangay 19, Gingoog City. She is 52 years old, is married, and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Marilyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes from buying and selling a variety of fish, including milkfish, mackerel, and salmon, in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish for her inventory. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and have working capital

loans.name: Nilda
