texts.en:
Nilda P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 49 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children. She plants rice and raises pigs for a living. She spends most of her time tilling her rice farm. When she is free of farming duties, she raises her pigs. She is planning to get more piglets to raise and sell.

Nilda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Nilda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies, piglets and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies, piglets and feed

loans.name: Evaristo Salvador

texts.es: Evaristo Salvador tiene 48 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio por lo que sus inicios fueron muy difíciles tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que se han enfermado últimamente, pues él ha tenido que gastar en medicamentos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su negocio ya que es de este negocio de lo que vive. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos baciscos.
texts.en: Evaristo Salvador is 48 years old and runs a small grocery store.  He has had this business for more than 10 years.  At first things were very difficult.  Evaristo has two dependent children who have been ill recently and he has had to pay for their medicine.  Through a lot of hard work he has managed to improve his business since it supports him and his family.  He is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as candies, soft drinks, bread and basic grains.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Venancia

texts.es:
La Sra. Venancia tiene 59 años. Ella es viuda. Trabaja vendiendo ropas para damas, caballeros y niños de forma ambulante. Tiene su pequeña clientela formada y también clientes nuevos, recomendados de las personas de confianza que adquieren sus mercaderías. Se dedica a esta actividad desde el año 2005.
 Necesita de este crédito para comprar prendas de verano para damas y niños (conjuntos, remeras, vestidos y otros), así podrá cubrir los pedidos que recibe de sus clientes.
 Ella desea brindar ayuda a sus hijos, en cuanto a la crianza de sus nietos, desea sentirse siempre util contribuyendo en los ingresos del hogar, pues con ella siguen viviendo dos de sus hijos ya casados. 
Anhela poder ver crecer a sus nietos como personas de bien, enseñándoles la responsabilidad del trabajo y el estudio.
texts.en:
Venancia is 59 years old and a widow.  She sells clothing in the streets for women, men, and children.  Venancia has formed her own small clientèle plus some new customers, recommended by her closest customers who have acquired her merchandise.  She has been dedicated to this activity since 2005.

Venancia needs this loan to buy summer clothes for women and children (ensembles, t-shirts, dresses, and other things), in order to cover her customers' orders.

She wishes to help her children, and especially her grandchildren, hoping always to feel useful by contributing to household income.  Two of her married children still live with her.  Venancia hopes to be able to see her grandchildren grow as good persons, teaching them the responsibility of work and study.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE T-SHIRTS, DRESSES, BLOUSES, SHORTS, AND OTHER ITEMS TO SELL

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana vive en la zona de la villa 1ro. De mayo, es casa propia donde vive junto a su hija. La Sra. Juana esta en su segundo ciclo en la institución, donde ha demostrado un buen comportamiento de pago. Ella alquila cuartos en sus domicilio y también tiene su venta de asaditos en el colegio que esta cerca de su domicilio. El crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de insumos como fideos, arroz, papa, aceite, para la elaboración de sus platillos ya que por estas fiestas de fin de año se va a dedicar a la venta de comida. La Sra. Juana es trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en: Mrs Juana lives in the Villa Primero de Mayo zone. She lives in her own home with her daughter. Juana is in her second loan cycle with the institution, where she has demonstrated herself to be responsible with repayments. She rents rooms in her home and also sells roasts in the school near to her home. The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of items such as noodles, rice, potatoes and oil for making her dishes, since at the end of the year she is going to focus on making food. Juana is hard-working and responsible.

loans.use: the purchase of tools for making roasts and roasted peanuts

loans.name: Luisa Del Rosario

texts.es:
Luisa Del Rosario L. O. tiene 41 años de edad. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el Compañero y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las blancas Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Luisa Del Rosario se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder dar el estudio a los hijos.

Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Luisa Del Rosario L. O. is 41. She is in a common-law marriage and lives with her partner in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. She has 3 children.

The members of the V.R.C. 26 de Noviembre ["November 26th"] are located in the Las Blancas neighbourhood belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The members of this bank have long worked in short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Luisa Del Rosario has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for five years. She buys her products in Agripac and sells them in the market in Ventanas.

She is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural tools and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. In supporting this loan, you will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to be able to provide her children with an education.

She enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en: Robelyn L. is from the village of Brgy. Banganan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 32 years old. Robelyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Robelyn plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Robelyn has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Robelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Robelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Robelyn is requesting a new loan of 34,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Robelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sergio De  Jesus

texts.es:
Sergio, de 48 años de edad ,originario de la comarca  el Dorado , municipio de Estelí, casado, con 5 hijos a su cargo, de oficio  agricultor, tiene 40 años dedicándose a la actividad de siembra de hortalizas ,solo llego hasta tercer  grado de primaria ,pues debido a su procedencia humilde , el tener estudios era algo difícil para sus padres  así que  se dedico a trabajar con su padre en la siembra  pues fue su papa  quien le enseño a sembrar.Al cumplir los 15 años   ya sembraba por cuenta propia, se caso a los 22 años .  A partir de entonces sembraba hortalizas , comenzó con tomate y cebolla  en su comunidad. Fruto de su labor logro comprar su propio   equipo   de trabajo  y su vivienda. Actualmente siembra a medias con su suegro una parte de la cosecha  de cebolla. Además  también tiene otros ingresos como el destace de cerdo actividad que hace cada 5 días dentro de su misma comunidad.
Solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de insumos y semilla de tomate. El crédito le permitirá obtener mayor ganancia, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y ser un productor conocido ,poderlo exportar  a Costa Rica .
texts.en: Sergio is 48 years old, originally from the Dorado region in the town of Estelí. He is married with five dependent children. He has worked as a trade farmer for 40 years growing vegetables. He only studied until 3rd grade, due to his humble origin. Continuing his studies was difficult for his parents so he dedicated himself to working with his father in planting because it was his father who taught him to sow. When he was 15 years old he was already sowing for himself and married when he was 22 years old. After having planted vegetables, from then on he started with tomatoes and onions in his community. The fruits of his labor are buying his own home and having his own team of workers. Currently he is planting half with his father, part of the onion harvest. In addition he earns other means of income doing pig butchering every 5 days in the same community. He is requesting a loan to invest in buying more raw materials and tomato seeds. The loan will allow him to have better earnings, improve his family's quality of life and be a well known producer, allowing him to export to Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and tomato seeds.

loans.name: Koemleng

texts.en:
Mr. Koemleng P. is 53 years old.  He and his wife, Mrs. Ly Seang, live in a suburb approximately 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have three children – one son and two daughters. Two are in school and one is still too young for school.

Koemleng is a commissioner. He also rents space in his house to garment factory workers because his house is located near a garment factory. His wife is a garment factory worker at the site as well.

He is asking for his first loan of $500 to repair his house because it is broken down in some parts.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Hannie

texts.en: Hannie is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by selling rice (palay). Her husband Segundino, who is 35 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 6 and 8 years old. Hannie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Hannie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to purchase rice so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of her business. Hannie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 49 years old and married with five children.

Clarita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell.

Clarita has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns an income from a piggery.

Clarita aspires to expand her piggery business.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. They own a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transport costs.

For the past four years, she has operated a beauty salon business which has improved her living standards. Her clients are her neighbours and passersby. Christine faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of owning a well-furnished beauty salon and a cosmetic shop in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to furnish her beauty salon, purchase mirrors, chairs and a refrigerator to sell soft drinks to her customers. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to uplift her business standard.

loans.use: To furnish her beauty salon, purchase mirrors, chairs and a refrigerator to sell soft drinks to her customers.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama B. sells pastries at Eguafo near Elmina. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer.  She has been in this trade for just 2 years and therefore needs a loan to expand it. The loan, when received, will be added to her initial capital to buy flour, oil and other ingredients that will enable her to bake more for sale. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs for the family. She plans to plough her additional profit back into the business.

loans.use: will be added to her initial capital to buy flour, oil and other ingredients that will enable her to bake more for sale.

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith is 36 years old and married with 3 children.  With 2 children in school, Bernadith works very hard to provide for her family.

Bernadith runs a Sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.  Bernadith has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, bread, etc.

In the future, Bernadith would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Kuume

texts.en:
Kuume is 33 years old, married and blessed with one child. He is a farmer and has been in this business for the last five years. His farm is in a productive area, which has proved to be good for maize farming. He learned about Kiva partner, KADET, through a marketing campaign carried out by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his third loan, with which he is planning to buy maize seed and fertilizers.
Kuume hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his child. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land. He is a particular man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Legne Maricel

texts.es:
Legne Maricel tiene 21 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NARCISA DE JESUS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Maricel se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar mas terrenos para seguir trabajando y ayudar a la familia.

Le gusta pasar en la casa con la familia.
texts.en:
Legne Maricel is 21 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their two children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank called “Narcisa de Jesus” is located in the neighborhood of Recinto San Temistocles, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Maricel is a farmer who grows primarily corn. She buys her supplies in Ventanas each month and then sells her products at the fair located in the same area.

Maricel is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and compost. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges she faces include pests, crop diseases, and changes in weather. Her dream is to buy more land so that she can continue working and helping her family.

Maricel enjoys spending time at home with her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
El señor Rogelio tiene 33 años. Es soltero y propietario de una carnicería desde el año 2008, en la ciudad de San Lorenzo..
Se define como un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, especialmente a la hora de cumplir con sus obligaciones. No teme a ningún trabajo, ya que desde pequeño ha tenido que hacerlo. Por medio de su carnicería el logra su sustento y de aquellos que de él dependen, tratando de darse una vida digna y sin privaciones.
El Solicita el crédito para la compra de planchas de carne tanto vacuna como porcina, embutidos y otros. Pues debe cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, ya que ademas de vender en su local, realiza venta al por mayor a pequeñas despensas de la zona con quienes esta logrando un buen trabajo y el aumento en sus ingresos. 
En el futuro desea construir su propio salon en donde pueda instalar su carnicerìa y ahorrar los gastos de alquiler.
texts.en:
Rogelio, 33, is single and has owned a butcher shop since 2008 in the city of San Lorenzo.

He defines himself as a very hard working, responsible man, especially with respect to his obligations.  He’s not afraid of working since he’s had to work since childhood.  Through his butcher shop he’s managed to support himself and help those that depend on him trying to provide a dignified life that’s free of privations.

He is asking for a loan to buy slabs of beef and pork, cured meats and others.  He must be able to meet customer demand because besides selling in his shop he also sells at wholesale to small local stores that he’s establishing good working relationships while increasing his income.  In the future he’d like to build his own locale to set up his butcher shop and save what he spends on rental fees.

loans.use: to buy slabs of beef and pork, cured meats and others.

loans.name: Jesus Enrique

texts.es: El joven Jesús, es soltero no tiene hijos se dedica a la fabricación de puertas corredizas, ventanas, portones, entre otro, aprendió el oficio por ayuda de sus tíos los cuales le enseñaron esta labor, viene trabajando en esta actividad por casi 3 años, el local en cual hace sus trabajos es alquilado, Jesús tiene un desafió que tiene que afrontar que son las lluvias que hacen la zona por donde vive y eso hace que sus herramientas de trabajo se mojen pero el enfrenta este desafió colocando una tolva de tela solo por el momento, es por ello que Jesús esta solicitando el dinero para comprar un techo de eternit para instalarlo en su local, y así evitaría que las lluvias mojen sus herramientas, Jesús tiene muchos sueños uno de ellos es adquirir un local propio y así dejaría de pagar alquiler, y sus ingresos incrementaría con lo cual  mejorar su calidad de vida, Jesús esta muy contento con la confianza que se le esta brindada.
texts.en:
Jesús is single and has no children.  He manufactures sliding doors, windows and gates, among others.  He learned the occupation helping his uncles who taught him this work.  He’s been working at this for almost three years.  

The place where he does his work is leased.  Jesús faces a challenge which is the rain that's common where he lives.  It causes his work tools to get wet.  He answers the challenge by placing a temporary canvas covering but this is only a momentary solution.  Because of this, Jesús is asking for the money to buy an Eternit (registered trademark for fiber cement) roof and install it in his locale to keep the rain from wetting his tools.

Jesús has many dreams.  One of them is to get a place of his own and stop paying rental fees.  His income would increase and this would lead to improved quality of life.  Jesús is very happy because of the trust that’s been placed in him.

loans.use: to buy an Eternit roof for his business to protect himself from the rain.

loans.name: Gulzat's Group

texts.en:
Gulzat is the leader of this group. She is 34 and is married to a construction worker. Together with her husband she brings up five children, three of whom are at school and the other two are preschool age (under seven). Four years ago Gulzat, with an initial investment of 6000 soms, started to sell detergents. With the profits from her trade she opened a small, nice pavilion. At the moment she sells foodstuffs, detergents and beverages. Her business runs well and she earns 11000 soms per month. Gulzat applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to purchase more goods such as macaroni, sugar, soda and juices. In the future Gulzat wants to give her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs, detergents and beverages

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a hard-working father who aims to improve his family's standard of living and give his children a bright future. He is 43 years old and has three school-aged children. He has been engaged in rice farming for almost 15 years, earning a net income of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month. 

To improve his farm's production, he is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and insecticides, as well as to pay for the labor required for rice production. He is hoping that he will obtain a large quantity of rice and increase his income to satisfy his family's needs. 

He believes that he will be successful someday if he continuously strives despite the hardships and difficulties of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides, and to pay for labor required for rice production

location.town: Brgy. Sta. Clara, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Kono Group

texts.en:
Aminata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born 32 years ago in the city of Koidu, Aminata is married and has 2 children.  For 3 years, Aminata has been selling cooking oil, sugar, gari (food made out of cassava roots), margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, pepper, groundnuts, palm oil, rice, etc. Aminata will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business by buying these items in bulk to sell. 

This is the first loan that Aminata and her group members have requested from SMT and Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, gari, margi, onions, pepper, groundnuts, palm-oil, rice, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Emmaculate

texts.en:
Emmaculate is aged 23 and married with two children aged 8 and 1. The first one is already in school. She has been in farming for two years producing horticultural products and coffee.

Emmaculate has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her purchase poultry birds and venture into poultry farming. She says the income will supplement her dairy business and help improve the living standard of her family. She is focusing on attending training to gain more knowledge in farming.

She says that a farmer's challenge remains the lack of knowledge in the farming business.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en: Houssam is a 44-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four school-aged children. He has been working as a professional taxi driver for the past 15 years. His main service route is between his town and the surrounding areas. He also provides private transportation services. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance on his car including improving the car’s body and updating the paint. He states that these improvements will help him attract more customers and therefore increase his business income.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years she has operated a beauty salon business, and her potential customers are neighbours, especially women. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During festive season she gets lots of customers in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase hair chemicals for use in her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase hair chemicals for use in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en: Apolinaria, a 62-year-old single woman, has been raising pigs for six years in the Philippines and earns additional income from operating a sari-sari store. Now requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs, Apolinaria is  working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lourino

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo,  provincia  do mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, solteiro e tem 1 filho que ainda frenquenta a Escola. Fez 10ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais dois sobrinhos que vivem com ele. 

Vive em Boane desde criança e nunca saiu, é funcionário do Governo Provincial de Maputo ha mais de 3 anos e tambem comerciante ha mais de 5 anos e dedica-se a compra e venda de produtos diversos onde tem um salario de 3.500.00mt e um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos  em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu nono emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 26.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (peixe, ovos, amendoim, arroz e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os outros emprestimos foram de: 14.478.00mt, 10.500.00mt, 17.655.00mt, 10.500.00mt, 20.519.00mt, 24.133.00mt, e 20.000.00mt também  para o negocio.
No futuro pretende ampliar a sua actividade comercial, para obter mais rendimento assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Lourino was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. He is unmarried and has one son who goes to school. He went to school through the tenth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family, and also supports two nephews who live with them. 

He's lived in Boane since he was a child and has never left it. He's worked for the provincial government of Maputo for more than three years and has been a businessman for more than five, buying and selling a variety of products. He earns a salary of 3,500 meticals a month and has profits of about 10,000 meticals a month. He uses the money to cover household expenses and is able to save some in his bank account (BIM).
He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his ninth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 26,000 meticals, which he will use to buy products (fish, eggs, peanuts, rice, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise he carries. His other loans were in the amounts of 14,478, 10,500, 17,655, 10,500, 20,519, 24,133, and 20,000 meticals, which he also invested in his business.
He hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to expand his business and earn greater profits in the future.

loans.use: to buy products (fish, eggs, peanuts, rice, etc.) to sell.

loans.name: Leyla Del Socorro

texts.es: Leyla Del Socorro de 48 años, se dedica a una pulpería. Desde hace 9 años  en donde ofrece productos como leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún y bebidas. Su negocio lo ha colocado en su vivienda para su seguridad, con las ganancias que obtenga para cubrir todos sus gastos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Es por eso que ha solicitado un crédito para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio sea más grande y tenga productos más surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en: Leyla Del Socorro, 48, runs a grocery store.  She’s been in business 9 years selling products like milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna and soft-drinks.  Her business is located at home for security and with profits obtained she’s able to cover her expenses and improve her family’s quality of life.  Because of this she’s asking for a loan to buy more merchandise.  Her only goal is that the business is larger and to have more products in stock to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene su actividad que es la venta de carne. Ella tiene su negocio ubicado en el mercado en donde la mayoría de sus clientes conocen su ubicación y saben de los buenos productos que ofrece. Maria Elena solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado y realizar el destace para la venta de carne. En todo este tiempo el negocio le ha permitido tener un ingreso económico, que le facilita poder solventar los gastos de su hogar, con ello apoya a su esposo en la economía. Sueña con ampliar su negocio cada día, para proporcionarle a su hijo lo necesario.
texts.en: Maria Elena's business is the sale of meat. She has a location in the market, and the majority of her customers know where to find her and know what good produce she sells. Maria Elena is seeking he loan to buy livestock for butchery and ultimately for sale. Over time the business has given her an income which helps keep on top of household expenses and supports her husband with their finances. She dreams of increasing her business each day, in order to give her son whatever he needs.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Orn

texts.en: Orn is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of two children who are of the age for attending school. She is a local farmer, cultivating crops such as rice, potatoes and beans. From this business, she is able to earn in the neighborhood of $3.60 per day and tries hard to support her family. Orn would like to borrow some funds from HKL and Kiva to add to her capital to purchase a threshing machine. With the rest of this loan, she will buy more bean seeds for growing. In the future, she will expand her own farmland and grow more crops.

loans.use: to purchase a threshing machine and more bean seeds.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en: Osama is a 34 year-old young man.  He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Osama wants to help his two brothers, who are studying Business and Finance, to pay their university fees, so he needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN.  When Osama gets the loan, he will pay the university fees for his two brothers so that they can continue their studies and get the first university degree.  This enables Osama to create a better future for his brothers. Osama is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay the university fees for his two brothers.

loans.name: Usaha Jaya 11 Group

texts.en:
Nuraini is a mother of two children.  She has been selling cell phone minute refills for two years from her house. Her business is going well and she has a lot of customers. This is her second loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She plans to use this loan to buy more cel phone minute refills to sell. Her husband is a container driver. Her income can contribute to her husband's income to buy food and pay for the children's school fee. She likes selling cell phone minute refills because it is practical and easy even though the income is not too big.

In the future, she hopes she can have a bigger stall and have more customers. By doing this, she hopes she can have enough savings to continuously send her children to school.

Other group members use their loan to improve their business selling clothes on credit and selling nasi uduk.

loans.use: to pay for more cell phone minute refills to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 30-year-old married woman with four children; all of them are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan, for three years.

Regina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Norlyn

texts.en:
Norlyn is married with 2 children. She is 39 years old and lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.
Norlyn owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 6 years. Each month, she earns 5000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 25000 PHP to purchase more stock to sell.
Norlyn has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Norlyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 31 years old.  She is married and has two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a driver for hire.

Dung has earned money by running a general store at her house for four years. Dung intends to use her loan to buy more kinds of products, such as instant food, confectionery, and shampoo to sell from her general store. She hopes that her business runs smoothly, and that this will help to improve her family's living conditions and provide additional income to pay for the eduction of her children.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of products, such as instant food, confectionery, and shampoo to sell from her general store.

loans.name: Wondoima Group-I

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the Wondoima group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting for a loan of 700,000.00 Leones for each in the group in order to expand the size and quality of their respective businesses. In this way, they can make more sales and better profits and consequently improve their living conditions. 
	
The leader of this group is Sia. She is 42 years old. Sia lives and works in Koidu city, together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a building contractor and her children attend primary and secondary schools. For 11 years now, Sia has been selling palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. With the help of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock. 

(Also appearing in this photo is loan officer Edward.)

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Chhin's Group

texts.en: Chhin’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Chhin makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.en:
Ana Luisa lives in Tampico Tamaulipas. She is 22 years old, single, and is studying Mathematics and English. Four years ago she decided to start her own small business selling clothing and accessories to pay for her studies and help her mother. Her great desire to succeed in life has driven Ana Luisa to continue with her project, with the aid and support of her mother and some loans she has received.

Perseverance, strength, and effort are qualities that define Ana Luisa. She needs a loan of $650 USD to be repaid in a 6 month term to buy more merchandise and increase sales. You can help her finish her studies and be part of her success!

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch:

En la localidad de Tampico Tamaulipas vive Ana Luisa, ella tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y estudiante de computación e ingles. Hace cuatro años ella decidió comenzar un pequeño negoció propio de venta de ropa y novedades, con el objetivo de poder solventar los gastos de la escuela y así ayudar a su madre. Las enormes ganas de superarse es lo que ha impulsado a Ana Luisa a continuar con su proyecto, con la ayuda y apoyo de su madre y de algunos préstamos que ha recibido.

Perseverancia, fuerza, entrega, son cualidades que definen a Ana Luisa, ella requiere de un prestamo de $650 dlls con un plazo de 6 meses para pagar y así poder comprar más mercancía e incrementar sus ventas. Ayúdala a terminar sus estudios, se parte de sus logros.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and maize

loans.name: Petrona

texts.en:
Petrona is 29 years old, she has 4 children, and her husband sells corn to people in their community. Petrona has a small store in her house where she sells soft drinks, cookies, soups, sugar, and salt. She also sells containers of gasoline and oil for vehicles. With her loan she hopes to separate the two businesses and therefore have two different sources of income. She is part of the “Clouds Group 8”.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

PETRONA TIENE 29 AÑOS , 4 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MAIZ CON LA GENTE DE LA COMUNIDAD.ELLA TIENE EN SU CASA UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA DE REFRESCOS , GALLETAS , SOPAS, AZUCAR , SAL . ADEMAS TAMBIEN VENDE ENVASES CERRADOS DE GASOLINA Y ACEITES PARA VEHICULOS. ESPERA CON EL PRESTAMO PODER SEPARAR LOS DOS NEGOCIOS Y ASI TENER DOS FUENTES DE INGRESO DIFERENTES. ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPE NUBES 8

loans.use: To separate her grocery store business from her business selling gasoline and oil

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es:
Norma is married and has three daughters. Her husband works as a mason and his revenues vary. Since it is not the most stable form of employment, Norma decided to start her own business in order to help her husband with household expenses. During a rainy season when her husband did not have much work, she actually placed a snack vending business in her home. Over time, she became successful and the business grew. She has many loyal clients, most of whom are her neighbors.

Norma is requesting a $200 loan to purchase merchandise so that she can restock her business and thus be able to offer her customers a greater variety of products. She is committed to paying back the loan within three months. Norma and her family would be very grateful for your support were you to help them improve their standard of living.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es una mujer casada y tiene 3 hijas, su esposo trabaja como albañil y sus ingresos son bajos y variables ya que es un trabajo que no es estable, por ello es que ella decidió poner su negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y mantener a sus tres hijas, en la época que ella empezó con su negocio fue por que eran épocas de lluvia y las obras escaseaban para el trabajo de su marido, por ello fue que puso en su casa un negocio de la venta de frituras, que poco a poco la ha ayudado a salir adelante y comenzó a crecer, teniendo clientes frecuentes que por lo general son sus vecinos.

Norma está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 para comprar mercadería y poder surtir su negocio y así mantener a sus clientes y poder ofrecerles más variedad de productos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en tres meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho tu apoyo para poder salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin F. is a low-income person who is very vulnerable to shifts in the local economy. He is 26 and lives with his parents in the village of Saatli in the south-central plains area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Ramin has a small flock of sheep. He buys lambs and raises them, then in a half year, he sells the sheep in the local market, buys other lambs, and spends the rest of his profit to provide all the necessities of life for his family. The business is very interesting but sometimes demands more funding than he has. Timely investments are important for Ramin. This summer he has applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a loan of US$ 400. He hopes eventually to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy lambs to raise for sale

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy Nikiggude is married with 3 children. For the past seven years she has been selling used clothing, usually t-shirts, skirts and trousers. She will go to the large market in Kampala and buy at a discount and then bring the items back to her village of Mpererwe on the outskirts of Kampala and resell the items outside her home. Often people sell items outside their homes. There is no additional rent and the paths of the villages constantly have foot traffic. And, people in the village support the businesses within their community.

With her loan she plans to buy a bale of used clothes. A bale is usually a weight measure and can contain up to 1,000 used t-shirts. By buying in larger quantities Prossy can get a larger discount and will not have to make as many trips to Kampala. She is new to her lending group and this is her first loan.

loans.use: Prossy plans to use her loan to buy used clothing in larger quantities, bales, to get a better discount.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 52 year old man. He lives in the South Lebanon, in the region of Saida, with his wife and three children. This is the fourth time Ali is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua. Ali owns a store in which he sells auto parts. He needs $1200 to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Nageeb

texts.en: Nageeb lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his own family. He is married with one son. He has a retail shop. He started this business 5 years ago. During this time, he attracted good numbers of customers in Kabul. Now he wants to enlarge his shop, so he requested an individual loan to complete his stock. He wants to make a good monthly income for his family. He is happy with all parts of his family and about this process of loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise and make improvements to her shop

loans.name: Stella's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Stella is a single woman with 4 children, ages 22, 13, 8, and 2 and a half years old. She also takes care of 3 other people, ages 50, 40, and 25 years old. Stella owns a small grocery store, which she started in 1997. Every day, she works from 6am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Isabela, who has a little cafe.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Cupertino

texts.es:
Don Cupertino is a hard-working and loving father. Since his wife decided to leave him along with his two dear children, he has worked hard to provide them the basics so that they can develop fully. In a small shop in his home, he makes spoons and ladles of wood and then, when he finishes his weekly work, he goes to the markets in his city in order to sell his products at reasonable prices. He gets a great reception and, thanks to the income that he generates, his work covers the education expenses of his beloved children.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Don Cupertino es un padre muy trabajador y amoroso, desde que su esposa decidió abandonarlo junto a sus dos queridos hijos se ha esforzado para brindarles lo necesario a fin de que estos puedan desarrollarse plenamente. En un pequeño taller de su hogar elabora cucharas y cucharones de madera y luego de concluir su labor semanal se desplaza a las ferias de su ciudad para ofertar sus productos a precios muy módicos, tiene gran acogida y gracias a las ganacias que le genera su labor satisface los gastos de educación de sus queridos hijos.

loans.use: More capital to acquire new tools and a greater quantity of raw materials.

loans.name: Ky

texts.en:
Mrs. Ky C., 41, and her husband, Mr. Bo Phang, 42, were married in 1986 and have four children; two sons and two daughters. All of their children are in school. Mr. Bo has been a mason for ten years. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Ky has been a farmer for five years. She grows a few different kinds of spinach on her farrm, which is not far from her house. Now she wants to start a new business raising pigs. She is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Asai

texts.en:
Asai A. K., 46, is married with 6 children. She has 5 years of experience in the Food Stall business. She sells to the general public and villagers 5 days per week. Her husband and children help with the business. Asai expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (about US $62).

Asai has had 6 previous loans with SPBD. These loans are her only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of this loan will be used for the children's education and to pay for electricity and water.

loans.use: Purchase more cooking equipment and ingredients.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel A. sells drinks. He is married, but his wife's income from her barbershop does not provide enough additional support for Daniel and his three children. He has a popular business, and is asking for additional capital to expand and increase his profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Vay

texts.en:
Vay S., 44, is married and lives with four of her children in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She also has two children who are married and no longer live at home. She and her husband are pictured in front of their home.

Vay S. sells Khmer noodles in the village and earns about $5 each day; her husband has a business selling firewood and also earns $5 each day.

Vay S. will use her loan to replace the hand-tractor's tire and to purchase land where she can grow rice and raise domestic animals. She hopes this will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To replace the hand-tractor's tire and purchase land to grow rice and raise animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing to sell in the community

loans.name: Afi

texts.en: Afi M. sells fish which she buys from fishermen, brings home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Enyaaye near Elmina. Afi has received no formal education.  She is a single parent and has 6 children Afi has been selling fish since 1978. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale to meet her ever-increasing customer demands. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into the business to increase sales, which will eventually increase her income.

loans.use: Buy more fish for sale to meet her ever-increasing customer demands.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is a 41 year-old man who lives in a small village near Saida in southern Lebanon. He is a carpenter and hopes to purchase additional wood for his business. He also wants to pay the school fees for his children. He is requesting a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to cover his expenses. This is the fourth time that he has requested a loan from Al Majmoua and has always paid on time.

loans.use: To purchase wood and pay his children's school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
La Sra. Fidelina G. es madre soltera de 3 hijos, ya todos mayores de edad. Logró salir adelante sola y con mucho esfuerzo.
 La misma comenta que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de verduras y frutas en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de  Itá, labor que realizó durante 30 años. Dicha tarea era muy esforzada  debido a  que se trasladaba desde una de las compañías lejanas hasta la ciudad en transporte público cargando con sus mercaderías. Fue por eso que decidió abrir su propio negocio comercial en su domicilio y terminar de esa forma con tantos años de sacrificio.
Fidelina posee una despensa muy bien surtida de la que compran mercaderías todos los vecinos del lugar. Es una señora muy amable que gracias al buen trato y cortesía con que trata a sus clientes, ha logrado formar una muy buena clientela.
Necesita de un préstamo para ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercaderías tales como: bebidas y alimentos balanceados para animales ya que en la zona existe mucha gente que se dedica a la ganadería y cría de animales de granja y hay una gran demanda de estos productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fidelina Gammara is a single mother of 3 children, all of them are adults now. She was able to succeed by herself working very hard. She used to sell vegetables and fruits at the municipal market of the city of Ita for 30 years. This was very hard work because she used to commute from a very far away town to the city carrying on her supplies on public transportation. This is why she decided to open her store at home and stop this way with all those years of commuting. Fidelina has a very well stocked grocery store, and all her neighbors buy from her. She is a very gentle lady and her good manners have brought her a large number of customers. She needs a loan to increase her business buying beverages, good for animals as many people work on cattle raising around the area.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages and food for animals

loans.name: Sayed Abdullqudos

texts.en:
Sayed Abdullqodus is an old man with lots of experience, though he is uneducated. He works in agriculture and has been involved in this business for more than 8 years, working with his family during this time. He has some land, but he would love to have more. To buy more land, he needs extra money. Therefore, he requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to buy new land and start growing crops on it.

He is a professional man and, from the moment when he started his business, he has always wanted to improve his business. In the town where he lives, when any of the agricultural men face any difficulties, they come and ask Sayed to help with their problems.

He is grateful for this loan process. He wants to say that it is his first loan and it is really great, especially for agricultural workers. He wants to continue his partnership and encourage other workers to use this loan service.

loans.use: Buying seeds and completing his stock

loans.name: Ogieva

texts.en: Ogieva O. is 38 years old and married with five children. She sells provisions which she uses to support her family. Her five children are in school and they are doing quite well. Ogieva plans to increase her stocks so as to make more profit to support her family. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva and all its lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Ambè Alako (Nous Suivons Dieu) Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Ambé alako  sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier médina Koura  de la  ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali). 
Elles se sont  connues à travers des liens  de voisinage et pour la pratique de la même activité. Elles exercent comme activité principale la vente de poissons fumés, de tubercules et de légumes. 
Dans le souci de conserver leur clientèle  en leur offrant  des services de qualité  et en mettant à leur disposition des produits en quantité, le groupe Ambé alako a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son troisième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
 Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter  des cartons  de poissons fumés, des sacs de manioc, de patate et d’igname. Elles s’approvisionnent en poissons à Mopti, et en tubercules à partir de Sikasso. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 110 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Ambé Alako are all married and average 28 years of age and 3 children each. They live in large traditional extended families in the Médina Koura district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They know one another by neighborhood ties, and their main work involves selling smoked fish, tubers, and vegetables.

Wanting to retain their customers by offering them quality services and by making large quantities of goods available to them, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their third solidarity loan (group loan). The first two loans have been repaid.

The women plan to use this loan to buy boxes of smoked fish and sacks of cassava, potatoes, and yams. Supplies of fish are gotten in Mopti, and the tubers are gotten from Sikasso.

They each hope to realize an average profit of 110,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to pay the loan interest, to provide for the extended family, and to invest the rest in their work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy smoked fish and tubers

loans.name: Apuu

texts.en:
Apuu M. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Apuu is 39 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has no children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her green vegetable business

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Mrs. Regie J. is 25 years old, married, and blessed with one child. Her husband is presently working as a gas station attendant. She is also operating a sari-sari store from their residence. She started the business from the capital given to her parents. Her mother, already a member at the Co-op, had encouraged her daughter to join Paglaum in order to obtain additional capital for the business, as well as because of some of the benefits it provides, particularly insurance.

Mrs. J. received Php 5,000.00 as her first loan. She used the money to buy additional grocery items, such as assorted canned goods, bath and laundry soap, seasonings, and beverages.

She’s hoping that someday her business will expand and become a mini grocery, that all of her future kids can finish school, and that she can build a concrete house for the family.

loans.use: Buying additional grocery items for the store

loans.name: Martha Ines

texts.es: La señora Martha Ines M., tiene la edad de 53 años, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, es viuda y con cinco hijos, tres de ellos trabajan y dos estudian, su negocio es la venta de ropa, y alquila cuarto tiene seis años de administrar su venta ella inicio con fondos propios. Este es su séptimo ciclo en Afodenic y ha sido de muchos beneficios para su vida personal como para su negocio. Con este crédito va a comprar ropa interior para seguir ofertando a sus clientes y poder seguir captando clientes.
texts.en:
Martha Ines M. is 53 years old and lies in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. She is a widow with 5 children; three of them work and two study. Her business is selling clothing. She rented out a room and has been running her business, which she started with her own money, for 6 years. This is her seventh loan with Afodenic and the loans have benefited her both in her personal life as well as in her business. With this loan she will buy lingerie so she can keep offering goods to her customers and continue to get clients.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena O. is 45 years old. She is married and has given birth to eleven children: nine sons and two daughters. She says that some of her children are out of school and working. Others are currently in senior high, junior high, and primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is unemployed due to old age. Abena is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. She prepares the food in her place of residence and sells on the street in the morning and afternoons. She procures bags of maize and other ingredients from nearby towns. Abena has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business so she can give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
"I have been helping my husband raise our pigs. This has been our livelihood since we got married and had children. Piggery is a profitable business. I enjoy taking care of our pigs so much so much and earning an income for our family," says Elisa L., a 50-year-old mother of nine children.

Elisa is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase feed for the pigs. The loan will also help her whole family to expand their businesses and increase their income.

CEVI is reaching out to people to sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides its clients not just with loans, but also with training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia N. is 38 years old and married with two children. She has operated a clothing business for more than 20 years. She is using the loan to purchase more clothing for her shop to meet customer demand. She is a hardworking lady whose future plan is to improve her business and buy more clothing products to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for her shop to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca P. is from the village of Sto. Ñino, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 64 years old, married, and has five adult children. Rebecca owns and operates a clothing-sales business, primarily selling clothes in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita J. is a 50-year-old persistent and courageous woman working to step out from poverty. She is married to Domingo, a 64-year-old jeepney driver. She is a mother to three sons; two are of legal age already and the youngest is 13 years old.

In 2006, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines with the hope of having access to capital for her business. She invested her previous loans in the buy and sell of charcoal and a Sari-sari Store (General Store). But years ago, she opted to invest in a jeepney which until now serves as her primary business.

Now on her 6th loan, she proposes the amount of 30,000 pesos to pay for sacks of charcoal and maintenance of their jeepney (purchase tires, renewal of licenses, etc.). She is hopeful that their business would bring her good income to sustain the needs of her family. She dreams sending her youngest child to college until he finds job.

loans.use: To pay for sacks of charcoal and maintenance of their jeepney (purchase tires, renewal of licenses, etc.)

loans.name: Loh

texts.en:
M. sells fish door to door. Every day, she gets up in the early dawn and hurries to the riverside to wait for the arrival of the fishing boats. She then makes haste to the market, where she sells her wares at suitable retail prices.

M., age 49, is the mother of four children. Her husband is 55 years old and works as a motor taxi driver, making approximately $3 per day. Three of their children are still young and living with them, and one is married.

She sometimes gets to the market on her bicycle and sometimes rides there with her husband, if he is not working. This makes for unpredictable transport, which has been the cause of some difficulty. For this reason, M. has decided to take out a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike to serve as her business transportation.

She is driven solely by her wish that her children someday may have the opportunity to attain university degrees.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her business transportation to and from the market

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: LA SEÑORA TIENE A SU CARGO LA MANUTENCION D. SU HOGAR QUIEN APORTA ECONOMICAMENTE Y CON MUCHO ESFUERZO SUTENTA A SU FAMILIA COMO JEFE DEL D. SU HOGAR, EL ESPOSO EN ESTE MOMENTO SE ENCUENTRA SIN TRABAJO. LA ACTIVIDAD D. LA SRA. GLADYS ES EL D. LA REPOSTERIA (ELABORACION D. TODO TIPO D. PASTELES), ESTA ACTIVIDAD LA REALIZA EN SU DOMICILIO, PARA LUEGO VENDERLA EL LOS DIFERENTES COLEGIOS D. SU ZONA, SIEMPRE CON LA COLABORACION D. SUS ESPOSO.
texts.en:
Ms. Q. is in charge of supporting her family as the head of the household after much hard work because her husband is currently unemployed. Ms. Q. runs a confectionery business in which she makes all kinds of cakes. She makes these cakes at home, then sells them at the different schools throughout her community. Her husband always collaborates with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home expansion and refurbishment, and purchase ingredients to make cake

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Living in a sugarcane plantation, locally known as a "hacienda", and earning a living as a hacienda worker is hard because you need to wake up very early around 4:30 AM to perform backbreaking work for very low wages with very little benefits. What's worse, the work is seasonal - usually work is available only from October to April, and then when sugar milling season starts, from May to September, work in the hacienda is intermittent at best.

This was the experience of Nancy F., a 38 year-old, who is married to Berdandin F., a 46 year-old. A few years back, Berdandin stopped working in the hacienda and started selling ice buko (frozen young coconut meat and juice) around their community because it earned more income than working for a daily wage in the sugar cane fields.

Seeing how much income her husband earned selling ice buko, Nancy joined in the efforts. She soon had many loyal customers in the local school, market and nearby villages. As demand for her product grew, Nancy's business became limited by her working capital. This made her decide to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 so that she could access the microcredit line, so that she could increase her selling capacity.

The loans she received from NWTF-Project Dungganon helped her to increase their income capacity. In addition to her ice buko business, Nancy also saw the opportunity to earn additional income by selling rice to her neighbors in the hacienda and neighboring villages. Later, she also bought a motorcycle, on installment, for her husband to provide transportation services. The vehicle is called "habal-habal"; it is a single motorcycle that can carry multiple passengers at a time, although it could be hired on a per trip basis to carry only one or two passengers or a load of goods. The motorcycle will be fully-paid in a few months time.

Nancy is happy with how her life is going. Her only child, who is now 17 years old is attending college and has a bright future. Her family's quality of life has greatly improved from the poverty that they previously experienced; all because they worked hard and concerted all their efforts towards the goal of moving out of poverty.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To increase their income capacity.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en: Salt is a very in-demand condiment in all households and is a very salable commodity. But making salt is not as easy as it seems. Yes, all you need to do is leave sea water under the intense heat of the sun, wait until all the water evaporates, and then all you need to do is gather and pack the crystal residue into sacks and haul it off to the market to sell. It may sound like such a laid-back job but when you factor in what havoc even just a little rain could do to the end-product, then it wouldn't sound so easy anymore. This is the business of Cecil C., a 52-year-old married woman who lives in the village of Tabao Baybay, San Enrique, Negros Occidental. Her husband, Jose, helps her with her business. They have four adult children: the oldest, who is 30 years old, already has a family; the two middle children are gainfully employed and help with the family expenses; while the youngest, who has also finished college, is still looking for a job. Cecil and her husband, Jose, have been in the salt business for over fifteen years, and they have persevered in spite of the many problems they have encountered along the way. They pushed on, traveling from town to town to sell their product, even when it just earned enough to pay for the basic household expenses with some left over for the education of their four children. But when their children were nearing college age, Cecil knew that if she did not increase her income, it would certainly not be enough to send the children to get their higher education. This was her motivation in joining NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000. The additional capital provided by each loan enabled them to increase their income and afford the college education of their children. Cecil now earns PHP 9,000 average monthly income for all her efforts, and is a big help to the family. The last time she borrowed from NWTF-Project Dungganon, her loan was PHP 12,000, and she used it as additional capital and it earned a good income. She paid each installment on time and fully paid the loan within its term. Now for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 that she intends to use as working capital for her salt-making business. In the attached picture, Cecil and Jose pose in front of a few sacks of salt they are readying to sell. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as working capital for salt making

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie N. is 31 years old, married with 6 children aged between 6 months and 13 years.  Marie lives in the northern province of Rwanda, Nyarwondo center where she has a shop in which she sells a variety of goods plus potatoes. Marie has been an entrepreneur selling a variety of goods in her shop for the past 10 years. She employs 3 people in her business. Her shop is open from 6AM to 4PM every day.

Marie is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose expanding her shop through purchasing some additional goods for sale which she hopes will serve her existing customers better and perhaps attract new ones as well.  With this loan, Marie expects that her business will make additional profits.  With this extra money, she hopes to improve her life situation.

loans.use: More merchandise for her store

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Kotognogontala sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à KAMALEN SIRAKORO un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
 Elles font la vente  de condiments alimentaires, de savons,  de chaussures,  de poissons fumés etc.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire. Le précédent s’est bien dénoué
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3 colis  de condiments alimentaires, 1sac de 100kg de savons traditionnels, 12 douzaines de paires de chaussures en plastique et  35kg de poissons fumés. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent dans les marchés de KAMALEN SIRAKORO, de façon ambulante  et à domicile, au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members of the Kotognogontala group are mostly married women averaging 30 years of age and 3 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Kamalen Sirakoro, one of the villages in Sikasso, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They sell food condiments, soaps, shoes, smoked fish, etc.

They work with Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. They are seeking their second solidarity loan (group loan). The first one went well.

With the new loan, they intend to buy 3 boxes of food condiments, one sack of 100 kg of traditional soaps, 12 dozen pairs of plastic shoes, and 35 kg of smoked fish.

They get their supplies at the market in Sikasso, as well as in the surrounding villages. They sell at the markets in Kamalen Sirakoro, as ambulant saleswomen and at home, for cash and often on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

They foresee turning a monthly profit of XOF 23'500 (ca US$ 55) each, to be in part saved and used for the family expenses. The other part will be reinvested in their businesses. They count on increasing their working capital to better meet customer demand, and better provide for their families.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 boxes of food condiments, one sack of 100 kg of traditional soaps, 12 dozen pairs of plastic shoes, and 35 kg of smoked fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Building a wall around his house

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia ISABEL es una humilde madre de familia que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

La socia tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos varones. Ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la crianza de pollos y después los vende. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que va sacar adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más pollos para luego venderlos en las ferias del Cusco.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The partner ISABEL is a humble mother who belongs to the community bank "VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA".

The partner is 42 years old, married, with four sons. She lives in the district of San Jerónimo in the community of Angostura located south of the town of Cusco. The partner takes care of her home as well as breeds chickens which she sells. She has been working her business for several years and has done well thanks to her enthusiasm. Our partner is a working and entrepreneurial mother who will make her family get ahead. The partner requires a loan to buy chickens to sell at the markets of Cusco.

The partner is grateful for this opportunity and she promises to repay punctually

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The partner requires the loan to buy chickens to be sold at markets in Cusco.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 25 years old, single and makes a living selling cooked rice, yam and fufu. Fufu is prepared from cassava and plantain, which are pounded together, cooked, and then eaten with different kinds of soup. It is a very popular traditional food among the Ashanti tribe of Ghana, and can be breakfast, lunch or supper. Ruth has applied for a loan to buy more raw materials, such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise her income and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Evelyn's Group

texts.en: Evelyn P. is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Evelyn is from the village of Barangay Lantap, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 49 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Evelyn owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 7th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a stock of drinks and food products for his store

loans.name: Loep

texts.en:
