Mrs. Loep A. is 49 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She is married to Karya, 53, who is a security officer in the district. She currently takes care of three kids and another two are married and live away from home. Four of the children are employed in different fields. Loep A. was not available at photo time so her husband is pictured instead.

Loep A. earns a living as a clothes seller, selling both men’s and ladies’ clothes at the market. From her business, she is able to earn an average of US$3 per day.

Loep A. will be using her first loan to decorate her house which she will rent to guests for a fee.

loans.use: To decorate her house in order to rent it to guests

loans.name: Nub

texts.en:
Nub S., age 45, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has three children. Her husband is a farmer and also breaks stone at the mountain for sale, earning an income of US$2.5 per day.

S. is engaged in a business of weaving Cambodian traditional silk, earning approximately an income of US$1.3 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially for the children’s education. She has been with this business since 2000. Her family's standard of living has improved since S. started this business, so she wants a loan to expand her business. S. is requesting a loan of USD $600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner. (S. is pictured with her husband)

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband's commute

loans.name: Mr. Mao Un Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mr. Mao U. is the leader of a twelve-person group in Prek P. village in Kandal province. He was selected by all the members. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to support his family; his wife, Mrs. Bong Lis, sells recycled goods. But their field has infertile soil and is far from the irrigation system so Mr. Mao U. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline so he can get to the water he needs. He is the father of five children — two do farming and the others are enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela, de 48 años, vive en su casa propia  con su hija Pamela  (20) y su nieto Cristopher (3).Desde hace 2 años, se dedica a la venta de medias y lencería, pero es comerciante hace muchos años atrás , antes tenia un puesto de venta de verduras, al cual tuvo que renunciar porque padeció de una enfermedad que no le permitía hacer mucho esfuerzo físico y  esa labor  requería cargar costales y acomodarlos. Es así que optó por una labor más tranquila y que pudiera realizarla durante las tardes, ya que  también cuida a su nieto por las mañanas. Su forma de trabajo la realiza de la siguiente manera, ofrece  su mercadería de casa en  casa a sus vecinas y amigas, luego ellas le hacen los  pedidos de las prendas que les gustaron. Después de unos días trae con seguridad la cantidad y el modelo que ellas escogieron haciendo una venta segura. En el  futuro tiene planeado instalar  un bazar en su casa y en el  desarrollo de este proyecto también la ayudará su hija.Es su primer préstamo y promete ser muy puntual con el pago de sus  cuotas, además agradece a todas aquellas personas que hicieron posible el dinero del crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando.Graciela tiene pensado invertir  el dinero solicitado  en la  compra de mayor cantidad de medias, pues ya tiene varios pedidos que cumplir.
texts.en:
Graciela is 48 years old. She lives in her own home with her daughter Pamela (20) and her grandson Cristopher (3). For the last two years, she has been selling socks and lingerie, but she has been a merchant for many years. Previously, she had a stall selling vegetables. She had to give this up because she suffered from a disease that didn't allow her to exert herself very much physically and that job required picking up and arranging sacks. This is why she decided on a job that was calmer and that she could do afternoons, since she also takes care of her grandson mornings. She works in the following way: she offers her merchandise door to door to her neighbors and friends. Later they order the clothes that they like. After a few days guaranteed, she brings the quantity and style that they have chosen and she makes a guaranteed sale. in the future she plans on having a convenience store in her house and her daughter will also help develop this project. This is her first loan and she promises to make her payments very punctually. In addition, she is very grateful to all the people who made the money for this loan possible, which will allow her to keep working. Graciela is planning on investing the requested money in buying alarger quantity of socks, since she has several orders to fill.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy merchandise in a variety of socks.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is a thirty-seven-year-old married lady. To earn a living, she sells charcoal to people who live near her home. She has been in this business for five years. She says that her business turnover is high because charcoal is the cheapest cooking fuel in the area. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, her business has expanded because she can access loans. She saves her money with a group under Faulu Kenya named Winners, which enables her to access loans because the members guarantee each other. She has limited stock and yet high demand, therefore, she has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Faulu Kenya to increase her stock of charcoal.

loans.use: To increase her stock of charcoal

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es:
El  Señor. JOSE DOLORES R., Labora como Supervisión de Limpieza en el Mercado Oriental de Managua.
Ella tiene un hijo a su cargo, y   este se encuentra en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado diez  créditos con CEPRODEL durante diez años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los diez  créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, hierro, cemento y piedrin para la construcción de dos paredes   de su casa de habitación ya que estas se encuentran en mal estado. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
El Señor. JOSE DOLORES R., Labora como Supervisión de Limpieza en el Mercado Oriental de Managua. Ella tiene un hijo a su cargo, y este se encuentra en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado diez créditos con CEPRODEL durante diez años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los diez créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, hierro, cemento y piedrin para la construcción de dos paredes de su casa de habitación ya que estas se encuentran en mal estado. Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 46-year-old man who owns a curio shop. He also does farming to earn a living. He has employed seven people in his curio shop so that he can concentrate on farming. 

He belongs to Turitu Uwezo group, where he saves his money on weekly basis. The group members have guaranteed him a loan of Kes. 50,000. With this loan, he wants to add raw materials for making curios, such as stones for carving and beads. He hopes to improve his living standards in the future.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as stones for carving and beads

loans.name: John

texts.en: John K. W. is 28 years old, married and has one child aged two years. For the last seven years, he has been involved in a transport business in a residential area in Thika. He says the business is good; the only major challenge is that during the rainy seasons he is unable to do much business since the bad roads make some areas inaccessible. He is using his loan of KES 50,000 to buy another motorcycle to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to have another child and to give his children quality education. He also plans to buy a matatu (a share taxi) and a plot of land and build rental houses. He describes himself as cheerful, hardworking and very patient.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is married with two adult children. She has a small business selling bed linen, pajamas, and bath robes at the central market in Kahovka town. Olena started this business 22 years ago. This business has been the main source of income for Olena's family, allowing her to raise her children and provide for her family's needs.

Today she has 3 small locations that sell inventories. She works at one location herself and provides work for two more people. Olena would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to increase the assortment of goods. She has used small business loans before and found them very instrumental for her business development.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 26 years old and a mother of one.  She has been operating a salon for two years. She was previously employed. Grace went into business because her income was not enough to raise her child, who is 3 years old.  She has managed to grow her business and has employed one person.  

She was introduced to a group in Faulu Kenya, where she saves her money on weekly basis.  In this group, she can be guaranteed a loan from Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy hair chemicals and a hair dryer.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and a hair dryer

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en: In Kampeaeng Tboung village in Takeo province has a person, Mrs. Somaly R. was born in 1965. She owns a general store in local village where she can earn a large profit to support her family while her husband, Mr. Yun Vorng, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. They all try to work hard but they can earn less income. So to improve her family living, Mrs. Somaly R. is seeking for a loan to buy some piglets, pig food for breeding to start a new business and rest of the loan she buys more groceries to resale, fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factory, while the other is studying in school. Her husband is taken the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy some piglets, pig food for breeding to start a new business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita T. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old and married with eight school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita has a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily-use products. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Lolita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Benetha Group

texts.en:
Benetha B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Benetha Group'. Benetha is 40 years old, single and has seven children who range from 22 to 4 years old. She was not able to attend school due to poverty. All of her children are attending school. She cares for one sibling.

For 10 years, Benetha has been selling oil, salt, tomatoes, beans, rice, and peppers in Sayon Town Market on Bushrod Island in Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 50,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more oil, salt, tomatoes, beans, rice, and peppers. She describes herself as determined.

Her goal is to improve her business and continue to educate her children. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Samuel F. is inset because he was absent during the meeting.

loans.use: To buy more oil, salt, tomatoes, beans, rice, and peppers

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a married woman with two children: one attending school and the other one still too young for school. Zainab lives in her own house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. Her husband is a driver by profession and he contributes to meet the family's basic needs. 

Zainab has been selling fried potatoes for over one year. She sells from home to the neighboring community and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. With this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a sack of potatoes. She hopes that in future she will open a hotel (restaurant) and attract many customers. She decided to join Yehu so as to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of potatoes

loans.name: Uok's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people who live in Preaek Reang village, Kandal province.  Uok P. is 65 years old and is the group's leader.  Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

Uok is married with five children; two are security guards and three work as seamstresses in a garment factory.  Her husband, Eng On, 70, stays at home.

Uok supports her family by selling Khmer noodles. In order to increase her income, Uok decided to ask for a loan to buy and resell groceries.

loans.use: Buy more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita L., 57, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is mother to two young hard-working adults who are currently enrolled in high school. By the grace of God, Nenita has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually send both of her children all the way through college.

Nenita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at a wholesale price and selling by piece rate. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Nenita dreams to be able to renovate her house soon, with all of the work with her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products such as groceries, toiletries and beverages, to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold B., from the village of Balintawak, Mambajao, Camiguin Province, is 30 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Arnold owns and operates a service-based business providing motorela or tricycle services to local community members. Engaged in his business for over two years, he earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Arnold joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting his first loan for 5000 PHP to purchase tools for the maintenance of his tricycle, he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools for tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica S. is from the village of Villa Sudiacal, Baybay Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 52 years old and married,with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Monica sells health and medicinal products in the local community. Monica has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Monica joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Monica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to purchase additional products to sell. Monica is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Monica from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Liloy-Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov C. is 29, married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Pre-Angkorian Temple. C. sells vegetables, earning an income of about $3 a day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of $2 a day. C. has to spend $60 on food, $5 on electricity and water supplies, and $45 on other necessary expenses every month.  C. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “EL AMANECER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Americo; el tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de huevos de codorniz, el tiene unas carretas en diferentes mercados donde vende los huevos que pueden ser sancochados o crudos, el vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, el socio quiere mejorar el negocio. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar huevos de codorniz y también mejorar las carretas donde vende los huevos.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank “El Amanecer” (The Dawn); the bank is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Americo; he is 32 years old, has a partner and 1 child. The member alternates his daily activities with his business of selling quail eggs. He has several carts in various markets where sells the eggs which can be eaten boiled or raw. He also sells as a street vendor from 6:00 am until 5:00 pm. Mr. Americo wants to improve his business. He is requesting a loan to buy quail eggs and to improve the carts where he sells the eggs.

The member is grateful to those who contribute to his dream through this channel, and commits himself to make his payments during the established period.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to buy quail eggs and to improve the carts where he sells the eggs.

loans.name: Gloria Emelina

texts.es:
doña Gloria S. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en el barrio cabañas de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de pollo frito en una glorieta del mercado Concepcion de Choluteca., Gloria es una mujer trabajadora.
Gloria es madre de 2 hijas ya grandes y que viven con ella toda via.
Gloria se levanta a las 4 de la mañana todos los dias para preparar los pollos que va a vender durante todo el dia.
los prepara en su casa y en la glorieta los frie para venderlos acabados de freir, calientes y con mejor sabor.
sus hijas le ayudan con las tareas en la casa,.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de pollos al por mayor.
sus tiempos libres los dedica a visitar familiares y visitar la iglesia.
texts.en:
Gloria S. is 49 years old.  She lives in the Cabañas neighborhood of the city of Choluteca.  She sells fried chicken in a small square in Concepción de Choluteca market.  Gloria is a hard-working woman.

Gloria has two daughters who are already grown up but still live with her.  She gets up every day at 4.00am to prepare the chickens that she will sell during the day.  She prepares the chickens in her home and then fries them in the square so that she can sell them just fried, warm and with a better flavor.  Her daughters help her with the housework.

Gloria will use her loan to buy chickens wholesale.  In her spare time she visits family members and goes to church.

loans.use: To buy chicken, oil, tortillas, soft drinks, bread, tomato sauce and French fries

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana  C., de 23 años de edad; es una mujer muy trabajadora. Vive en una casa alquilada junto a su pareja Jhon Yucra de 28 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio de Yovana es la venta de ropa, negocio que es muy frecuentado por sus clientes ya que se le considera una persona muy atenta, y siempre esta dispuesta aconsejar a sus clientes sobre el tipo de prenda que debe elegir, de esa manera ellos puedan estar satisfechos con la compra. En esta actividad lo desarrolla a lado de su pareja, trabajando sin para desde hace 05 años. Su negocio es muy rentable por que esta situado en la avenida principal de su ciudad y eso le da mucha ventaja ya que hay mucha afluencia de gente. Su plan a futuro es alquilar un espacio más en el centro comercial, de esa manera logrará aumentar sus ganancias. Este es su 11avo crédito con MFP y asegura que no dejará de pagar sus cuotas, En su banco comunal es una socia muy admirada por su trabajo y por lo puntual que es en sus pagos. Con los 2000 mil que solicita, implementará su negocio con variedad de prendas de vestir, así podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Yovana C. is 23 years old and is a very hardworking woman. She lives in a rented house together with her partner Jhon Yucra, who is 28, and her three dear children to whom she desires to give a better quality of life. Yovana's business is a clothing store and it is frequented often by her clients who consider her a very attentive person. She is always available to consult with her customers about the type of clothing that they should choose. In this way they can be satisfied with their purchase. She has worked non-stop to develop this business along with her partner for the past five years. Her business is very profitable because it is situated on the principal avenue of her city and this gives her a big advantage because there are a lot of affluent people in this area. Her plan for the future is to rent a space closer to the commercial center. In this way she will be able to augment her earnings. This is her 11th loan with MFP and she assures that she will not fail to repay the loan. In her communal bank she is a very admired member due to her work and her punctual loan payments. With the 2000 soles she is seeking she will purchase a variety of clothing to keep up with the demand of her customers.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of clothing to keep up with the demand of her clients.

loans.name: Perfecto Alberto

texts.es:
Perfecto Alberto C. M. tiene 65 años de edad. Es soltero, Vive con la hija en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene un hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las blancas Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Perfecto Alberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder remodelar la casa.

Le gusta conversar con las amigas.
texts.en:
Perfecto Alberto Cedeno M. is 65 years old. He is single and he lives with his daughter in the city of Ventanas, in the Los Rios Province. He has one daughter.

The communal bank named "November 26" is located in the community of Las Blancas and it belongs to the city of Ventanas. This group is dedicated to short-cycle agriculture, planting corn and rice. They have practiced this business for a long time. 

Perfecto Alberto is an agriculturist who has been sowing corn and rice for the past 5 years. He makes his purchases from Agripac, and he carries out his sales in the fair at Ventanas. 

He requests a loan to purchase agricultural products and fertilizers to cultivate corn and rice.  The support of this loan will help him financially to provide for his needs, and to face challenges such as plagues, disease, and the changing weather. His dream is to renovate his house.

He enjoys chatting with friends.

loans.use: To purchas agricultural products and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mat

texts.en:
Mrs. Mat Y. lives in Prey Bay village in Takeo province and she was born in 1969. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. The dry season is the time for growing rice, so she needs some money to support this business.

Mrs. Mat Y. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to hire farm laborers. She will use the rest of the loan to add to her savings to buy a cow for breeding and start a new business. Her husband, Mr. Nat Mouv, is a laborer who is able to earn some money to support his family, too. Through this activity, the couple is raising three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, but the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to hire farm laborers.

loans.name: Ada Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Ada Ruth H. tiene 46 años de edad, vive en el barrio el Mangallano de la ciudad de San Lorenzo y se dedica a la venta de refrescos en diferentes tamaños.
Ada es madre de cuatro hijos y esta casada con el señor Marco Antonio Rodas.
tiene 15 años de vivir en dicho lugar y dos de sus hijos ya se graduaron y los otros dos continuan estudiando.
su esposo le ayuda a cubrir los gastos del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de refrescos al por mayor ya que en esta epoca se vende mucho el refresco helado debido al gran calor que se mantiene en la zona.
 
Ada es una mujer tranquila, responsable y con deseos de salir adelante.
en un futuro desea remodelar su negocio y comprar mas freezers o refrigeradoras para tener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Ms. Ada Ruth H. is 46 years old. She lives in the Mangallano neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo. She works selling soda of various sizes. Ada is a mother to 4 children and is married to Mr. Marco Antonio Rodas. She has lived in the same place for 15 years and two of their children have already graduated and the other two are continuing their studies. 

Her husband helps cover the home expenses. She will use the loan to buy wholesale soft drinks since at this time much soda is sold frozen because of the great heat that remains in the area.

Ada is a very laid back woman who is responsible and wants to succeed. In the future she wants to remodel her business and buy more freezers or refrigerators to earn a greater income.

loans.use: To buy wholesale soft drinks of different sizes: 1/2, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5 and 3 liters

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a butcher shop.  Her husband Romeo, who is 62 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living.  They have four children who are between 27 and 36 years old. Letecia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Letecia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000 uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to buy meat for her business so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Letecia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: As additional working capital for her butcher shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, toothpaste and salt to sell.

loans.name: Seap

texts.en:
Mrs. Seap was born in 1966. She is a widow with three children who are seamstresses in garment factories. She is a farmer who owns a 1.50-hectare plot of land where she grows rice. Part of the rice yield she sells and the rest is for her family. She is a farming laborer. 

In the rice field, she has a problem because her field has infertile soil. So to improve her rice production, Mrs. Seap is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide, and with the rest of the loan, she is going to plow her field in the dry season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide

loans.name: Arbak

texts.en: Arbak S. lives in Shamb community in Syunik region. He works at a hydro power plant. Arbak and his family are engaged in agriculture. He has a small cattle farm and apple orchid. Arbak also has his own land and wants to develop his farm, but he hasn’t got the financial means to purchase high quality seeds. It is not the first time that Arbak has borrowed from SEF. With the requested loan, he plans to buy seeds and develop his farm.

loans.use: to pay for seeds.

loans.name: Aunty

texts.en: Aunty S. is married with five children. Her husband is a security guard. For the past 10 years, Aunty S. has been making and selling kenkey, which is a popular Ghanaian staple made from fermented corn dough. Alongside her kenkey business, she also runs a provisions stall, where she sells food items such as salt and condensed milk, as shown in the photograph. Her income helps supplement her husband’s earnings, and she contributes to the payment of household expenses. She would like to increase her provisions business and so will use the loan to purchase more provisions to sell. She plans to build a provisions shop from her increased capital.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is single and 18 years old. He is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 50,000 for each crop. John is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to pay for the laborers working on his farm and to buy fertilizers. John grows corn and has been doing this for two years. He wishes to expand his business farm site by purchasing land someday to help his parents improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for laborers

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married and has two children. Ali has run a cafeteria and a playing hall since 2009. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area. He is requesting a $2,000 loan to renovate his shop and buy a refrigerator. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
CAROLINA
La  señora  Carolina necesita un segundo crédito para la inversión D.  compra D. regalos  ya que por el mes D. mayo  celebran el di a D. la  madre y así mismo  variar mas sus ventas con venta D. arreglos D. globo y florales  porque su negocio queda en el centro D. la aldea y es muy buscada para esas fechas y también invertir otra parte en la venta D. tortillas que tiene en su casa  y así mismo poder comprar  maíz , leña y también en la compra D. un comal , y poder tener un ingreso extra vendiendo  granizadas fuera D. su casa su mayor deseo es siempre seguir creciendo  en sus diversas ventas  y así mismo sacar adelante a sus hijos que aun estudian  en las escuelas locales.
texts.en:
CAROLINA

Carolina needs a second loan to buy gifts because Mother’s Day is celebrated in the month of May and she wants to vary her sales with balloon and floral arrangements because her business is located in the center of the village and is quite sought after on these dates.  She also wants to invest another part in the tortilla sales she does at home.  She wants to buy corn, firewood and also a griddle and she’d like to be able to earn extra income selling "granizadas" (shaved ice treats) outsiD. her house.  Her greatest wish is to always continue to grow in her various sales as well as raise her children who still go to local schools.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn for the tortilla shop and to buy gift items.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La Señorita Claudia es Modista, elabora ajuar para bebes, juegos de sabanas, distintos tipos de vestimenta, es soltera y vive con su madre en casa propia, tiene clientela formada y se dedica a la actividad hace 3 años.
Ella es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, le gusta la actividad que realiza y le gustaría seguir para poder ayudar con ingresos para la casa y poder de esa manera brindarse una vida digna y decorosa.
Ella lucha para poder salir adelante y poder, en el futuro, tener un taller grande de costura y poder ser conocida ademas en los barrios posteriores a su zona.
Solicita el credito para la compra de los materiales que necesita para ejercer su profesión, es decir telas hilos y demás kits de costura que podría necesitar. Tiene las esperanzas puestas en el credito ya que sabe que es una gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Claudia is a dressmaker.  She makes outfits for infants, bedclothes, various types of clothes.  She’s single and lives with her mother in her own house.  She has an established customer base and has been in business for three years.

She is a very responsible, hard working person.  She likes the work she does and would like to continue to help with household expenses and provide herself with a dignified, decorous life.

She struggles to get ahead and be able, in the future, to have a larger sewing shop and to be known also in the neighborhoods beyond her own.  

She is asking for the loan to buy the materials she needs to exercise her profession; that is, thread and other sewing kits she might need.  She has her hopes placed on the loan because she knows it will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Chonimabaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Santa Catalina es casada tiene 55 años D. edad, tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar 3 años la educación primaria, tiene 9 hijos 5 D. los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a prestar servicios D. salud y como también a la crianza D. animales domésticos, inicio este negocio criando pollos criollos y hasta el momento  tiene 10 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

DeciD. organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo  que le servirá para comprar cerdos, para engorD. y cuando crezcan poder venderlos y recuperar la inversión y ganancias. Los demás integrantes también se dedican a la agricultura y a la crianza D. animales. Esperan en el futuro contar con una granja.
texts.en:
Sra. Santa Catalina is 55 years old, married, and has a third graD. education. She has nine children, five of whom are in school. Santa Catalina provides health services and also raises domesticated animals. She started her business by raising chickens and has now accumulated 10 years of experience. Santa Catalina has the support of her husband, who works as a farmer.

She decided to organize a group so that she could request a loan for buying pigs to fatten. When the animals are grown, she will sell them so that she can recoup her investment and earn a profit. The other members also engage in agriculture and raising animals. They hope to have a farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en: Gulbahor lives and works in Kurgantyube, Tajikistan. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Her husband is a pensioner and only she is a breadwinner in her family. Culbahor is engaged in the selling of shoes and clothes. She trades at the local market of “Barakat”. Gulbahor has a reach of experience in this business because she has been running her clothing sale business for 19 years. Gulbahor would like to get a loan of 12,000 TJS for purchasing new clothes and shoes in order to increase her merchandise and expand her business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy new clothes and shoes for sale

loans.name: Marve

texts.en:
Marve is 35 years of age, married, and has three children who are currently going to school. He is a farmer working in the Philippines. He engages in agricultural businesses like rice farming and hog raising. His wife is a housekeeper and his partner in managing their furniture business.

Marve is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase feed for the maintenance of his pigs. He will use the loan wisely for the future of his family. He plans to improve his practice in the hog raising business towards growing the business and gaining a higher income.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 33 years old, married and has four children aged five and three years old whom his wife and he hope to give good educations up to university level. He describes himself as a determined man.

Michael runs a welding and fabrication business in which he makes and sells steel doors, windows, etc. to the local people in Mombasa. He says the major challenges he faces are due to financial constraints.

Michael will use his loan of 50,000 KES to buy a welder for his business so as to better meet the demands of his customers. He hopes in the future to build a house and buy a car for his family.

loans.use: to buy a welder for his business.

loans.name: Yein

texts.en:
Yein is 55 years old and has a business selling food. Her husband works for the government as a village consultant. Their combined income is 5 USD per day. Yein has two children, who are 19 and 20 years old. They both work in a factory and each earns 3 USD daily. Each month, Yein spends 50 USD on food, 8 USD on electricity, 3 USD on rent, and 10 USD on other expenses. 

Yein is requesting a 300 USD loan to buy piglets to raise and sell. Her loan will provide capital for starting this business and Yein hopes that she will continue to expand her business and increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Penninah

texts.en: Penninah is 27 years old, married to Enoch Nzau who is a businessman. Together they have two children aged seven and four years who are both in school. She owns a shop as her primary business which gives her a monthly income of 16,500 KES. Her business is located at Bissil market where her customers are residents of the area. She was introduced to KADET by a KADET officer. This is Penninah's third loan from KADET. She will use the loan to purchase more stock of wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat. She repaid her previous loans successfully. Her extra profit will be used to open a wholesale shop, which she hopes to do in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat for her store

loans.name: Jenny Luz

texts.es:
La señora Jenny es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Productivas del Distrito Manantay del Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija menor.
Lleva varios años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas, lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles  comprará: 10 jabas de gaseosas de diferentes sabores, 3 paquetes de gaseosas de 3 litros, 2 paquetes de gaseosa de 2.5 litros, 2 paquetes de agua mineral.
Tiene que tener gaseosas de deferentes sabores y  tamaños porque sus clientes así lo piden, su casa está cerca de los aserraderos y tiene muchos clientes quienes consumen sus productos.
Su esposo trabaja manejando motocar (transporte) y es el que le ayuda cuando tiene que hacer sus compras, solo tiene una hija, esperan darle una buena educación, por ello se esfuerzan cada día.
texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the Mujeres Productivas (Productive Women) Communal Bank in the Manantay district in the Ucayali department.  She is 32 years old, married, and has a daughter who is a minor.

She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for several years.  She sells soft drinks.  She has been in this business for a good amount of time.

With her new loan for 1,000 soles she will buy ten crates of different flavors of soft drinks, three packages of three liter size soft drinks, two packages of two and a half liter size soft drinks, and two packages of mineral water.

She needs to have different flavors and sizes of soft drinks because that is what her customers ask for.  Her house is near the saw mill, and she has a lot of customers who consumer her products.

Her husband works driving a “motocar” (transportation).  He is the one that helps her when she has to make her purchases.  She only has one daughter, and they hope to give her a good education.  That is why they put forth their efforts every day.

loans.use: to buy wholesale soft drinks.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 22 years old and the mother of a three-year-old son. She is raising him by herself because her husband abandoned his family a year ago because their life was so difficult. Today, Francis earns a living by raising hogs, and her main goal in life is to care for her son and provide for his future. She is applying for a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them to eat. In the future, she dreams of putting her son through school so that they can both live a better life.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them to eat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business by buying new materials for his mill.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 35 years old, is married and has two children, age 14 and 8. Violeta's husband is a fisherman.

Violeta runs a small sari-sari (variety) store in Getafe, Bohol. She sells items like chips, vinegar and canned goods. Violeta also helps her husband sell fish at the market. 

She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as vinegar, canned goods, soy sauce and soap. Violeta hopes to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as vinegar, canned goods, soy sauce and soap.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luis es un hombre muy trabajador y muy responsable con su familia, lo que José más desea es ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida y una vivienda digna de vivir. Hace un año adquirió su casa de interés social lo cual fue un beneficio ya que no tuvo que vivir en casa de renta o de un familiar. En este momento el desea  construir una barda al frente de su casa y a un lado ya que esta en esquina lo cual hay más probabilidad que entren a robar a su casa o que sus hijos puedan tener un accidente.  De esta manera tendrá la certeza de que sus pequeños jueguen dentro del patio y se encuentren seguros, lo que hizo esta persona fue colocar tarimas alrededor de la casa per están expuestas a caerse por que no están bien colocadas. Para que su barda quede mejor reforzada la quiere construir de block lo cual necesita material de construcción.
texts.en: José Luis is a very hard-working man who is very responsible so far as his family is concerned.  What José most wants is to offer his family a better quality of life and a decent home to live in.  A year ago, he acquired his home through a government-subsidized housing scheme.  This was a benefit to him as it meant he didn't have to live in a rental house or in a family member's house.  Right now, José would like to build a wall out the front of his house and round one side as the house is on a corner and so it is more probable that people will come and burgle his home or that his children could have an accident.  In this way, he will be sure that his little ones will play within the yard and be safe.  What he did was place pallets around his home but they are exposed to falling down because they are not well placed.  In order to ensure his wall is strong, he would like to build it from blocks and needs to buy building materials.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to build a wall

loans.name: Savat's Group

texts.en:
Savat, 61, is widowed and has nine children, five of whom are married and two children are still in school. To earn a living, she has been farming on her rice field for 20 years. 

Savat leads a group of three female members in a rural area of Moung Russey district where the typical business is rice farming. She has been with VisionFund for four years and she completely repaid her loans with VisionFund. The loans from VisonFund help her to have enough capital for her rice plantation, family expenses, and children's study. She is now applying for a fifth loan from VisionFund to buy fertilizer for her rice field. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield and also hopes to earn more income to set aside some savings to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the rice fields

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married and has two children.

Karar has been an owner of a shop since 2009, selling women’s and kids' shoes. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has sufficient experience in this field. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of 2,400 USD in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop

loans.name: Phallim

texts.en:
Phallim is 36 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Phallim raises pigs at home and her husband is a pig vendor. 

Phallim is requesting a 700 USD loan to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to transport pigs to sell. With a motorbike, her husband can more easily carry pigs to market and generate more income to support the family. In the future, Phallim would like to expand her husband’s pig-selling business, renovate her house, and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to transport pigs

loans.name: Bunavsha

texts.ru: Бунавша жительница города Куляб. Замужем. Возраст, 40 лет. Имеет двоих детей. Она занимается торговлей детской одежды. Кредит берет для закупа сезонного товара.
texts.en: Bunavsha is a resident of the city of Kulob.  She is 40 years old, married and has two children.  She is involved in selling children's clothing.  Bunavsha is requesting this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s wholesales business. He sells edible items like chocolates, candies, and chips to different grocery stores for a profit. He has good contacts to whom he sells his items through orders. With the loan investment, he will buy these items in larger quantities and improve his sales. 

Nasreen herself is a housewife. She spends her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She has given birth to 2 sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their educations. She is very confident that the loan investment will help her family to live a better financial life. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Nasreen.”

loans.use: to buy edible items for selling

loans.name: Diarra's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 25, fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 22 octobre 2012. Ce banc regroupe des membres qui habitent le même village et ceux des environs. La plupart des femmes font le commerce et l’embouche. Une bonne entente règne entre elles.
Awa debout à droite de la photo est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est âgée de 32 ans.
Elle envisage de faire de l’agriculture et du commerce de crème glacée  avec le prêt qu’elle a reçu. Elle veut acheter 112kg d’arachide comme semences, à 140f le kg. Elle va acheter aussi pour la préparation de la crème une bassine de bissap à 6000f, du pain de sine 10kg à 3000f, 10kg de tamarin à 3000f. Ainsi elle peut vendre 3500f par jour de crème. Elle achète aussi 2 brebis pour les élever.
Les bénéfices lui servent à renforcer son épargne, à soutenir sa famille dans les besoins quotidiens et à satisfaire les frais de scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This 25-person group is part of the banc villageois that was founded on October 22, 2012. The group includes members who live in the same village and its surrounding areas. The majority of women in the group work in sales and fattening livestock. They get along well with one another.

Awa, seated at right in the photo, is married and has three children. She is 32 years old. With her loan, she plans on farming and making ice cream. She would like to buy 112 kg of peanut seeds for 140 FCFA per kg. 

In order to make the ice cream, she would also like to buy a container of hibiscus for 6,000 FCFA, 10 kg of baobab fruit for 3,000 FCFA, and 10 kg of tamarind for 3,000 FCFA. This will help her sell 3,500 FCFA worth of ice cream per day. She is also buying two sheep that she will raise. 

The profits will help her bolster her savings, support her family's daily needs, and pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: buy peanuts and ingredients for ice cream.

loans.name: Digna Tomasa

texts.en:
Mi nombre es Tomasa H. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, tengo la ayuda de mi hija para a produccion de mi producto, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor venta de mi producto y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alquilar un establecimiento para poner una cafeteria.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

My name is Tomasa H.. I work in the production and sales of tortillas. I´ve had my business for 3 years. I have the help of my children for the production of my product. My business generates income to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to sell more of my product and with the earnings that I obtain to be able to rent an establishment and open a cafetería.

loans.use:
Compra de harina de maiz, agua, sal, cal, leña, fosforos, carbon.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Purchase of corn flour, water, salt, lime, firewood, matches and charcoal.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married and has one daughter. After her schooling she couldn’t find a good-paying job so she decided to become self-employed. Today she runs a little kiosk selling men’s outerwear in the local central market. She has been in this business for two years. Tatyana has proven to have the heart of an entrepreneur and is enthusiastic about her small business. Her exceptional prices, positive attitude and cheery, smiling face attract many customers. Tatyana has very good reputation with “Nadiya Ukraine”. She has promptly repaid 12 loans in the past. In the last two years her turnover capital has increased to $600. She would like to get a loan for $700 to supplement her available capital. This will allow her to introduce some new clothing items and purchase assorted inventory. Tatyana’s responsibility, stable business growth, and prompt payment record characterize her as a consistent and serious entrepreneur who is capable of loan repayment.

Тетяна – одружена, в неї одна дочка. Вона певний час не могла знайти гарно оплачувану роботу, а отже, вирішила працювати на себе. В неї є невеличкий кіоск з продажу верхнього чоловічого одягу, розташований на місцевому ринку. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже два роки. Тетяна має справжній талант підприємця, вона з великим ентузіазмом розвиває свій бізнес. Вигідні ціни, чудове ставлення до кожного покупця та широка посмішка на обличчі приваблюють багато клієнтів. В „Надії України” в Тетяни склалася гарна репутація. Вона вчасно сплатила усі 12 попередніх позик. За останніх два роки її робочий капітал збільшився на 600 доларів. Тетяна хотіла б отримати позику в 700 доларів для того, щоб поповнити свій капітал. Завдяки їй вона зможе придбати новий одяг та поповнити асортимент товарів. Відповідальність Тетяни, стабільне зростання її бізнесу та чудова кредитна історія характеризують її як поступового та серйозного підприємця, який спроможний сплатити чергову позику.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Development of a cafeteria

loans.name: Mario Edgar

texts.es:
Mario is married and he has 2 little girls. His daughters were his main motivation to start his own business by opening up a car wash in Creel, Chihuahua where he is from originally. Little by little, his business has grown due to his great customer service. Since he has been getting a lot of business, he had to hired 2 employees.

Mario wishes to offer an even better customer service. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $475 USD which he will use to buy the basic things he needs to run his car-was business. He commits to repay this amount within 6 months. Be part of this business by lending your support! Thank you very much!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario es casado y tiene dos pequeñas hijas, ellas han sido el motivo por el cual decidió iniciar su propio negocio ofreciendo su servicio de lavado de autos en la localidad de Creel, Chihuahua de donde es originario. Poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio gracias al buen servicio que ofrece y para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes ahora cuenta con la ayuda de dos empleados.

Mario desea que su negocio pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio y para esto solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de insumos que necesita en su trabajo, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, muchas gracias.

loans.use: To purchase basic cleaning supplies

loans.name: Rehanna

texts.en:
I am Rehanna K. and I have been married for the past seventeen years. I have three boys and four girls. Four of my children attend school while the others are too young to attend yet. I am a housewife and I can’t go out for work as I have to take care of the children at home.

Therefore, in order to help add to the household income, I raise livestock such as such as cows, buffaloes or sheep and sell them at a profit. I have been doing this for the last fifteen years.

Now, I also want to buy an additional animal, for which I require a loan. I think I have sufficient experience in this business and I can do quite well. This way I can share some of the burden of supporting our family with of my husband.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Euis

texts.en: Euis is 25 years old and is married with a 4-year-old child. She sells food such as noodles, rice, meat, fried snacks and other items. She usually earns $5 per day with a profit of $2.50 per day. Her husband is a driver and earns about $10 per week. Euis would like a loan of $75 (IDR 500,000) to buy more goods and expand her business. Euis hopes to use the increased income for her child's education.

loans.use: To buy more goods and expand her food business

loans.name: Sukarsih

texts.en: Sukarsih is 30 years old and has a 3-year-old child. She has a small food stall where she sells snacks and beverages. She can earn about US$ 10 per day. Her husband, B., is a motorcycle driver who earns US$ 2.50 per day. Sukarsih is requesting a US$ 75 loan to buy more goods to fill her stall. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to expnd the inventory of her stall

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Mrs. Leng V. (age 37) and her husband, Mr. Svay Khat (age 39) have been married since 1990. They have five children--three sons and two daughters. Two of their children are studying in the local school. Leng and her family live in a fertile farming area along the Tonle Basac (river), a tributary of the Mekong, several kilometers south of Phnom Penh. She has been in the business of selling flowers since 2001. She buys flowers from farmers for reselling at a market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and construction worker.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the fifth time in the amount of $1000. She will use this loan to purchase a contract for the future harvest of flower farms in her village. Two or three months later, she will sell them at a price higher than the agreed-upon price she pays today.

loans.use: To buy a contract for flowers for reselling

loans.name: Igamba East C Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Betty K.. She runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase the stock in the shop. Betty is 42 years old, and married with 4 children, ranging from age 12 to 18. Her husband Her children all go to school.

Each week, Betty makes approximately 17000 UGX profit. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest in growing and selling maize. In the past, Betty had a loan of 200000 UGX from BRAC Uganda , which she used to increase the stock in her shop. She paid back the loan on time.

Betty is joined in her small group by Khadija Nantambi, Amina B., Joweria Nakawoma, and Judith N.. Khadija Nantambi sells matooke, charcoal, and tomatoes, and wants to increase her charcoal business. Amina B. is currently selling clothes and ladies shoes and wants a loan to increase the inventory of shoes and clothes. Joweria Nakawoma operates a local cinema hall and wants to buy a bigger generator and more fuel to improve the business. Judith N. currently has a local brewing business and is requesting a loan to start trading sugar at the wholesale market.

loans.use: To increase the stock in retail shop

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia is in her late thirties, and she and her husband are raising five boys and four girls. Eusebia defines herself as a many-sided entrepreneur who does everything in her power to support her family and provide good education with her children.

She sells new and used clothing from her house. She also prepares natural juices which she sells with fried vegetables and pork meat in a school next to her house, located in the Quita Sueño community of San Cristobal. Eusebia hopes that her business’ growth will help her put aside money with the intention of setting a cafeteria next to the public school of the community.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to prepare fried food; and clothing in bulk to retail in her community.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela considers herself persevering, honest and very dedicated to her work. She is married to Ramón Ortiz Gilberto who works as a construction worker. She has four children: José Francisco ages 22 who is single, a student and disabled; Miriam, aged 19 and single; Celeste, aged 16, single and a high-school student and Gilberto, aged 12, a secondary-school student. They all live at home.

She established her business because she has always liked sales, and it also provided her with an independent income in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She began selling goods 20 years ago, firstly children’s underwear among her neighbours, friends and family, then she sold catalogue beauty products and from February 2004 she began to sell new clothes, which she used to sell from home but now she operates from a customised space in the front of her house and which in the future she would like to convert to a boutique.

Now she would like a loan for $300 USD which she will repay in 4 months in order to buy new seasonal clothes which will allow her to have a better stock to satisfy her customers and in this way increase her earnings.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Marcela se considera una persona perseverante, honesta y muy dedicada a su trabajo Está casada con el Sr. Ramón Ortiz Gilberto quien trabaja como albañil. Tiene 4 hijos José Francisco de 22 años, soltero, estudiante, el es discapacitado; Miriam de 19 años, soltera; Celeste de 16 años, soltera, estudiante de preparatoria y Gilberto de 12 años, estudiante de Secundaria; todos viven en casa.

Inició el negocio porque siempre le han gustado las ventas además de que así podía obtener un ingreso aparte del de su esposo para ayudarle con los gastos de la casa. Comenzó hace 20 años en las ventas, primero con ropa interior para niño entre sus vecinas, amistades y familiares, luego se dedico a vender productos de belleza por catálogo y a partir de Febrero de 2004 inicio con la venta de ropa nueva la cual antes vendía a domicilio pero ahora ya tiene un local que acondiciono en la parte del frente de su domicilio y el cual en un futuro quiere convertir en una boutique.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $300 que pagará en 4 meses para comprar ropa nueva de temporada que le permita tener un mejor surtido para satisfacción de sus clientes y de esta manera aumentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Mercy O

texts.en: Mercy O E.’s business is distinguished from other shops around her because of the unique way she arranges the drugs and provisions in her shop. She was able to arrange the pharmaceuticals in various sections, but makes them look uniform, and the provisions are in other sections of the shop that made it so colorful and attractive to customers. She has been in the business now for 8 years, and she also has been borrowing from LAPO microfinance for the past 8 years. She is 37 years old, married with 4 children, and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Mercy needs the sum of $875 to buy more drugs and provisions for sale so that she can serve her increasing customers better.

loans.use: To buy more drugs and provisions for sales

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Upon deciding to settle in the city of Juliaca with her family, Lidia has fought to make progress and provide peace and education to her three beloved children. This exemplary mother and her husband, Aurelio, have, little by little, established a small workshop, where they transform metal into beautiful doors and windows for orders. At present, they live in the home of her in-laws, where they were able to set aside a space to establish their workshop, but seeing the discomfort and the little space that they have, they long for the day that they have their own premises. With this goal in mind, this diligent family works with determination. In addition to this work, Lidia wants to enter the handicrafts trade. She is sure that knitting and selling her beautiful pieces of clothing will significantly help with her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde que decidió radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca junto a su familia Doña Lidia ha luchado por progresar y ofrecerles tranquilidad y educación a sus tres queridos hijos; esta ejemplar madre y su esposo, Aurelio, poco a poco con esfuerzo han implementado un tallercito de transformación de metal en donde fabrican hermosas puertas y ventanas por pedidos.Actualmente viven en el domicilio de sus suegros en donde pudieron adecuar un espacio para instalar su tallercito, pero viendo la incomodidad y el poco espacio con el que cuentan anhelan algún día tener su propio local, con este objetivo en mente ésta diligente familia trabaja perseverantemente y adicionalmente a esta labor Doña Lidia desea incursionar en el oficio de la artesanía, está segura que tejiendo y vendiendo sus hermosas prendas de vestir apoyará considerablemente con los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: To raise capital to enter the handicrafts industry

loans.name: Saily

texts.ru:
Saily M. lives in the village of Vahdat, Tajikistan. She is a widow with 4 children. She does not have a job but supports her family by working with livestock. Now, she wants to buy another cow for its milk. She will be able to sell this milk to neighbors and feed her children. To be able to buy this cow, she needs a loan that she plans on repaying within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Махмудова Сайли живет в городе Вахдат. Вдова с четырьмя детьми. Нигде не работает , но для того , чтобы прокормить детей занимается животноводством. Разводит бычков , для продажи. А теперь хочет купить дойную корову для того , чтобы получать молоко. Получаемое молоко сможет продавать соседям , а так же поить им своих детей. Для того , чтобы купить корову она должна получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Hai Amarat 2038-D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Flora W.. She is currently in the business of selling vegetable oil and onions and is requesting a loan to set up a petrol sales point. Flora is 50 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 5 children ranging in age from 14 to 28, and her younger children go to school. Each week, Flora makes approximately 300 Sudanese pounds in profit and with the extra money from her loan, she hopes to be able to set up a petrol sales point.

Flora is joined in her small group by Daruka S., Mariya Salka, Mary W., and Rejina S.. Daruka S. has a business selling clothes and wants to expand the business. Mariya Salka is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to build a house for her own use. Mary W. operates a business baking bread and wants to expand her bakery. Rejina S. is currently in the business of selling vegetables out of her home and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: set up a petrol sales point

loans.name: Norng

texts.en: Norng C. is 33 years old and resides with her child in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 1993, she has been working as garment factory worker to earn a living and is able to make US$3 each day. Her husband, Soam Yon, is a construction worker and sometime when he free he operates a motor-taxi business as well. On average, he makes about US$5 of profit per day from two activities.  Mrs. Norng would like to loan from Kiva via Credit, local partner, to replace an old and unreliable motorbike for her husband. (Soam is pictured with a motorbike)

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike..

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel es un hombre muy trabajador y dedicado a sus deberes agrícolas, con las cuales hace más de 15 años ha alimentado a su familia, y educado a sus hijos, quienes aman a su padre y lo tienen como ejemplo de un gran hombre.Es una persona muy responsable y amable, puesto que nos muestra sus terrenos donde  cultiva habas y otros productos agrícolas. Productos que consumimos gracias a personas como don Samuel, quien trabaja para llevar alimentos a las personas y para  brindar alimentación a su familia y sobre todo de tener la posibilidad de mejorar su calidad de vida dentro de su hogar.Bajo este fin, por los altos costos de los abonos y fertilizantes, de no adquirir estos, sería muy perjudicial para sus chacras, requiere de un préstamo, en usted esta la posibilidad de que Samuel pueda mejorar su producción y sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Samuel is a very hardworking man, dedicated to his farm work, with which for more than 15 years he has supported his family and educated his children, who love their father and have him for an example of a good man. He is a very responsible and kind person, who cares for his land where he grows beans and other agricultural products, products that we eat thanks to people like Don Samuel, who works to deliver food to the people and to enable his own family to eat, and above all to have the possibility of improving the quality of life inside his home. For this end, because of the high costs of fertilizers, he needs a loan. In you is the possibility in which Samuel could be able to improve his production and his income.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo e hijos. Se levanta cada día, muy temprano, para recoger el pasto que ha de dar a sus cuyes y sus vacas, esta labor, en las tareas de la agricultura y ganadería la viene haciendo desde hace 17 años, después de que  Delfina se casó y formo una familia, hasta ahora, que junto a su esposo tiene la responsabilidad de educar a sus 3 hijos.  A parte de dar de comer a sus vacas, también vende la leche que producen, y si la cría de su vaca es un toro, lo hace engordar y luego lo vende, en ocasiones también compra toretes y después de unos meses de engorde los vende en las ferias ganaderas. Delfina trabaja en esta actividad porque disfruta de tener la disposición de leche fresca, no solo para vender, sino también para su familia, así como de otros productos, sin necesidad de ir al mercado a comprarlos, es por ello que no solo se ha trazado la meta de tener la misma raza de vacas, sino también en mejorar su calidad a fin de que pueda tener mayores ingresos. Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá comprar algunos cuyes sementales para su granja, así también como la preparación de sus tierras de cultivo, con la compra de abono y fertilizantes para que siembre papa y alfalfa.
texts.en:
Delfina, 40, lives with her husband and children. She rises very early every day to collect the feed to give to her guinea pigs and cows. She has been working in agriculture and livestock breeding for 17 years, from the time Delfina married and formed her family up to her present responsibility, with her husband, of educating her 3 children. Besides feeding her cows, she also sells the milk they produce, and if a bull is produced, she fattens it and then sells it. At times she also buys young bulls and after several months of fattening she sells them at livestock markets. Delfina works at this activity because she enjoys having fresh milk at her disposal, not only to sell, but also for her family, as well as other products, without having to go to the market to buy them. This is why she not only has set herself the goal to maintain the lineage of her cattle, but also to improve their quality in order to increase her income. She is requesting this loan so she can purchase some breeder guinea pigs for her farm, as well as improvements to her agricultural land with manure and fertilizers to grow potatoes and alfalfa.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of breeder guinea pigs, plus improvement of her agricultural land to grow potatoes and alfalfa

loans.name: Oumar Seydi

texts.fr: Oumar Seydi N. est dans le secteur de la pêche. Il vend du matériel de pêche (filets, bacs ...) et exploite des pirogues. Cet entrepreneur sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son fond de roulement et faire face à la demande. Il a une expérience avérée du secteur.
texts.en:
Oumar Seydi N. is in the fishery business. He sells fishing equipment (nets and crates, etc.), and operates several canoes. This entrepreneur is seeking a loan to increase his working capital and meet the demand. He has proven experience in this field.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fishing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in food sales.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Mrs. Ros S. E., 35, is a mother of two and started a business selling river clams at Soung market, Kampong Cham province in 1992. She can make on average $5.60/day of income. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver transporting customers to different locations in the town and generates around $2.50/day for his household.
The income she and her husband make will cover for food an amount of $80 per month, $5 on utility, $15 on her children tuition fee and $15 on their transportation. 
Ros S. E. and her husband would like to apply for a loan from KIVA to purchase rice from the growers and will then resell thE. for a profit when the price is going up.
This will enable thE. to generate additional profit and improve their living condition.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell for a profit.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Mapinduzi Group

texts.en:
Shakila O., age 30, is married with two children, ages 15 and 18. She sells juice and bites. She started this business five years ago and works daily from 8am until 11pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $207. 

This will be Shakila’s sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the stock and improve her cafe and has repaid the loans successfully. She now hopes for a sixth loan to open a pharmacy. 

Shakila will share this loan with her loan group, Mapinduzi, which totals 20 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Shakila O. is in the back left in a dark dress.

loans.use: To build a pharmacy

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita C. lives in Villa Cayaban, Malalinta, San Manuel, Isabela.  She is 40 years old and married to Marcelino, 36 years old, whi is a farmer.  They have two children; both are in their primary level of education and they are: John Kyle - 6 years old, and Jade Karen – 5 years old.

Since farming is their primary source of income, Clarita decided to engage in vegetable vending.  She sells their own crops and harvests in their village.  She can earn a weekly net income of PHP1, 200.  

She wants to contribute more to their financial needs, so she has availed for a loan of PHP4, 000.  She intends to use the loan to increase her merchandise and buy fruits that she will sell.  

Helping one another is what this couple is doing in order to expand their business and save money for the education of their two children.  They want their children to finish their studies because education is the only possession they can give them for the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise and fruits to sell

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela sells bags of cement and bricks. She has been in this business since 2003. Angela needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more bags of cement to sell.

Angela is 39 years old and married with three children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.
