loans.use: To purchase more bags of cement to sell

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki has been a fish seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She belongs to Safi nia group loan (Group code 2007).  Every day she works at her business for 12 hours, earning an average monthly profit of $70. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fish, wheat flour and sugar for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, she will be able to grow her business and her profit will increase.   


Riziki is 33 years old, married, and has two children, ages 13 and 12.

loans.use: To buy more fish, wheat flour and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: El señor José Manuel A. Pérez tiene la edad de 47 años, habita en barrio el Edén ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante de frutas en el mercado Oriental , ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos un de 25 años que trabaja y les apoya y una hija de 18 años que actulamnte estudia y le poya con las cosas del hogar  los planes hacia su familia es poder apoyar a sus hijos siempre para que sigan estudiando y otros de sus planes es poder construir su casa , don José desde hace diez años trabaja como agricultor , el mayor problema que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y las plagas que han afectado a su cultivo , el inicio el trabajo agrícola por si solo , con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para tener una buena cosecha y poder vender a buen precio al mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. José Manuel A. Pérez is a 47-year-old man who lives in the Edén neighborhood of the Ticuantepe municipality with his wife, who works as a fruit vendor in the Oriental market. They have two children under their care; one who is 25 years old and works to help out the family, and an 18-year-old daughter who is currently in school and helps with the household chores. His family plans are to always be able to support his children to keep studying, and to be able to build his own house. Mr. A. has been working as a farmer for ten years. His biggest problems are the lack of financial resources and the pests that have affected his crops. He started working in agriculture on his own. With this loan, he will purchase fertilizer and supplies so that he can have a good harvest and sell his produce at a good price at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and fertilizers for crops

loans.name: Gifty's Group

texts.en: Gifty O. is a professional hair dresser. She is 30 years old, married and has three daughters. Two of her daughters are currently in primary school while the last born has not started school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community called Kofiase. It is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a mason by trade. Her saloon is located on the principal street of her community where she serves her numerous clients. Gifty says she has four apprentices under training, equipping them with skills to manage their own saloon soon. She wants a loan to buy working tools and materials such as pomades, lotions, creams, weavons, mesh etc. to improve her services to her clients. She started her operation three years ago. She is expecting to improve her income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing materials.

loans.name: Florgie

texts.en:
Florgie B. is from the village of Cabol-anonan, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Florgie is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Florgie provides transportation services to local community members. Florgie is just starting this business.

In May 2009, Florgie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florgie is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Florgie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Felix Vasco

texts.pt:
Felix Vasco A. de 34 anos de idade, nasceu na província de Manica, cidade de Chimoio (centro dos pais a 1.240km de Maputo), casado e pai de dois filhos menores de sete anos de idade. o primeiro filho estuda na escola primaria de boane.

Concluiu a formação media de docência e encontra se a trabalhar neste distrito a mais de oito nove. Sustenta seus pais que ficaram na província de origem, enviando lhes dinheiro. Tem um salário mensal no valor de 7.346,00MT e continuar com a sua formação no nível superior.

Chegou a boane a procura de melhores condições de vida e vive na casa própria com sua esposa e com mais um irmão sob sua responsabilidade.

Teve informações sobre a existência da hluvukua traves de amigos e nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo no valor de 15.00,00MT e pretende comprar material de construção. O primeiro crédito foi de 11.500,00Mt. 

Propõe se a pagar em harmonia com o plano de prestações para terminar cedo a sua casa que esta cosntruindo em fases, para depois mobiliar.
texts.en:
Felix Vasco A. is 34 years old and was born in the province of Manica, in Chimoio, a city in the middle of the country,1240 km from Maputo. He is married and has two seven-year-old children. His eldest son studies in Boane's elementary school. He is trained as a teacher and has been working in the district for more than nine years. He supports his parents, who still live in their home province, by sending them money. He earns a monthly salary of 7346 MT and is continuing his studies. He arrived in Boane looking for a better quality of life. He lives with his wife in their own home, and also support a number of siblings. work in Maputo, and now lives in his own home with his wife. He learned about Hluvuku through friends and has never had loans through other banks. This is his second loan, in the amount of 15,000 MT, which he will use to purchase construction materials. His first loan was for 11,500 MT. He intends to pay off his loan in accordance with the loan schedule, in order to be able to finish the house he's been building in stages, and then furnish it.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family home

loans.name: Ni Putu Suantini

texts.en:
Ni Putu Suantini - (DNR.M-0580) is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Palasari - Melaya. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, Ni Putu Suantini owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ni Putu Suantini has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 300,000 Indonesian rupiahs (about $29 US) a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ni Putu Suantini joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Putu Suantini has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 rupiahs from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Ni Putu Suantini is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. The loan will be the second she has taken out from DINARI. Ni Putu Suantini plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Putu Suantini - (DNR.M-0580) merupakan 39 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Palasari - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 3 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Putu Suantini memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Putu Suantini sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 6 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Putu Suantini menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2008, Ni Putu Suantini bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Putu Suantini meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli ternak indukan. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Putu Suantini berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk tabungan sebagai cadangan bagi keadaan darurat di masa mendatang.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: For baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 42 years old and is married to a farmer named Avelino. They have four children ranging from 16 to 3 years old now. All of them are studying except for the youngest.

In the municipality of Hamtic in the province of Antique, most people are into the rice production business, as are Chona and her husband. Chona started this kind of business when her brother in- law gave her money for capital in 2003. However, the capital was not enough to grow the business. In 2007, Chona found out about ASHI and she became a member of said institution. She had the opportunity to borrow and expand her business from then on until she was able to set up another source of income while waiting for the harvest: her variety store.

Chona is so happy that she has a variety store. It has brought convenience to people in their community especially during the harvesting period. Furthermore, Chona wishes that, together with her farming business, her variety store will grow and will generate bigger profit. By then, she will be able to send all her children to school until college. This is Chona's greatest dream.

loans.use: Fertilizers, chemicals for killing pests, insects, and grass, and rice seedling; and part for her ongoing variety store

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hog raiser and a vegetable vendor in their village as her source of living.  She usually roam around their village when selling her vegetables.  She is very diligent in earning a living for their family.  Their poor living condition inspired her to work hard and dream big. Presently, Josefina and her family live in the peaceful village of Binarzang, Quirino, Isabela.

Josefina is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP7, 000 as additional capital for her hog raising and vending business. She aims to gain higher income to be able to provide the important needs of her family especially her children. She works everyday to attain her dreams.  She prays for the financial support of Kiva lenders and for her business to grow.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Elvin Jairo

texts.es: El Señor de Nombre Elvin Jairo C. Rodríguez tiene la edad de 33 años, sus sueños son establecer un restaurante para obtener más ingresos para poseer 2 negocios enfocados en lo mismo y obtener más ganancias para su familia. La actividad económica de Elvin es un restaurante la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda.  Hace más de 6 años, que se dedica a esta actividad por la búsqueda de una fuente de ingresos que sea más y con el paso del tiempo han logrado comprar sillas, mesas, manteles entre otras cosas y así fue que su negocio fue creciendo.  El  financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la comprar de sillas y otras cosas necesarias para su local. por lo que su deseo es crear un ambiente familiar.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is 31 years old and she is married with 2 children.She is a friendly and hard working woman.She sells shoes and bags.She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell.She is indeed grateful to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Tota

texts.es:
La señora Tota vive en la calle Miguel de Cervantes la zona Sopocachi en la ciudad de La Paz
 
Ella, vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos, se dedican a la venta de repuestos para movilidades.

Gracias a los préstamos otorgados anteriormente, cuenta con un pequeño capital de trabajo con el cual tiene  mejores ingresos y condiciones de vida.

El crédito que solicita será utilizado en la compra de repuestos de movilidades, para mantener su stock y poder servir mejor a su clientela.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tota lives on Miguel de Cervantes Street in the Sopocachi zone in the city of La Paz. She lives in her own house with her children, and she sells vehicle replacement parts for a living. Thanks to the loans she has already repaid, she has saved a little capital, which allows her the ability to make better investments and have a better lifestyle. She will use the loan she is soliciting to buy vehicle replacements to maintain her stock and to better serve her clientèle.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de repùestos de vehiculos, para su negocio de venta de los mismos.

loans.name: Aymara Group

texts.es: En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, “Panamericana” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Aymara”, con 13 integrantes, están juntas hace aproximadamente 4 años, una de las integrantes es Sofía de 45 años, casada y tiene 6  hijos, ella se dedica al tejido de chompas de algodón y dice “…antes me compraba por libras y era difícil conseguir, pero ahora con la ayuda del préstamo puedo comprar al por mayor y rebajar mis costos..”, vende sus productos a clientes potenciales que le vienen a comprar a su domicilio y éstos los venden en Potosí, Villazón y Desaguadero. Las demás integrantes también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de alimento seco, refrescos, verduras. Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios comprando mercadería y materia prima.
texts.en:
In Pro Mujer's Focus Center "Panamericana" is located the "Aymara" Communal Association which is made up of 13 members who have been together for apporxomately 4 years. One of the members is Sofia, 45, married and the mother of 6 children. She knits cotton skirts and states: "...I used to buy by the pound which was difficult to get but now, with the help of the loan, I can buy wholesale and cut my costs...". She sells to potential customers who come to her home to buy and these then resell them in Potosí, Villazón y Desaguadero. The other members have their own businesses such as the sale of dry food stuffs, beverages, vegetables. They all need the loan in order supply their businesses with merchandise and raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and raw materials.

loans.name: Mosoc Runa Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “MOSOC RUNA”, este nombre es D. origen quechua y traducido al español. "MOSOC" significa nuevo y "RUNA" significa hombre (en el sentido D. la raza humana), nosotros lo traducimos como Gente Nueva. Nuestros miembros son 15 socios, todos ellos son muy amigables y emprendedores. Los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco, la mayoría D. ellos son comerciantes independientes y tienen actividades similares.   

Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades con el comercio minorista en la ciudad Cusco. Ellos tienen diferentes negocios como venta D. ropa, productos D. belleza y otras cosas. Una D. las socias su actividad es procesar tejido con lana D. alpaca y después confeccionar chompas, chulos, chalinas, guantes y vestidos. Ella exporta sus productos al país D. Japón. Otra socia tiene una tienda escolar donD. venD. golosinas, galletas, pasteles, etc. 

Todos los miembros del banco comunal son nuevos socios y están deseosos D. invertir el préstamo en sus nuevos negocios y D. este modo hacerlos crecer, esto ayudará a mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus hogares y les dará mayor producción y mayor ganancia.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

(El socio RUBEN no esta en la foto por que estaba trabajando como profesor)
texts.en:
Our members belong to the communal bank " MOSOC RUNA." This name is of Quechua origin and translated to Spanish. "MOSOC" means new and "RUNA" means man (in a human racial sense), we translate it as New People. There are 15 members, who are all friendly and enterprising. The members live in the city of Cusco. The majority of them are independent entreprenuers and have similar jobs. The members alternate their diverse activities with minority commercialism in Cusco. They have different businesses such as selling clothes, beauty products and other enterprises as well. One of the member's jobs is to process alpaca wool into fabric and later make sweaters, winter hats, scarves, gloves, and dresses. She exports her products to Japan. Another member has a store in a school where she sells sweets, cookies, cakes, etc. All of the members of the communal bank are new and wish to invest the loan in new businesses. This way they plan to make their businesses grow, improve their standards of living, and increase production and profits The members value and are thankful for the offered loan through this resource and in the same manner commit to repay their loans in the established time period. (Member RUBEN is not in the photo because he was working as a teacher.)

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell clothes, food, cosmetics, and the production of sweaters.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina M. is from the city of Pagadian City. She is 56 years old. Marina is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Marina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Marina has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. Marina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Basilia Yamileth

texts.es: Doña Basilia mujer activa se desempeña en la costura, a la venta de cosméticos, y zapatos, durante muchos años laboro en zona franca pero con deseo de superar renuncio por que el salario es bajo, y no prestan todo el servicio de ley, con su liquidación logro comprar su propia maquina de coser, el cual ahora  cose en su propia casa y ha ido teniendo los clientes del barrio, vende cosméticos de la Avon el cual trabaja por encargo de los producto pero mucho de sus clientes compran perfume y es lo que mas compra  para vender. Trabaja medio tiempo en una maquila el cual su salario es por producción, ahí labora lindo vestido, de dama como de traje de caballero. Contenta por que hasta ahora le ha ido mejor, ya que puede realizar su trabajo y puede vender al mismo tiempo. Sus planes es poder confensionar sus propios trajes para vender es por eso con este préstamo comprara tela variada en diversos colores, como producto de Avon pintura, perfumenes, cremas entre otro y poder cada día crecer en su negocio, todo esto con ayuda de su esposo y gracias al financiamiento de la institución.
texts.en:
Basilia is a very active woman who works as a seamstress and sells cosmetics and shoes. For many years she worked in a free zone and wanted to quit because the pay was low and and they did not offer full legal services. With her settlement, she was able to buy her own sewing machine. Now she sews in her own home and has customers from her neighborhood. She sells Avon cosmetics, and many of her customers buy perfume, so that is what she buys to sell most often. She works part time in a workshop producing pretty dresses as well as men's suits. She is glad that so far she is doing better, as she can do her job and be able to make sales at the same time. Her plan is to be able to produce her own suits to sell. She is requesting this loan in order to buy materials of various colors as well as Avon makeup, perfumes, and creams among other things so she can expand her business a little bit every day. She will do all this with the help of her husband and thanks to the institution's financing.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials of various colors and Avon makeup, perfume, and creams

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to five children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Akua is a petty trader. She sells second-hand clothes. She hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Akua has been in business for over ten years and desires to give her business a face-lift. She therefore wants the loan to procure bales of textile goods.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes in bales

loans.name: Manuel Salvador

texts.es: El señor Manuel Salvador  N. L. de 54 años desde su niñez  trabajo junto con su padre en la industria de almidón de yuca la cual heredo y piensa heredar a sus hijos tres hijos quienes trabajan con él. Este señor por medio de los préstamos ha ido mejorando su negocio y con el préstamo desea seguir adelante con su pequeña industria.
texts.en:
Manuel Salvador N. L. is 54 years old and works with his father in the cassava starch industry, a business he inherited and plans to pass down to his three children who work with him. Manuel has improved his business thanks to the loans he's received, and with the current one he is requesting he plans to keep making headway with his small plant.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cassava

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es: Ximara vive en la zona # 7 de Nueva Guinea, sus hijos son mayores, solo una niña es menor de edad que habita junto a ella, labora como gerente de la empresa Vogue de Nueva Guinea donde vende cosmeticos, esta solicitando su primer credto a la institucion de AFODENIC para realizar mejoras a su vivienda construyendo una tapia y embaldozado de vivienda, lo que le permitira darle mayor seguridad y mejores condiciones a su casa.  Tiene buenas referencias comerciales con otras instuciones financieras, ademas se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, con alto espiritu de superacion y muy responsable.
texts.en:
Xiomara lives in District #7 of Nueva Guinea. Her sons are grown, but her only daughter is still a dependent and lives with her. Xiomara works as a manager for a company called “Vogue” in Nueva Guinea, where she sells cosmetics.

She is requesting her first loan from AFODENIC and will use the funds to make improvements to her home. She plans to construct a wall and install a tile floor in her house, which will provide greater security and better living conditions. Xiomara has good references from other financial institutions. She is known for being a hardworking woman, who is very responsible and determined to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall & install a tile floor

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa S. is from the village of Napilan, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental.  She is 57 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Luisa maintains a corn farm. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from her corn production. Luisa has been engaged in her business for 8 years and earns approximately 16,000 PHP per cropping cycle (about 4 months) for these activities.

In 2006, Luisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC.  Luisa is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to finance her corn production. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Luisa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her farm. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for corn production

loans.name: Rialen

texts.en:
Rialen J. is from the village of Purok 13 Poblacion, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is thirty-six years old. Rialen is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rialen owns and operates a specialized retail store in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegetables, fruits, and spices in the local community. Rialen has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rialen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rialen is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Rialen's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income and to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kigo Nakijoba Alice Group

texts.en:
N. Alice is a businesswoman, thirty-three years old, who is a single woman with five children all going to school. She deals in stone quarrying and she has been in the business for over twenty years.

Alice is using the loan to pay wages in her stone-quarrying business. The loan is improving her business as well improving her family welfare. She is so encouraging and her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To pay wages in her stone-quarrying business

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: El cliente es originario del municipio de Cinco Pinos, el crédito será destinado para mejorar su vivienda, compra de zinc, bolsas de cementos y ladrillos, asi vivir dignamente en su casa. Agradece mucho ya que le ha servido para que su familia tenga un techo donde vivir. Ha pagado en tiempo y forma sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The client is from the Cinco Pinos municipality. The loan is to make improvements on his house. He will buy zinc, bags of cement, and bricks. That way he will live decently in his house. He is very grateful because the loan has served to give his family a roof over their heads. He has paid on time and as agreed upon.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Alejandro Ramón

texts.es: El señor Alejandro Ramón A. D. es trabajador de  la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como Operario de limpieza, es acompañado y tiene cuatro hijos, pero solo uno depende de el los demás viven con el pero trabajan por cuenta propia, su esposa también trabaja para la Alcaldía de Chinandega es operaria de limpieza ambos luchan por mantener un trabajo digno y darle lo mejora a sus hijos por eso se ayudan con el financiamiento de CEPRODEL  para ir mejorando su casa poco a poco.
texts.en:
Alejandro Ramón works as a custodian in the Chinandega city hall. He is married and has four children, but only one still depends on him for support. The others live with him, but work and support themselves. His wife also works for the city call as a cleaning woman. Both strive to maintain dignified employment and provide a better life for their children. They have requested this loan trough CEPRODEL in order to be able to make improvements to their home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Aldrin

texts.en:
Aldrin V. is from the village of Mohon, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. He is 39 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Aldrin owns and operates a business providing motorcycle habal-habal services to local community members (a habal-habal is a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers). He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Aldrin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Aldrin is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for his business. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto, de 56 años, es soltero y tiene cinco hijos. Vive en una localidad ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana del Perú, donde tiene su casa que es propia .En la actualidad la localidad donde vive, se encuentra en  pleno auge económico, es por esta razón que encontró un buen mercado para comercializar, para cubrir sus necesidades insatisfechas, y empezó a producir  cacao desde muy joven. En la actualidad siembra  dos productos mas que son el café y la hoja de de coca.Modesto siempre ha sido consecuente con sus objetivos trazados, aunque tuvo que pasar por muchas dificultades , jamás  se amilanó y así aprendió buenas lecciones en la vida. Su horario de trabajo empieza a  partir de las 7 de la mañana  hasta las 6 de la tarde ; y por lo general  trabaja solo , pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia. Aunque los años pasan, él sigue  con esas mismas fuerzas, desde su juventud, es por esta razón que en el futuro desea  vender  sus productos en otras comunidades para minimizar el tiempo y costo de traslado de sus productos.Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, y se  compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos puntualmente , además trabaja en armonía junto a su grupo comunal, por el apoyo incondicional que lo otorgan.Tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  productos finales de cacao, y café,  a otros productores, con el propósito de mejorar su margen de utilidad.
texts.en:
Modesto, 56, is single and has five children. They live in their home located in Peru’s beautiful Ayacucho backcountry. The area where he lives in is currently undergoing an economic boom, so he finds a good market for sales there that will make it possible for him to cover his unmet needs. He started farming cocoa beans as a young man. He currently farms two additional products: coffee and coca leaves. Modesto has always been conscientious about his set objectives although he did go through some tough times. However, he didn’t become discouraged and learned good life lessons. His work schedule starts at 7am and continues until 6pm. He usually works alone but sometimes gets help from his family. As years go by he continues with the same strength as when he was young and would like to sell his products in other communities in the future in order to reduce the time spent and the costs of transporting his products. This is his 4th loan with MFP and he pledges to repay in a timely fashion. Besides, he works harmoniously with his fellow communal bank members and appreciates the mutual support they provide. He will use the funds to buy harvested cocoa beans and coffee as well as other products in order to improve his profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cocoa beans and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: H. Philomène est mariée à ZANNOUGBO Hervé, un mécanicien. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille s’est installée depuis cinq ans au quartier Agbalilamè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Philomène aide son mari à subvenir aux divers besoins de sa famille. Philomène n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Philomène vend des fagots de bois de chauffage à son domicile, ce qui lui permet de se faire de revenu l’aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Philomène s’approvisionne à Pahou, au Bénin. Philomène a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui avait permis de rehausser un peu le niveau de son activité. Philomène sollicite un deuxième prêt, pour agrandir davantage son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Philomène H. is married to Hervé ZANNOUGBO, a mechanic. They have two children, both in school. The family settled five years ago in the Agbalilamè borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Philomène helps her husband deal with the family’s various needs. Philomène has not attended school. She sells bundles of firewood from her home, which generates revenue that helps her meet the needs of her family. She gets her supplies from Pahou, in Benin. Philomène has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which enabled her to increase somewhat her level of activity. She is now requesting a second loan, to further expand her activity and increase customer satisfaction.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood

loans.name: Zindzy

texts.en:
Zindzy has been operating her open air food stall for one year. She is married to a businessman, and has three children:  two boys and a girl and they all attend school. With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to buy a sack of beans, cooking oil, Irish potatoes and baking flour.

Zindzy sells from home to her neighbors and passersby, citing competition as her major challenge in the business. She hopes to run a big restaurant in future. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, electricity and food. Zindzy decided to work with Yehu to get a loan and improve her living standards. She owns a house with electricity but no piped water.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, Irish potatoes,cooking oil and baking flour.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth S. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old. Janeth is married and has four school-aged children. Janeth owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Janeth has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Janeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 11,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital.

Janeth is now requesting her fourth loan from HSPFI, for 14,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity has been farming for the last 20 years in Nkubu town in Eastern Kenya. She has employed one farm-hand. She sells her coffee, bananas and milk to the local market.

Charity is 50 years old. She is a widowed mother of 7 children between the ages of 15 and 32. Her youngest child is still attending school.

Charity recently completed her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES.30,000 and has requested this loan of KES.60,000 to expand her poultry project. She says that the extra income from this loan will help in educating her child and grandchildren in school.

Her major challenge has been insufficient funds to expand her activities, and pest and diseases which attack her crops and animals.

She says that Juhudi Kilimo loans are flexible in terms of repayment, since they give grace periods during the loan term.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom S. A. is a married mother caring for two kids. Both of them attend the local school and are dependent on her income. Her husband is a professional teacher who teaches the secondary class. 

To earn a living, Mom S. A. sells fish paste that she buys in bulk from her supplier. She also buys fresh fish and turns them into fish paste.

Mom S. A. is concerned that her current business has come to a low capacity due to insufficient financial capital. She wishes to have more money to increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits. This is why she has decided to ask for a Kiva loan. (Mrs. Mom S.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro tiene 54 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el caserío San Francisco, una zona rural del distrito D. Chulucanas, un distrito agrícola que pertenece a la provincia D. Morropón, D. encuentra situado en la región Piura, a mas D. tres horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta D. ovejas, ella cuenta con un rebaño D. ovejas que cría alimentándolas D. pastos naturales en un corral situado cerca a su vivienda. Cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donD. vive. Con los ingresos que percibe D. esta actividad ayuda a su esposo a solventar los gastos económicos familiares.

Socorro desD. realizar algunos arreglos en los corrales, asimismo desea adquirir alimento balanceado para hacer que sus ovejas se desarrollen D. mejor manera y poder percibir mayores ingresos al momento D. venderlas. Para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer entregada a su familia y a u trabajo, sus dias transcurren en el cuidado D. su hogar y en D. sus animales. En la zona donD. vive sus vecinos la consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Socorro, age 54, is married and lives with her husband in the San Francisco settlement. It is a rural area in the Chulucanas district, which is an agricultural district belonging to the Morropón province. It is situated in the Piura region at over three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She raises and sells sheep. She has a flock of sheep that she raises by feeding them natural grasses in corrals close to her house. When they have achieved a good level of development, she sells them to the businessmen who always visit the area where she lives. The income that she gets from this activity helps her husband pay the family’s expenses. Socorro wants to make some repairs to the corrals. She also wants to get balanced feed in order to have her sheep develop in a better way. This is so that she will be able to get greater earnings when it is time to sell them. In order to do this she believes it is advisable to request, for the first time, a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 soles. She is a woman who is devoted to her family and her work. Her days pass by taking care of her home and her animals. In the area where she lives her neighbors consider her to be a level-headed and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy balanced feed and repair corrals in order to improve the way she raises sheep to sell

loans.name: Rasheedan

texts.en:
Rasheedan, a 56-year-old resident of Riwind for the last 25 years, is married to 60-year-old K. M.. A very hardworking lady, she has operated a milk-selling business for over 20 years. At her home Rasheedan has two buffalo whose milk she sells to her neighboring customers. She gets approximately 16 kilograms of milk from her buffalo, selling each kilogram for 45 PKRs, thereby earning approximately 720 PKRs each day. Her income is a major source of financial support for her family.

Her husband is involved in an animal-selling business, purchasing them at an early age, raising and then selling them for a good profit. He has operated this enterprise for the last 15 years.

Rasheedan has given birth to three sons and one daughter. Her eldest and youngest sons help her in getting milk from the buffalo, while her middle son works in a factory. Her daughter, 17, stays at home and manages the household chores.

Rasheedan is requesting a loan from Asasah to buy another buffalo and expand her milk-selling business. She feels that she can serve a larger number of clients by purchasing another buffalo and increasing milk productivity.

A regular user of Asasah, this will be her sixth loan. In previous loans, she has proven herself to be a responsible client who never misses a single meeting and pays her installments on time. Note: She is with her elder son in this photo.

loans.use: To purchase another buffalo for her milk-selling business

loans.name: Ket

texts.en: Mr. Ket M. is an old man whose wife appears in the photograph. Ket M., age 50, owns and operates a handicraft business whose main activity is making and selling furniture. He sells beds and rattan cupboards that he and his wife produce or that he orders from other makers who live in the village. He uses his horse cart as transportation and it takes a week to sell all his products. Mr. Ket M. is taking out his first loan in order to mend his old house that breaks down frequently.

loans.use: To mend his old house that breaks down frequently.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan Asimwe is 51 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has 7 children. Three of his children are currently in school. Nathan has a business of a retail shop, which he has had for over 10 years. He has rental houses as well.

To help expand his business, Nathan has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items like sugar. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Nathan hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Nathan hopes to own a bigger wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more items like sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old Lebanese man living with his parents and one brother. He is engaged to a girl from his town, and they are planning to get married soon. Despite his young age, he has opened a barber shop in his town after getting the needed experience of seven years working in another local barber shop. Always presenting new styles to his clients, he works hard to earn a good income in preparation for his coming married life.

Today, he is requesting a loan of 1200 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to add new décor to his shop to attract new customers. In the future, he hopes to open a new branch and build a good reputation in his field.

loans.use: To add new décor to his shop to attract new customers

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a resident of Gujranwala, which is a big industrial city in Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house in the area named Veniawala and lives in it with her family.  She is an active lady who carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and takes care of her children. She is married to A. who has a grocery store business. 

She is the mother of three sons. Her first two sons are involved in different businesses. Her eldest son has a welding shop and the next oldest is running a computer hardware shop through which he sells computer parts. Her youngest son is 18 years old and stays at home because he is currently jobless. 

Razia has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her elder son’s welding business. He will invest the loan in the purchase of another welding machine that will help him do his work better and produce quality work. Razia is hopeful that, after this investment, her son will be able to improve his business, resulting in financial stability for the family. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah. In the photo, Razia is the lady who has a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands.

loans.use: To buy another welding machine for her son's welding business

loans.name: Aldrin

texts.en:
Aldrin V. is from the village of Mohon, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. He is 40 years old. Aldrin is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Aldrin owns & operates transportation services.  Aldrin has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Aldrin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aldrin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for his business. Aldrin is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Aldrin from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Blanca Oliva

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca M. es socia del banco comunal Nuevas Amigas, vive por el sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por su belleza arquitectónica de su centro histórico, su cultura y tradición, también cuenta con varios lugares turísticos  los que se pueden visitar.

La señora Blanca tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 20,18 y 17 años de edad,los tres estudian en la Univercidad. Su esposo se encuentra fuera del país, ha migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo para brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro. Con el esfuerzo conyugal han construido su casa propia.
 
Doña Blanca trabaja desde su casa atendiendo una tienda la que tiene hace 10 años, labora desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 y media de la tarde, como pasa en su casa aprovecha y  se dedica a la cría de animales como: cuyes y ganado, también siembra en sus tierras verduras y hortalizas las que son para su consumo y también el sobrante lo vende.
 
Se encuentra 9 años formando parte del  banco comunal, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en su tienda comprando más productos para la misma. Su meta es  comprarse un vehículo.
texts.en:
Blanca M. is a member of the 'Nuevas Amigas' (New Friends) community bank.  She lives in Monay district, in the city of Cuenca.  This city is noted for the architectural beauty of its historic center, its culture and its tradition.   It also has a number of tourist sites that people visit.

Blanca is 42 years old.  She is married and has 3 children aged 20, 18 and 17.  Her three children are studying at university.  Blanca's husband is out of the country.  He migrated in search of a better job so that he could provide his children with a better future.  Through their joint effort they have built their own home.

Blanca works from home, serving in a store that she has had for 10 years.  She works from 6.00am to 6.30pm.  As she is working from home, she takes advantage and raises animals such as guinea pigs and livestock.  She also grows greens and vegetables on her land which are primarily for her family's consumption, though she sells what is left over.

Blanca has been a member of her community bank for 9 years.  Her new loan will be invested in her store, buying more products for it.  Her goal is to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: To buy food and convenience store items

loans.name: Cristo Y Nuestro Esfuerzo 1, 4, 8 Group

texts.en:
Junette is the coordinator of her group, Cristo y nuestro esfuerzo 1, 4, 8 (Christ and our effort). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is saving enough money to buy a house.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying her business.

Junette is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for three years, starting with a loan she took from a friend. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying shoes, clothes and cosmetics products to sell. She will save the profits, because through this business she wants to make her dreams come true, especially to have her own house. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to improve her business and learn more about how to run a business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and irregular electricity.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes and cosmetics products to sell

loans.name: Bertha Rufina

texts.es:
La Señora. Bertha A. es socia del banco comunal Buscando el Éxito, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su cultura y tradiciones, la belleza de esta ciudad cautiva a propios y extraños, cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es muy amable y cordial quienes mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Nuestra socia tiene 53 años, es soltera y tiene 5 hijos, todos son mayores de edad, casados y viven  independientes. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Bertha se dedica a la venta de comida en un mercado de la ciudad, esta actividad la realiza hace 24 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde, cuenta con un puesto propio.
 
Se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 5 años y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su negocio y vajilla. Su meta crecer mucho más en su negocio.
texts.en: Mrs. Bertha A. is a member of the Buscando el Exito ["Searching for Success"] community bank. She lives in the city of Cusco, known for its culture and traditions. The beauty of this city captivates natives and strangers alike; it has a large variety of gastronomy, and its people are very friendly and polite and they maintain their culture and traditions. Bertha is 53, single and has 5 children who are all grown, married and live independently. She does not have her own home because she rents. Bertha sells food in a market in the city. She has been doing this for 24 years and works every day of the week from 10 am to 3 pm. She has her own stall. She has been a member of the community bank for 5 years and she likes it because she has very good friends there. She will invest her loan in the purchase of supplies for her business and dishes. Her goal is for her business to grow much more.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and dishes

loans.name: Maritza Del Rosario

texts.es:
Doña Rosario S., trabaja en Mercado Iván Montenegro desde hace 8 años en donde desempeña el cargo de Supervisora de Higiene.
Es casada con 4 personas a cargo 2 de ellos en edad escolar.
Ha pagado 9 créditos en CEPRODEL de forma puntual, los que ha invertido en la mejora de su vivienda y en gastos escolares para la preparación de sus hijos. Este crédito lo solicita para la mejora de vivienda y cubrir gastos escolares del año 2011.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosario S. has worked in the Iván Montenegro Market for 8 years as the Hygiene Supervisor.
She is married with 4 people to care for, two of whom are school-aged.
She has paid 9 CEPRODEL loans punctually. She invested them in home improvements and school fees for her children. She is requesting this loan for improving her home and covering the 2011 school fees.

loans.use: home improvements and 2011 school fees

loans.name: Milo's Group

texts.en:
Milo P. is from the village of Brgy. Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. He is 46 years old. Milo is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Milo is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Milo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Milo has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Milo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Milo is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Milo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Anyela Del Carmen

texts.es: Anyela Del Carmen tiene 34 años, por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella ofrece una variedad de productos, como la venta de granos básicos que es muy solicitada, golosinas, refrescos naturales, granos básicos, verduras, medicinas y detergentes. Es una persona muy alegre y trabajadora por lo que vive muy feliz con su negocio a pesar de ganar mucho con este negocio le proporciona lo necesario para mantenerse a ella y la familia. Ella solicita urgentemente para comprar la materia prima necesaria para mantener a sus clientes. Su deseo es mantener siempre su record crediticio porque sin él no podría avanzar con su negocio.
texts.en: Anyela is 34 years old and has made a living running a convenience store for the past 16 years. She offers a variety of products such as basic grains, which are in high demand, snacks, natural refreshments, vegetables, medicines and detergents. She is a very happy and hard-working person and is very satisfied with her business since she makes a lot and can provide what's necessary to support herself and her family. She is urgently requesting a loan to purchase merchandise so she can keep her customers. Her desire is to always have a good credit record because without it she would not be able to move forward her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina H. is a 26-year-old single lady who has been operating a retail shop in Takaye, Malindi for the last nine years. Out of this business Elvina earns a monthly income of about $188.

She has applied for a 3rd loan, after successfully paying her previous loans well and in good time. She intends to use the loan to add more stock to her retail shop, such as food stuff, soft drinks, cooking oil, toothpaste and many other commodities. She also wants to renovate the business premises with a view of growing her business so as to serve more customers from her place of work.

Elvina hopes to plow her anticipated profits back into the business, and in the future to buy a piece of land to set up a larger shop.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to sell and to renovate her shop.

loans.name: Mary Wanjiku

texts.en: Mary has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 40 years. She is 61 years old, married to Joseph K. and they have three children. She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time, and she plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Mary hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Sokna

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokna A. (pictured with her loom) and her husband, Mr. Savoeurn Pork, have been married since 2006 and have one young son. The family lives in a village along the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sokna and her husband are silk weavers. The couple asked for a Kiva loan several times; they hope to continue their silk-weaving business because it is a traditional profession. So Sokna is asking for another loan in the amount of $600 to purchase weaving materials (raw silk).

loans.use: to purchase raw silk materials for her silk weaving business

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz D. is 59 years old and lives in Samtredia, Imereti Region, together with his family – his wife and his 31-year-old son. His wife Darejan works as a nurse in a local medical institution and earns 200 Laris per month. 

Revaz is heading the agricultural business of the family and gets average monthly income of 400 Laris. He has a small pig farm consisting of two pigs and 17 piglets. He sells the piglets locally. He also runs small poultry farm and sells approximately 3,600 chickens annually. Revaz grows maize on his own land with an area of 1 ha - the whole harvest of maize is used in his farm.

With the requested loan, Revaz plans to purchase 1500 chickens, which will be sold after a month with approximately 200% price mark-up.

With the increase in income, Revaz plans to expand the building of the poultry farm, so he will be able to expand the scale of the business – raise more chickens.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Katia Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Katia es socia del banco comunal Madres Coraje del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada tiene 4 hijos pero solo 2 de ellos siguen a su cargo.
Se dedica a la venta de verduras de la región en un mercado de la zona, trabaja desde las primeras horas de la mañana hasta las 11:00 am., hora en la que regresa a su casa para poder atender a sus hijos y a su esposo.

Lleva 4 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos que le han servido para seguir trabajando y de esa forma contribuir con los gastos de su hogar, su esposo trabaja haciendo taxi en su motocar (transportista).
Con éste préstamo de S/. 1,200 nuevos soles comprará: 1 ciento de limones pequeños, 1 ciento de ají dulce, 20 atados de culantro de la región, 5 atados de sacha culantro, 5 kilos de ají charapita .
Con el negocio que tiene puede dar a sus hijos un poco mas de comodidad y todas las facilidades para que vayan a estudiar sin que les pudiera faltar nada.
texts.en:
Katia is a member of the 'Madres Coraje' (Mothers Courage) community bank which is located in Yarinacocha district, in Ucayali department.  She is 39 years old, married, and has four children (only two of whom are still in her care).  Katia sells regional vegetables in a local market.  She works from the very first hours of the day until 11.00am when she returns home to look after her children and her husband.

Katia has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for four years.  They have helped her to keep working and contributing to her household expenses.  Her husband offers a taxi service in his car.

Katia will use this loan for 1,200 Peruvian soles to buy 100 small lemons, 100 sweet peppers, 20 bunches of local culantro (a herb), 5 bunches of sacha culantro and 5 kilos of chili peppers.

Thanks to her business, Katia is able to provide her children with a little more comfort and the opportunity to go to school without lacking anything.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and citrus fruit

loans.name: Iona

texts.en:
Iona, who is married, sells clothing at an open market in the town of Novomoskovsk. Good location and affordable prices attract many customers, earning her a net monthly profit of 6,000 Grivnas. Iona has been in the clothing sales business for 11 years but took a break a few years ago to care for her baby daughter. When her daughter turned two years old, Iona decided to return to her business.

Iona is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnas to purchase swimming shorts and socks for the coming summer season. This business is the only source of income for Iona’s family.

loans.use: to purchase swimming shorts and socks to sell.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is 26 years old, married and has one child. She has been in business for over three years.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. She plans to buy more stock and fertilizer.  She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to invest in farming.

She is a very hardworking woman who runs a hotel in Narok town. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Vidalicia

texts.es:
La señora María Vidalicia, es casada  con el señor Flavio y su responsabilidad tiene  una hija de nombre Ana Carina de once años, de edad.

    Ella es la primera vez que solicita el préstamo en fundación y es para comprar, productos naturales, en donde lleva  un año y dos meses  y comenta que le va bien  ya que con ello ha estado  trabajando para salir adelante teniendo un ingreso mejor en su hogar.

      En ello se inspiro ya que también quiere apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de su hogar  y juntos aportar para darle una buena educación a su única hija quien es su razón de trabajar.

     Su más grande deseo es que con esta actividad y el préstamo que solicito pueda trabajar comprando más productos y su negocio crezca dio con día.
texts.en:
María Vidalicia is married to Flavio and has one eleven year-old daughter, Ana Carina, in her care.

This is the first time she requests a loan from the foundation.  It is to buy natural products, which she has been selling for one year and two months.  She comments that things are going well for her, since she has been working to get ahead and generate additional income for the household.

She was inspired by her desire to support her husband with the household expenses.  Together, they want to provide a good education for their only daughter, who is the reason they work hard.  Her greatest wish is that, through her business and the loan she requested, she can buy more products and make her enterprise grow each and every day.

loans.use: buy natural products.

loans.name: Leobarda

texts.es: La señora Leobarda es una persona muy trabajadora que desea salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Hace unos meses inicio su propio negocio de abarrotes en la casa de su hija porque no hay tiendas cercas a los alrededores. El negocio se le denomino como “Abarrotes Lizy” donde ofrece variedad de producto como lo es refrescos, botanas, lácteos y mas, en este momento se ve en la necesidad de comprar mayor mercancía que no tiene en su local que su clientes le solicitan y por falta de eso no quiere perderlos, de esta manera seguirá generando mayor ingresos.
texts.en: Senora Leobarda is a hard working person who wants to improve her quality of life, and help her husband with their household expenses.  A few months ago she opened a small general store in her daughter's house, since there were few shops nearby.  She calls her shop "Abarrotes Lizzy", which translates into Lizzy's General Store.   She sells a variety of items including fruit drinks, snacks, dairy products, rice, sugar, beans, etc.  Right now she needs to purchase more items that her customers are requesting, as she doesn't want to lose business.  With this investment she can continue to grow her income.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her small store

loans.name: Estrellas De Fatima Group

texts.es: La Sra. Hermelinda  es casada, tiene 2 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Estrellas  D. Fátima” grupo  conformado por 12 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Hermelinda  trabaja desD. hace   4 años en la venta D. Gaseosa y cerveza en su domicilio este negocio surge a raíz D. que sus hijos empiezan la universidad ya que con el sueldo D. su esposo solo cubre los gastos básicos alimentación, pago D. servicios agua, luz, teléfono, a su vez Hermelinda también venD. semillas D. plantas, Hermelinda nos cuenta que nada fue fácil tuvo que trabajar muy duro para poder salir adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y dediacion ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos,  sus hijos van a la universidad , y sobre todo su familia cuenta con una  mejor calidad D. vida, con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería gaseosa, cerveza. Sabemos que Hermelinda cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Hermelinda is married and she has 2 children. She is a member of the communal bank "Estrellas D. Fatima", meaning "The Stars of Fatima". The group is maD. up of 12 members and they all have different business activities. Hermelinda has been selling soft drinks and beer for the past 4 years from her home. This business was started out because her two children are starting university and her husband's wages are enough only to cover the basic expenses: food, water, electricity, and telephone. Additionally Hermelinda also sells seeds. Hermelinda tells us that it was not at all easy, that she had to work hard to move forward. It was thanks to her efforts and dedication that she has been able to improve her income. Her children are in university.  Over all the family enjoys a better quality of life. With the goal of continued growth she requests a new loan to purchase soft drinks and beer. We know that Hermelinda will meet her goals through hard work and effort, and loans from Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner) will help her do that.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Bautista

texts.en:
Bautista is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 3 children.  Bautista has a tailoring shop that provides repair & sewing of uniforms & dresses. She has had this business for 26 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.
Bautista has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Bautista hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 33 years old and is single. He has owned a small boutique business selling spare parts for the past two years. His business is well organized and he works daily from 7am until 8pm every day. 

Jean de Dieu has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing more spare parts for resale. With the profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future, and he will be able to build a house for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a resident and a farmer in Kisii, South Rift, Kenya, where he lives with his family of five children aged between 12 and below 2 years. Joseph runs a hotel in the local market. His farm produces maize, milk, beans and potatoes.

Joseph has made a request for a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow and construct a dairy unit. He says the income will enable him to educate his children and further expand his farming business. He wants to run a wholesale shop in the local market.

Joseph is concerned with the high running costs of animal diseases and poor infrastructure.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children. Two attend school while two are still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past nine years, she has operated a street food-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During rainy season it becomes difficult to operate her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, rice, beans and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, rice, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Unión Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN” iniciará su sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Faustina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de batidos, venta de ropa, venta de verduras, venta de periódicos, venta de carne, confección de deportivos.

La señora Faustina,  indica que este es el sexto año que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por recomendación de su sobrina. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de batidos que viene trabajando desde hace seis años, el que aprendió de su hija.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de azucar y bicervecina), que comprara de las ferias y lo venderá en los colegios. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la salud, el crédito y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Union" is starting its 6th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, in the Santiago II central office.  This group has 8 members and is led by a board of directors headed by Faustina.  The members of this communal bank have a variety of businesses such as the sale of: milkshakes, clothing, vegetables, newspapers, meat and also the production of sportswear. 

Faustina states that this is her 6th year working with Pro Mujer, which she joined at the recommendation of her niece.  Now she has had a milk shake business for 6 years, a business that she learned from her daughter.

The loan that she will take now will be used to increase her capital to purchase sugar and bicervecina (a non-alcoholic malt beverage.)  She will buy these products in the market, and she will sell her milkshakes at the schools.  This type of work allows her to generate resource so that she can support her family as best she can.  She is married and has 4 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the health care services, the loans and the savings accounts.

loans.use: to buy sugar and "bicervecina"

loans.name: Leonor Katherine

texts.es:
Leonor de 33 años, es una mujer trabajadora que es vendedora de perfumes.  Hace algún tiempo atrás había dejado la actividad del comercio porque su hija estaba enferman pero la retomo en la actualidad para mejorar sus ingresos. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere mejorar  sus ingresos con un préstamo ya que lo utilizara para comprar cosméticos, perfumes para la venta ambulante y a conocidos.  En el futuro quiere que sus 6 hijos tengan todos los recursos para una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Leonor, age 33, is a hardworking woman who sells perfume. A little while ago she had to leave the industry because her daughter was ill, but is returning now to increase her income. 

She has many dreams for her business, which is why she wants to improve her income with a loan. She will use it to buy cosmetics and perfumes, which she sells as a street vendor and also to acquaintances. In the future she wants her six children to have all the resources for a better life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 57-year-old mother of two children who failed to complete their education due to early marriages. However, Aida continues working to help her grandchildren in their studies. Currently engaged in buying and selling vegetables in her community, Aida tires easily at her age as she carries her produce, but the fatigue is worth it when she sells all of her goods.

Despite living alone, Aida seeks to improve her living standards and so, in order to expand her business, she is requesting a loan of P3,000 to buy onions, garlic, ginger, beans, cabbage, carrots and Chinese pechay as additional goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy onions, garlic, ginger, beans, cabbage, carrots and Chinese pechay.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia is a 64-year-old married woman. She tills a rice farm in Talibon, Bohol, where she also lives with her family. Basilia earns 5,000 PHP per month from rice farming. She plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

Basilia hopes to own a bigger farm in the future. She also wants to be able to extend help to her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Tith

texts.en:
Mrs. Tith is a diligent widow woman who comes from a low income family. Her husband passed away and left five children living with her in Ang Snoul district, Phnom Penh city. To raise her children and provide them a comfortable living, Mrs. Tith works tirelessly and tries hard from dawn to dusk working on her own farmland.
