He and his wife are sacrificing a lot just to provide a better life for their children.  

To help his wife to meet the needs of their family, Eddie decided to engaged in the hog-raising business.  At the moment, Eddie has only one hog to raise.  He is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 which he will use to buy more piglets.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El Sr Alejandro se dedica a alquilar su camioneta para tranasportar ladrillos, tejas, cemento , etc pertenece a una asociacion en el 5º anillo santos dumont. Vive en  la zona alto Santa Rita junto con su esposa son dueños de casa su esposa se dedica a la costura de ropa y tiene una pequeña hija. El credito utilizara para realizar algunas reparaciones a la movilidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Alejandro rents out his truck for transporting bricks, tiles, cement and other construction materials. He is a member of the #5 Anillo Santos Dumont Association. He lives in the Santa Rita district with his wife (who is a seamstress) and young daughter. His loan will be used to pay for repairs to his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Test We Group

texts.en:
This is Angela S., Mbalu K., Mariatu K., Mohamed K. M. and Abass K. S.. They named their group Test We. They are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo small town, twenty miles from Freetown. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo. Each of them is requesting a loan of Le 500,000.00. With this loan, they will be able to increase the sizes and qualities of their businesses and consequently make better profit and improve on their standards of living.

Angela (right) is the leader of this group. She is thirty-seven years of age and was born in a small town called Batt K. in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with four children who are attending school. Angela sells cooked rice, meat, vegetables and cold soft drinks and has been a businesswoman for over sixteen years now. With this loan, she will buy a cool-man, two bags of rice, ten gallons of palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and other cooking ingredients.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Martha Veronica

texts.es: La Joven Martha Verónica A. , tiene la edad de 21 años habita en el barrio la Francia numero uno , junto a sus padres y hermanos , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ella desde hace cuatro años se dedica a trabajos del campo , ya que su abuelo le heredo para que se defendiera por si sola , los sueños de la Joven es poder llegar a ser doctora , actualmente trabaja como auxiliar de enfermería , agradece a la institución por la aprobación del préstamo ya que el primero obtuvo resultados mejores , lo cual le permitió vender en un buen precio la piña a la vez cancelo su desembolso en tiempo y forma . Con este préstamo comprara fertilizantes para aplicar al cultivo  Se siente contenta ya que son muchos los agricultores que se benefician con estos programas dirigidos al sector agrícola.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes para aplicar al cultivo

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela is a 34-year-old borrower who lives in San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. This is Daniela’s first individual loan, and fourth overall with Esperanza International. She has a perfect repayment record, and she is excited for the challenge of having a loan for which she is solely responsible.

Daniela runs a beauty salon in her neighborhood here in San Pedro, which she rents on a monthly basis. She specializes in hairstyling and coloring, and also gives manicures and pedicures. Daniela will be using her loan to purchase new hair and nail products, shampoos, creams, and perfumes. She hopes these will lead to happier customers, better business, and greater profits.

Daniela likes the detailed attention she receives from Esperanza. She has never had a problem working with her loans, and she hopes to continue borrowing in order to have a better future for her business. One day, she would like to own both her business and her home. Thank you for lending to Daniela and her beauty salon!

loans.use: To purchase hair and nail products

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.en: Senora Maria is 45 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 14 and 12. They are both in high school. For three years, she has had a restaurant in the small community of Palo Grande near the city of Chinandega. Maria has worked in El Salvador where she gained valuable work experience and with the money that she earned she opened her business. She serves three meals a day. This loan of C$10,000 will go towards structural improvements to her business. Maria Eugenia has a good credit history with Fundacíon León 2000 and is a very capable client and businesswoman.

loans.use: To make structural improvements to her business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa D., 46. is married to Arsenio D. and blessed with six children. Three are already married and three are single. They reside together at the village of Calaocan, Cabatuan, Isabela. Their house is situated near the Baranggay Health Center.

Marissa is engaged in hog-raising for almost 20 years. Every time she disposes of one hog she earns a net income of 5000 PHP. She works hard to increase her income and to strengthen her business.

Marissa decided to request a loan of 11,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to purchase hog feed and some hogs to raise. She wants to expand her pig pens to earn more income for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: To buy hog feed and some hogs to raise.

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es: Doña Julia V. mujer trabajadora desde su juventud, había deseado tener su propio negocio el cual es una pulpería que con ayuda de su única hija han salido adelante, a pesar que la crió sola. Las dificultades en su negocio que ha dado crédito y mucha gente no le han pagado y ha venido descapitalizando su fondo como poco inventario,  es por eso desea invertir en granos básicos, cosmético como: vanidades, pinturas, sombras, pintura de uña, talco, colonia, a si como productos enlatados, para preparar los alimentos. El cual espera poder vender más y seguir aumentado de clientes. Con esto que le ha pasado no dará más al crédito ya que tiene una responsabilidad con la institución de pagar mensual, a si como pagar sus gastos básicos de agua, luz, teléfono.  Su anhelo es poder hacer crecer su venta para que a futuro su hija dependa de su negocio propio. Feliz por que solo mediante el financiamiento ha podido fortalecer su negocio  y solo mediante este medio se logra la inversión a largo plazo.
texts.en:
Julia V. has been a hard-worker since her youth. She had wanted to have her own business, which is a mini market. With help from her only daughter, they have gotten ahead in spite of the fact that she raised her alone. The problem with her business is that she has given credit, and many people have not paid. She does not have adequate funding, and she has little inventory. That is why she wants to buy basic grains and cosmetics like lipstick, shadow, nail polish, powder, and cologne. She also wants to buy canned goods to prepare food. She hopes to be able to sell more and get more customers. With what has happened, she will not sell anymore on credit. She has a responsibility to the institution to make monthly payments, and she has to pay basic expenses like water, light, and telephone. Her goal is to be able to make her sales grow so that in the future her daughter can depend upon her own business. She is happy that she has been able to strengthen her business with the loan. The loan is the only way to achieve long term investment.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains like rice, beans, sugar and cosmetics and other products to increase sales through a variety of products

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es: Gloria Patricia H. D. L. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango. Vive junto a sus tres hijos menores D. edad los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Debido a la difícil situación económica su esposo decidió irse a los Estados Unidos, lugar en el cual espera encontrar un buen trabajo. Gloria posee una venta D. ropa para dama, así también zapatos para adultos y niños. Gloria solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para poder comprar ropa y zapatos al por mayor D. manera que pueda obtener precios más bajos. Esto lo hace con el fin D. poder brindar mayor cantidad D. productos D. diferentes tallas y colores y así mismo poder brindar un poco más barato su producto, D. manera que sus ventas aumenten y ella pueda seguir adelante junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria Patricia H. D. L. is thirty-five years old, she lives in the municipality of Soyapango. She lives with her three young children who are in school. Due to the difficult economic situation her husband decided to go to the United States, where he hopes to find good work. Gloria has a women's clothing shop, where she also sells shoes for adults and children. Gloria sought a loan in order to obtain the money necessary to buy clothes and shoes at wholesale prices. She does this in order to be able to proviD. a variety of sizes and colors, and she is also able to lower the price of her products in order to increase her sales and continue to do well with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Hikmat

texts.en: Hikmat is 35 years old, married, and has two children. The family lives in Baku city. He has been in this business for three years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy the necessary things for improving his carpenter business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for improving his carpenter business

loans.name: Digana Emerita

texts.es: DOÑA DIGNA ES UNA COMERCIANETE DE PESCADO DE LA ZONA DE JIQUILILLO EN CHINANDEGA  TIENE 15 AÑOS DE TENER EL ACOPIO  Y ES UNA CLIENTA QUE COMENZO CON SOLO UNA PANA VENDIENDO AMBULANTE HOY EN DIA DEBIDO AL ESFUERZO EL NEGOCIO VA EN AUMENTO  SE PUEDE OBSERVAR EN LA FOTO UN DIA NORMAL DE TRABAJO EN EL ACOPIO
texts.en:
Mrs. Digna markets fish in the Jiquilillo area of Chinandega. For 15 years she has had a fish distribution business. She is a client who started out selling bread in the streets. Now, thanks to her efforts, her business is increasing. In the photograph you can see a normal working day in her fish business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a boat motor

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita U. is a woman of many dreams and the heroism to fight challenges in order to achieve her dreams. She is 57 years old and married to George, 50, who is a fisherman.  She is a loving mother of an only child, King, who is 15 years old and a high school student. She lives in the town of Tanay, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. 

In 1996, she joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with an opportunity of having startup capital for generating income. During her previous loans from ASHI, she carefully invested it in planting vegetables and a hog raising business. Both businesses gave her a reasonable income, but it was lost due to a storm last September 2009.

Now on her third loan, she requests 15,000 PHP for the recovery of her planting business and to also start hog fattening. Specifically, the amount will be use for both businesses. This loan will help her business, which was destroyed by huge typhoons ”Ondoy” and “Santi”. 

As a mother, Nenita dreams of sending her son to school and on to completing college degrees and finding jobs for a better life. She also enjoys that the loan from ASHI will change their lives and accommodate her family's needs. Through the support of ASHI, a Kiva partner, she hopes to continue reaching for her dreams.

loans.use: For the recovery of her planting business and to start hog fattening.

loans.name: Sepha

texts.en:
G. Sepha, 45, is a state teacher in the Takeo province. He is married with five children. Two are students and three are employed as garment factory workers.

On average, G. Sepha is able to make about US$2 a day, while his wife, pictured here, sells vegetables and beef at the local market. She is able to make US$2 of profit a day as well.

Due to the high transportation costs that her children spend every day to commute to work, G. Sepha would like to purchase a motorbike for her children. This will help reduce transportation costs and allow her children to save even more.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.
